loans.name: Gladys Ender

texts.es: Gladys es socia del Bancomunal Hormigas, tiene 32 años de edad y es casada. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 1 año y es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes. A través de su trabajo con la institución Gladys ha aprendido a administrar cuidadosamente su dinero e invertirlo en su negocio, a ser responsable y a pagar puntualmente sus préstamos.  Su sueño para el futuro es de tener una cadena de tiendas y de esa manera apoyar a su familia financieramente. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, fideos, menestras, aceite, bebidas,etc.
texts.en: Gladus is a member of the Hormigas Community Bank. She is 32 years old and is married. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for one year and is the owner of a grocery shop. Through her work with the institution, Gladys has learned to manager her money carefully and invest it in her business, to be responsible and to pay her loans punctually. Her dream for the future is to have a chain of stores and, in this way, support her family financially. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of groceries for her business like rice, sugar, noodles, beans, oil, drinks, etc.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her business like rice, sugar, noodles, beans, oil, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Maritza; La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de pan, la socia lleva años ejerciendo este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio ,la socia vende de forma ambulatoria los panes ,la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.
La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como harina y manteca.
texts.en: The member is Maritza. She continues with her business buying and selling bread. For years she has been working in this business which is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it. The member sells bread on foot. She is a happy and responsible person with many wishes to continue working for her family. She is requesting the loan to buy ingredients for her business such as flour and butter.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business such as flour and butter.

loans.name: Javier

texts.en:
Javier is a skilled woodcarver who creates relief panels with religious themes. He would like to stock up on high quality raw materials.

Javier has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:

Javier strives to continue his family's carving tradition. "It is a legacy we have inherited from our ancestors. I decided to go my own way as I wanted to work on my original designs. I have always enjoyed carving! I love the look of wood, its color and natural appearance. My brother taught me how to find the detail in every little corner. I joined my family when they were commissioned to work on a screen for the Church of the Assumption in my village. It meant a lot to each one of us."

"Woodcarving is my family's legacy. When I saw how my sculptures were well received and appreciated, I felt that God has placed me on the road to continue expressing myself through my work. This experience is a blessing for me, and you are a part of it."

Use the link below to view Javier's relief panels and carvings on the NOVICA site:http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=5800

loans.use: to purchase high quality raw materials.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is an artisan who specializes in alpaca accessories including shawls, ponchos, hats and scarves. This is the time of the year when alpaca wool is readily available, and he would like to invest in large quantities so he can prepare a good stock of accessories for the upcoming high season.

Alfredo has been selling through NOVICA since 2001. This is his story:

"When I was but a small child, I learned from my parents the best weaving techniques. Like me, they had learned from their own parents. This makes us a family entirely devoted to the world of textiles, and we have been for generations. Nowadays, I combine weaving by hand with the use of classic equipment, and have a special passion for traditional Inca and colonial motifs."

"From the moment I joined NOVICA I began to grow and grow as an artisan and as a person. And not only that, my designs and my work have also improved. I've created new designs and collections thanks to the unwavering support I've received. My workshop has grown and so has the team of people I work with, which is my way of supporting the people in my community -- especially the women who provide for their families. It fills me with great pride to know that I have achieved all of this with a product that is 100% Andean. I would like to take this opportunity to thank you for considering this microcredit request. You are supporting the preservation of our culture and tradition."

Use the link below to view Alfredo's work on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=2891

loans.use: to stock up on wool ahead of the winter selling season.

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
Nem has taken a photograph together with her husband in front of their thatched house in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Nem is now 54 years old while her husband is one year older than her. Together, they have given birth to four children, one of whom started a new family and the other three children are single. Rice farming has been the primary source of income for Nem’s family. Nem cultivates rice for both their sustenance and for sale. Also, Nen has her husband, and some of her children, help in this business. Nem wants to make improvements in her business in order to satisfy her family’s living needs. She aims to become financially stable so that she will be able to provide all the basic necessities to this family.

As of now, Nem is requesting additional capital in the amount of USD 1,300, which will be used to purchase a motorcycle for home use. Also, with the remaining funds she will pay for labor costs occurred in transplanting her rice crops. She hopes to obtain the requested loan amount in order to develop her business as well as her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for home use and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a funeral services business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional materials and other supplies for her funeral services business.

Gina has been in this business for 10 years. Gina earns additional income from raising livestock.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials and other supplies for her funeral services business

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is a weaver who crafts tapestries and handbags using traditional Andean looms. He would like to invest in a professional-grade sewing machine to open up the possibility of developing new designs and finishes and expanding his business.

Walter has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

Walter continues his family's weaving legacy in the style of San Pedro de Cajas. "My father was a well-known weaver who won several national prizes, and many of his finest works ended up in Europe. I began working with him when I was 14 years old. I am a full-time weaver of tapestries. My wife also weaves and we transmit the beauty and tradition of our hometown to the rest of the world. Our tapestries emulate photographs with their delicate shading of colors. The yarn is like paint, and my hands are like a paintbrush. Now I find I need new tools to create a different line of textiles. Thank you so much for your help."

Use the link below to view Walter's tapestries and handbags on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=760

loans.use: to purchase new equipment.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
EL socio pertence al banco comunal QORI ORCCO;el socio Teofilo tiene 60 años,casado y tiene 03 hijos;el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de multiservicios ,el vende diferentes tipos de productos de libreria,regalos,ropa entre otros,el socio es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia,el socio trabaja todos los dias en su negocio desde las 09:00am hasta las 09:00pm aproximadamente,siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como chompas para su negocio.
texts.en:
Teofilo is a member of the communal bank QORI ORCCO. He is 60 years old, married, and has three children. He alternates his daily activities with his multiple service business. He sells different types of products, i.e. books, gifts, and clothing, among others. He is a happy and responsible person with lots of desire to continue working for his family. He works from approximately 9:00 am to 9:00 pm every day. This is how he helps his family to get ahead.
Teofilo is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise, such as sweaters, for his business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, such as sweaters, for his business.

loans.name: Emma Gloria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de pasto,en su negocio de teinda de abarrotes la socia vende arroz,azucar,leche y aceite y el pasto lo vende en las noches por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y ampliar el negocio de venta de pasto.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues dedicating herself to the grocery store business and also continues dedicating herself to the business of selling food. In her grocery store business, she sells rice, sugar, milk and oil and the food she sells at night. Through these businesses she is getting her children ahead. The member's dream is to expand the grocery store and food businesses. She is requesting the loan to buy products for her grocery store such as rice, sugar, milk and oil at wholesale prices.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil at wholesale.

loans.name: Clara Agripina

texts.es:
Clara Agripina tiene 40 años de edad es soltera tiene cinco hijos vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS.

Clara Agripina se dedica a la cría de animales como gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para compra de pollos, cerdos, patos.

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar mas animales para la cría. Realiza sus compras y ventas en la ciudad de Babahoyo.

El sueño de la señora es contar con salud. El desafío al que se enfrenta la señora es seguir trabajando para salir adelante.
En su tiempo libre se dedica a sus animales y a limpiar la casa.
texts.en: Clara Agripina is 40 years old. She is single and has five children. She lives in Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. It is located in the San Francisco zone. She belongs to the parish of San Juan de Pueblo Viejo. She is dedicated to farm work. Clara Agripina is dedicated to raising animals like hens and pigs. She is requesting the loan to buy chicken, pigs and ducks. With the support of the loan, she will be able to buy more animals to raise. She makes her purchases and sales in the city of Babahoyo. Her dream is to be healthy. The challenge that she faces it to keep working to get ahead. In her free time, she is dedicated to her animals and cleaning the house.

loans.use: to buy chicken, pigs and ducks.

loans.name: Yhely Hindira

texts.es: Yhely es socia del Bancomunal Hormigas, tiene 24 años de edad y es soltera. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años, es estudiante de derecho y también se dedica a la venta de ropa, las vende en la universidad y también al público en general. Su sueño para el futuro es obtener su título universitario y ser profesional. El préstamo  que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para vender y  así continuar con el éxito de su negocio.
texts.en: Yhely is a member of the communal bank Hormigas. She is twenty-four years old and single. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years. She is a law student and also sells clothing. She sells clothing at the university and also to the general public. Her dream for the future is to earn a university degree and have a professional career. She will invest the loan she is requesting by purchasing clothing to sell and thereby keep her business successful.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Matilde Lucrecia

texts.es:
Matilde, una joven mujer de 39 años, oriunda de la ciudad de Latacunga ubicada en la provincia del Cotopaxi, en la sierra centro del Ecuador, ha solicitado por primera vez un crédito en Kiva para poder comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para su negocio.

La ciudad de Latacunga está ubicada en la zona interandina el Ecuador, tiene clima templado y gracias a que se encuentra en el centro del país ha tenido un gran crecimiento económico y constructivo, que es precisamente el ámbito del negocio de Matilde. La provincia de Cotopaxi al estar atravesada por la carretera Panamericana, una vía de primer orden, es una zona de gran intercambio comercial, sobretodo de la enorme cantidad de productos agrícolas que ahí se cultivan.

Matilde tiene hace 12 años un pequeño negocio de venta de cementina en fundas; la cementina es un material de construcción que se usa para blanqueamiento y alisado de paredes. Aprendió de su padre los secretos del negocio y a pesar de tener muchas dificultades como la separación de su esposo y un inesperado gasto médico, estos años de experiencia le han servido para sustentar sola a sus 5 hijos.

Matilde una mujer con tan solo educación primaria, trabaja alrededor de 5 horas diarias en su negocio, sin contar con todo el tiempo que destina al cuidado, educación y sustento de sus hijos. Ella tiene dificultades para acceder a los bancos tradicionales, y necesita el crédito para incrementar el negocio en que ya tiene mucha experiencia, comprando una mayor cantidad de materia prima, lo cual le permitirá conseguir mayores ganancias que destinará a la educación de sus hijos y a lograr un mayor bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Matilde, a young 39 year old woman, a native of the city of Latacunga, located in the province of Cotopaxi, in the central mountains of Ecuador, has requested for the first time a loan from Kiva to be able to buy a greater quantity of raw material for her business.

The city of Latacunga is located in the inter-Andes zone of Ecuador. It has a temperate climate and, thanks to being found in the center of the country, has had a great economic and construction growth, which is precisely the scope of Matilde's work. The province of Cotopaxi, crossed by the Panamerican highway, a first order road, is an area of much commercial exchange, above all the enormous quantity of farming products that they cultivate there.

Matilde has had for twelve years a small business selling cement in cases. The cement is a construction material that is used in bleaching and straightening walls. She learned the secrets of the business from her father and despite having many difficulties like the separating from her husband and an unexpected medical expense, those years of experience have served her to support her five children on her own.

Matilde is a woman with only elementary school education. She works around five hours daily in her business, without counting the time spent caring for, educating and supporting her children. She has difficulty approaching traditional banks and needs the loan to increase the business in which she already has a lot of experience, buying a greater quantity of raw material which will allow her to get greater earnings that are destined for the education of her children and to achieve a better wellbeing for her family.

loans.use: to buy cement for her business.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,la socia vende en el mercado y tambien la socia sigue teniendo una tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de comida y negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo,carne y verduras y tambien comprar productos para implementar la tienda de abarrotes como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite al por mayor.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Antonia continues to sell food in the market, and in her corner store she sells basics such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil. She works from 8 am to 10 pm. With income from these two small businesses, she helps her children get ahead. Her dream is to grow her market and store businesses.

Antonia is seeking a loan to buy ingredients for cooking such as chicken, meat, and vegetables, as well as stock for her store such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil at wholesale prices.

She is grateful for this loan and promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as chicken, meat, and vegetables, and stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Kabibi

texts.en:
Kabibi lives in the coastal town of Mariakani, Kenya. She is married and has three children. She owns a food café which has been in operation for three years. From this café, Josephine sells tea, cooked cereals and bread. Kabibi began the business from her savings.

Kabibi was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined in order to access credit for her business. She is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase more tables and chairs for the café. 

Kabibi’s aspiration is to own a fully stocked restaurant in the near future and the additional income will help her expand her menu by offering different varieties of food.

loans.use: To purchase more tables and chairs for the café.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 55 years old and married with three children.

Judith works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business doing direct sales of Avon in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Judith has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct selling of Avon for seven years and also earns an income from raising pigs and farming sugarcane.

Judith aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Lorgen

texts.en:
Lorgen is 46 years old, married, with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lorgen has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Lorgen requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

Lorgen has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lorgen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 36 years old, married, with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Maribel has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts for maintenance.

Maribel has been in this business for one year. In the future, Maribel would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for maintenance.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 48 years old, married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marilyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her five children. She is married and has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines.

Helen has requested a 4100 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses. Helen is aware that by using the solar lamp, she will not only be saving money but also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old and married with three children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and paid for 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from charcoal retail, pig fattening, motorcycle transport and farming rice.

Josephine aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: C18539 Urukundo Group

texts.en:
Sylvie is 41 years old and is married with three children aged between 11 and 13 years old and she takes care of one relative who is 10 years old. She sells various goods such as bananas, beans, potatoes, maize, etc. Vestine is a leader of this group, which is called "C18539 URUKUNDO" in the local language, which means in English "LOVE". In the photo, she's the one who is in front of the others. She works from 7 a.m to 10 p.m daily except on Sunday. Sylvie has 17 years of experience in this work and she currently employs one person to help her. 

Sylvie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various food such as beans, potatoes, bananas, etc. for re-sale. With any profits, she will be able to save money for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy various food such as beans, potatoes, bananas, maize, etc. for re-sale.

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmela ella es soltera y tiene 40 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de librería, ella vende artículos de escritorio y también vende útiles escolares como lápices, cuadernos, libros entre otros utiles, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de librería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar libros, cuadernos, lapiceros, libros y borradores.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, negocio de venta de desayunos, negocio de restaurant y negocio de venta de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This is the “SANTO DOMINGO” communal bank group. This group is located in the district of Urubamba, in the Urubamba province and the Cusco department.

Carmela is 40 years old. She is single and has two children. She works at her book store. She sells writing implements, as well as school supplies such as pencils, notebooks, and books, among other items. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. Through her business she has been able to help her children get ahead. Her dream is to expand her book store. She is requesting the loan to purchase books, notebooks, mechanical pencils, and erasers.
The other members of the group sell beauty products, breakfast items, restaurant goods, and food.

Carmela is grateful to everyone who helps her achieve her dreams through the communal bank. She promises to make her loan payments on schedule.

loans.use: to purchase books, notebooks, mechanical pencils, and erasers.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 36 years old and married with four children. All her children are in school, so Melba works very hard to provide for them.

Melba runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more stock for her store. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, soap, sugar and toothpaste. 

In the future Melba would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her general store

loans.name: Nermilyn

texts.en:
Nermilyn is 25 years old and married with one child.  

Nermilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Nermilyn has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, toothpaste, soap, canned goods, spices, etc.. 

In the future Nermilyn  would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is 51 years old and married with 10 children. With two children in school, Purita works very hard to provide for them.

Purita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Purita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, egg, spices, sugar, etc.. 

In the future Purita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica is 36 years old and married with four children.

Rica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Rica has borrowed and paid for nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Rica aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 63 years old and married with five children.

Estelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Estelita has borrowed and paid for 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 42 years and also earns an income from a barbershop.

Estelita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Luz Mariana

texts.es:
LUZ MARIANA tiene 53 años es casada, tiene 10 hijos Vive con su esposa e hijos en la ciudad de Montalvo Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC 3 cruces esta ventanilla se dedica al cultivo de cacao, naranja y maíz.

LUZ MARIANA se dedica a la siembra de cacao. Solicita el crédito para compra de urea, insecticidas, fertilizantes, líquido para la maleza.

Con el apoyo del crédito piensa comprar los fertilizantes que tanta falta le hace.

Realiza sus compras y ventas en la ciudad de Montalvo cada semana.
El sueño de la señora es comprar un carro.
El desafío al que se enfrenta es las plagas en los cultivos.
En su tiempo libre trabaja y sale a pasear.
texts.en:
Luz Mariana is 53 years old and married.  She has ten children and lives with her husband and children in the city of Montalvo in the province of Los Rios.  

She is a member of the solidarity group "Three Crosses".  This group works in the cultivation of cacao, oranges and corn.  

Luz Mariana grows cacao.  She is requesting this loan to buy urea, insecticides, fertilizers and weed killers.  With the help of the loan she plans to buy the fertilizers that she needs very much.  She completes her purchases in the city of Montalvo each week.

Her dream is to buy a car.  Her challenge is the pests on the crops.  

In her free time she works and goes out to walk.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticides, fertilizers, and weed killer.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem is a hard-working mother who is engaged in a grocery selling business to generate income. She sells soft drinks, chocolates, sweets, shampoos, canned goods, and spices to serve people around her community. She is thankful to her customers who are buying and using her products, this allows her to provide enough food for the family and pay tuition fees for her children. Hem has been in this business for four years and earns approximately USD 3.50 per day on average. She is now 54 years old and has three children.

Hem aims to improve her selling business and increase her merchandise to satisfy her customers. That’s why she is asking for an additional capital of USD 700 to purchase noodles, cooking oil, detergent soap, biscuits, and beauty products to sell in her store. She believes that the loan will help them to improve the business well. With the profit she will earn, Hem will continue supporting the education of her children because she wants them to become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, cooking oil, detergent soap, biscuits, and beauty products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 43 years old and married with two children.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Gina has borrowed and paid for three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.

Gina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Melda

texts.en:
Melda is 37 years old and married with three children.

Melda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail and nipa (woven palm mats) business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Melda has borrowed and paid for 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal retail and nipa (woven palm mats) business for six years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Melda aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Candida works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Candida is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Candida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Sofanor Gustavo

texts.es: Sofanor cuando recibió su anterior credikiva compró una estufa, maíz, aceite pollo carne frutos e insumos con los cuales elaboró pasabocas fritos con sus respectivos refrescos y ganó un poco mas de dinero de lo acostumbrado, porque incrementó su capital de trabajo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva,  con el que comprará implementos como calderos, cucharones y molinos, además comprará víveres para volver a invertir en materias primas en mayor volumen y una gran proporción en refrescos. Con esta inversión aumentará su cartera de clientes y también sus ventas, lo cual lo pone contento porque repuntan sus ingresos. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Muchas gracias por su apoyo tuve dificultades pues se dañó mi  enfriador afortunadamente logré superar esta situación y terminé de cancelar mi crédito; espero me continúen apoyando para continuar fortaleciendo mi negocio”.
texts.en: When Sofanor received his previous Kiva loan, he purchased a stove, corn, oil, chicken, beef, fruit, and ingredients, which he used to make fried snacks that he sold along with his soft drinks to earn a little more money than normal, which increased his working capital. Currently, he is applying for a new Kiva loan, which he will use to purchase implements such as cooking pots, ladles, and grinders. Additionally, he will purchase supplies so he can invest in a greater quantity of raw materials and a larger number of soft drinks. With this investment, he will improve his customer base, as well as his sales. Sofanor will be happy because his earnings will improve. His message to Kiva financiers is: “Thank you very much for your support. I had difficulties when my cooler was damaged, but luckily, I managed to overcome that situation and repay my loan. I hope that you will continue to support me so I can continue to strengthen my business.”

loans.use: to purchase implements such as cooking pots, ladles, and grinders, as well as supplies.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 56 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Edna has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Edna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 56 years old and married with seven children. With one child in school, Consolacion works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Consolacion has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sardines, bread, spices, egg, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Consolacion would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is 63 years old, married and has 3 children. He is in the agricultural business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Felix requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Felix has been buying and selling livestock for six years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Felix would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Rodela

texts.en:
Rodela is 55 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rodela is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 14 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Leonila has been in this business for 3 years.

Leonila requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more rice to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to save enough to improve her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell to customers.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is 66 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Visitacion has been farming rice for four years and also earns additional income from rice retail.

Visitacion is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mwaruwa

texts.en:
Mwaruwa, who lives in the Changamwe, Kenya, is a water vendor. He is married and has two children; both are in school. He supplies water to his neighborhood; this idea came from the fact that there is a challenge with water delivery in the area. He began the business three years ago through borrowing a few cans and selling to individual people and to food stalls.

A loan of Ksh 31,450 will help Mwaruwa purchase water tanks. Apart from the high cost of living all over that has reduced the disposable income of many customers for such businesses, Mwaruwa has been facing the challenge of lack of storage tanks, a problem he sees solved by purchasing of these water tanks. He also intends to apply for a water meter and sell water from a tap instead of pushing a handcart.

loans.use: To purchase water tanks.

loans.name: Sulfecia

texts.en:
Sulfecia is 56 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by farming peanuts in the Philippines. Sulfecia has been farming peanuts for 12 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

Sulfecia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her peanuts. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her peanuts.

loans.name: Miguel Floresmilo

texts.es:
MIGUEL FLORESMILO tiene 51 años vive en unión libre tiene 8 hijos, vive con su esposa e hijos en la ciudad de Montalvo Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC 3 cruces esta ventanilla se dedica al cultivo de cacao, naranja y maíz.

MIGUEL FLORESMILO se dedica a la siembra de cacao y maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla, urea, abonos, líquido para la maleza.

Con el apoyo del crédito piensa comprar la semilla y lo que le hace falta. Realiza sus compras y ventas en la ciudad de Montalvo cada semana.

El sueño es comprar un carro. El desafío es combatir las plagas en los cultivos.
En su tiempo libre descansa.
texts.en:
Miguel Floresmilo is 51 years old.  He lives with his partner and has eight children.  He lives with his partner and children in the city of Montalvo in the province of Los Ríos.

He is a member of the 3 Cruces Communal Bank.  He grows cacao, oranges, and corn for a living.

Miguel Floresmilo plants cacao and corn for a living.  He is asking for this loan to buy seed, urea, fertilizers, and weed killer.  

With the help of this loan he plans to buy seed and the things he needs.  He buys and sells in the city of Montalvo every week.

His dream is to buy a car.  The challenge he faces is pests in his crops.

He rests in his free time.

loans.use: to buy seed, urea, fertilizers, and weed killer

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn is 43 years old, married, has two children, who currently are married and live with their new families. 

Sorn owns a few hectares of farm land on which she grows rice, potatoes, corn, and various kinds of seasonal crops. As usual, she cultivates and harvests her crops, and then she sells them to local traders for profit. In addition, she sometimes transfers her products to retail in a market in Prey district, Kompong Cham, which is about three kilometers from her house. Typically, she is able to generate approximately US $5.00 per day to satisfy her family’s living needs. Sorn has been in this type of business for almost 33 years. She also has her supportive husband's help in this business, which ensures a good growth of her crops.

Sorn aims to improve her business and increase her income, but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase a water pump, which she will use to balance the water at the field in each season. She believes that with the help of the loan and her hard work she will be able to make her business a viable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump, which she will use to balance the water at the field in each season.

loans.name: Engracia

texts.en:
Engracia is 59 years old and has eight children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

Engracia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Engracia has been raising pigs for 30 years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 58 years old, married and has seven children.  She is in the agricultural business raising "carabao" (water buffalo) in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy a "carabao" to plow her farm.

Virginia has been raising "carabao" for 12 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Virginia would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy carabao (water buffalo) to plow her farm.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rope-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her rope-making business.

NWTF is relisting Arsenia 's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope-making business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Emily is 31 years old and both her children are in school.

Emily has a sari sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. Emily requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like diapers, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

Emily has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Emily would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like diapers, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
Marivel is 42 years old, married, and has 5 children. Three of her children are in school.

Marivel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marivel has been raising pigs for 8 years now, and she has borrowed from NWTF 15 times in the past to sustain her business.

In the future, Marivel would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 57 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Alicia works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store.

Alicia has been in this business for 37 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Alicia would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
This is Rosa, 52, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Moises, a jeepney driver, and is the mother of their child, who is now in college. By the grace of God, Rosa has managed to support her child’s schooling up to college level.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their daily expenses.

Rosa operates a rug-making business. She makes the mats by herself and she directly sells them to her neighbors and the local community, as well as to suppliers. She also operate a video karaoke machine for additional income.  She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric and thread. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosa hopes for her child to find a good job after college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 55 years old, married, and has 3 children. 

Josephine is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

Josephine has been raising pigs for 10 years now. She has borrowed from NWTF 17 times in past years to sustain her work.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Delgertsogt

texts.en:
Delgertsogt, 38, lives with his wife and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Umnugovi province, Mongolia. His son is a college student, and his two daughters are secondary school students. 

Delgertsogt is a hardworking and clever man. He is planning to start a grocery store with his wife, so he built a new store building, whose location is the best place to sell food to the locals. Now, although Delgertsogt wants to sell food in his new store, he does not have enough money to buy products to sell. 

His children's education is very important to him. Delgertsogt said, " I am working for my children's future. They will soon go to college together; therefore I have to prepare for their college tuition." He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products to sell in his store.

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
Elida tiene 50 años, vive en unión libre, tiene 10 hijos y vive en el Municipio de Villanueva, Cortes.
Doña Elida se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, este es su fuente de ingreso desde hace 15 años y le ha ayudado mucho a su esposo con lo gastos de la familia.  Es muy conocida en la zona y por tanto la mayoría de los vecinos son clientes de ella. 
El préstamo que solicito a  Odef de 10,000 lempiras es para comprar insumos para elaborar las tortillas como maíz, leña y otra parte la invertirá en la compra de un comal para trabajar mejor y generar mayor productividad de elaboración para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes.
Su meta es seguir trabajando para poder  tener el capital para arreglar su casa y darle el estudio a sus hijos menores.
texts.en:
Elida, age 50, is in a common-law marriage and has ten children.  She lives in the Villanueva municipality in Cortes.

Elida makes and sells tortillas.  This has been her source of income for 15 years.  It has helped her husband a great deal with the family expenses.  She is very well known in the area, and most of her neighbors are her customers.

The loan that she requested from ODEF for 10,000 lempiras is to buy supplies to make tortillas.  She will buy things like corn and firewood.  The other part of the loan will be used to buy a griddle in order to work better and generate greater productivity.  She will do this to satisfy her customers’ needs.

Her goal is to continue working in order to be able to have the money to fix her house and to give her minor children an education.

loans.use: to buy supplies like corn and firewood and to buy a griddle to make tortillas.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.

NWTF is relisting Renalyn's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jenelyn is 40 years old and all three of her children are in school.

Jenelyn has a dry goods retail business in the Philippines. Jenelyn requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like slippers, pants and other dry goods.

Jenelyn has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like slippers, pants and other dry goods.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is 34 years old and a hard-working father of two school-aged children. He lives with his family in a small village in Kampong Chhnang province. Hong is in two businesses at the same time: rice husbandry and construction. He manages his rice farming in the rainy season, which lasts from May to October. Aside from this, he works in construction with his team for additional income. Hong is married to Chhun, age 33, who works as a sewing worker in a garment factory in the province to help provide income.

Due to the lack of a family-owned vehicle, Hong’s family is experiencing difficulties in transportation. They have to walk to nearby places or take taxis to distant areas. So now, Hong would like to borrow KHR 2,000,000 to purchase a used motorcycle for household use. This will better his living conditions and reduce some transportation expenses. Hong aims to send his two children to college after they finish high school, so he must try hard and save money for their future education.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for household use.

loans.name: Shallate

texts.en:
Shallate is a married woman and has one child who is still too young for school. She lives in Kaloleni, Mombasa where she works at her kiosk. For the past one year, she’s been operating her kiosk to support her home. 

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan because she wants to strengthen her business more each time and plans to use this loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar at a much more special price than usual because she has the capacity to buy wholesale with her Kiva loan which will make the investment successful.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
This is Eufemia, She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 12,000 loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 


Eufemia hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed for her store.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Because of her need to generate an income so that she could improve her family’s well-being, Harriet began her business selling household consumables. Harriet is a married woman who lives with her husband and four children. Her main clients are the neighboring community members.  

Harriet is requesting a second loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust, an organization she has been a part of for one year and that made it possible for her to set up her business, in order to give it a more comfortable environment. She will use the loan to buy stock of wheat flour, cooking fat, beans and sugar for resale in order to increase the opportunities in the market, such as responding to new customers that have been referred by the current buyers and those whose attention she wants to capture. This is the reason she is asking for this Kiva loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust, with which she will buy supplies in quantity, which will allow her to buy at a discount for cash and large volume.

loans.use: to buy stock of wheat flour, cooking fat, beans and sugar

loans.name: Katerina

texts.ru:
Катерина проживает в городе Хуст. Она арендует помещение в центре города, где изготавливает и продает свадебные букеты, а также букеты на всякие торжественные события. Кроме того она также реализует цветы в вазонах, которые всегда пользуются неизменным спросом. Катерина занимается этим бизнесом уже 5 лет. 

Катерине необходим кредит в размере 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести дополнительную партию товара, а именно цветы для оформления праздничных букетов. Катерина всегда говорит, что этот бизнес ей по душе, занимаясь им, она может реализовывать свой творческий потенциал. Она планирует и дальше развивать свой бизнес и вкладывать полученные средства в свое дело. Катерине 43 года, семьи у нее нет, и она может посвящать себя целиком и полностью своему любимому делу. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Katerina lives in the city of Khoost. She rents a retail location in the city centre where she creates and sells wedding bouquets, as well as bouquets for other celebrations. Additionally, she also offers potted flowers, which are always in demand. Katerina has been in this business for the past 5 years.

Katerina needs a loan of 5000 hryvnia in order to purchase an extra shipment of merchandise, particularly flowers to arrange holiday bouquets. She often talks about how much she likes her business, and how it allows her to exercise her creative talents. She plans to continue expanding her business and investing money into its development.

Katerina is 43 years old. She does not have a family, and so can dedicate herself fully to her favourite occupation.

loans.use: to purchase a new shipment of merchandise, particularly flowers for holiday bouquets

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana Julia, tiene 49 años de edad, es soltera con 4 hijos, vive en una aldea cerca de la ciudad de Puerto Cortes junto a su hija mayor.
Doña Ana Julia, siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, ella vendía todo tipo de mercadería, y hace 5 años se dedico al negocio de venta de comidas ya que es rentable. Anexado a su casa hizo un local donde vende refrescos, golosinas, comidas como pollo frito con tajadas, chuletas fritas, tacos, y otros. Y le ha ido muy bien tiene buena demanda sus comidas. 
Ella ha solicitado  varios préstamos lo que ha permitido que su negocio se mantenga en crecimiento. Hasta el momento ha logrado tener un buen record crediticio con la institución y eso le motiva a seguir trabajando. 
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo paralelo a ODEF y a Kiva por 6,000.00 Lempiras para comprar una freidora con más capacidad y rapidez y servir la comida mas rápido a los clientes. Su meta sigue siendo la de trabajar muy duro con su negocio ya que tiene buena demanda y superarse cada día más y mejorar la calidad de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Ana Julia, 49, is single with four children; she lives in a village near the city of Puerto Cortes with her oldest daughter.

Ana Julia has always been a merchant. She used to sell all sorts of merchandise and five years ago decided to sell food because it’s profitable. She built a locale onto her house where she sells soft-drinks, snacks and food like chicken with fried banana, fried chops, tacos and others.  It has been going very well for her, and there is a good demand for her food.

She has requested various loans that have allowed her business to keep growing.  She has managed to have a good credit record with the institution, and this motivates her to continue working.

She is now requesting a concurrent loan with ODEF and Kiva for 6,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy a fryer with a larger capacity that works quickly.  Then she will serve the food more quickly to her customers.

Her goal continues to be working very hard with her business because she has a good demand.  She wants to improve more every day, and she wants to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a fryer for her food business.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her boutique business. With the loan investment she will buy clothes, embroidered and simple clothes to sell through her boutique. She has been operating her business for many years and her clients like her variety very well and make regular purchases.

Razia has 3 sons and 5 daughters. Two of them are studying while the others couldn’t complete their education. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her business and will make positive changes in her family’s living standard.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Razia.

loans.use: To buy clothes for boutique business

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village located in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Mom is 25 years old and married. She has two dependent sons and earns a living through farming rice on 0.13 hectare of farmland, supplemented with vegetable planting. Having been in this business for almost seven years, she is able to earn a daily income of about 20,000 KHR. 

Mom's group consists of four members living in the same village. She is a second-cycle client while  two other members have been with VisionFund for seven cycles and the other has just begun with VisionFund. Mom is now leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund after completing her loan repayment. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and crop seeds for her farming and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to make a living better with the loan from VisionFund.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and crop seeds for her farming

loans.name: Yolanda Maria

texts.es: Yolanda de 40 años tiene en el centro de la ciudad un puesto de ventas de calzado informal, desde que llego a la ciudad de Barranquilla hace 18 años, procedente del departamento de  Antioquia, con el fin de encontrar nuevos horizontes, pues el mercado del municipio donde habitaba, estaba muy  saturado. Ella en su tierra natal, también se dedicaba a comercializar ropa por encargo y mediante la modalidad de crédito.  Cuando se instaló en esta ciudad, identificó la venta de calzado, como una estrategia mas productiva para a Costa, por eso empezó con este producto, con el que le ha ido muy bien y desea  hacer crecer su negocio cada vez mas, hasta lograr su estabilidad financiera totalmente. Cuando inició su negocio, Yolanda debió trabajar fuertemente, pero poco a poco fue capitalizándose y adquirió así mismo 2 puestos comerciales en los cuales trabaja, en uno vende chancletas y calzado informal en general y en el otra papelería. Con el fruto de su trabajo de un largo periodo, compró su propia vivienda y fue adecuándola hasta lograr habilitarla, con tres dormitorios, para estar más cómoda con su familia. La mercancía que compra Yolanda, la adquiere de contado en un municipio ubicado en la costa norte de Colombia y viaja dos veces por semanas, para luego venderla de contado en sus puestos comerciales y a crédito con un plazo de 30 días entre diversos clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará calzado, chancletas, porque planea extender su mercado en otros puntos comerciales, con el fin de experimentar la potencialidad comercial existente.  Entre sus metas futuras está la de adecuar un local en su vivienda y tener una  miscelánea que abarque el mercado alrededor de su residencia.
texts.en: Yolanda is 40 years old. She has had a stall in the city center where she sells casual footwear since she arrived in the city of Barranquilla eighteen years ago. She arrived from the department of Antioquia with the hope of finding new horizons since the market in the municipality where she had lived was very saturated. She also sold made-to-order clothing on credit there. When she arrived in Barranquilla she identified shoe sales as a better business strategy for its cost. That is why she started with this product, which has gone very well for her. She hopes to grow her business at every turn until she can achieve total financial stability. When she started her business, Yolanda needed to work very hard, but little by little she has capitalized on her efforts and acquired  two commercial stalls where she works. In one of them she sells flip-flop sandals and general casual footwear, and in the other one she sells paper products. Using the fruits of her labor over a long period, she purchased her own home, which she has been adapting and making nicer, with three bedrooms, so her family can be comfortable. Yolanda purchases her merchandise with cash in a municipality located on the north coast of Colombia that she travels to twice a week. She later sells her merchandise for cash in her commercial stalls, and on 30-day credit for various customers. Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing she is receiving from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to purchase footwear, flip-flop sandals, because she plans to extend her market to other commercial spots in an effort to discover the potential customer base that exists. Among her future goals is to adapt a storefront in her home and have a corner store that supplies the market where she lives.

loans.use: to purchase casual shoes for women, children, and men.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi lives in Tiribe, Kenya with her two children. She dreams of a promising future where she is able to provide her little ones with the potential for success. 

Her children are the motivation behind her work of selling fast food such as fried potatoes and French fries. Her business is open on weekends and holidays. It is located near her home; she sells food to passersby in her area as well as to neighbors, family members and friends. They are familiar with the products that Mwanamisi prepares and are loyal to her business. 

Mwanamisi' goal is to achieve sustainable growth and thus improve her family's income. Her biggest challenge is building up enough working capital in order to grow her business. Mwanamisi is currently applying for a Kiva loan (her first loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust). She will use it to buy supplies such as sauces, breads, sausages and meat in larger volumes so that she can increase her offerings.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sauces, breads, sausages and meat.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
This is Victoria, 55, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband, Leonardo, is her business partner. They manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Victoria operates a variety store, which is a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries and beverages to the neighborhood. People can buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Victoria earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is next to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will use it to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Victoria hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of giving her child a good future and high-quality education through her hard work. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр – талантливый мастер, у которого золотые руки. До того, как он открыл свое дело 5 лет назад, Александр 7 лет проработал раскройщиком ламинированного ДСП на мебельной фабрике. Но потом решил работать на себя, арендовал у частного лица небольшое помещение, переоборудовал его под цех и теперь занимается производством корпусной мебели на заказ. Самый распространенный вид заказав со стороны клиентов – мебель для кухни. На данный момент у Александра уже есть 2 качественных станка, которые себе могут позволить только серьезные мебельщики-фабриканты. Он с готовностью вкладывает в свое дело, ясно ставит цели, очень трудолюбив. 

Александр обратился за кредитом в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести кромкообрабатывающий станок для своего мебельного цеха. Этот станок поможет Александру качественнее и быстрее завершать работу над своими заказами. Дополнительную прибыль Александр планирует вложить в покупку автомобиля и, возможно, постройку гаража. Он намерен развивать производство корпусной мебели, а, значит, ему понадобится еще оборудование и он планирует в дальнейшем пользоваться услугами КИВА.   
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Alexander is a talented craftsman with gifted hands. 
Prior to starting his business 5 years ago, Alexander was a laminated particle board worker at the furniture factory for 7 years. 
However, later he decided to start his own business. He rented out a small room, re-equipped it into a furniture manufacturing facility, and now manufactures cabinet furniture to order. Kitchen furniture is the most wide-spread order. As of today, Alexander already has 2 high-quality wood-working machines that only experienced furniture-makers can afford. 
Alexander invests a lot into his business, sets clear objectives and works hard.  He asks for a loan of 15,000 hryven to purchase an edge-beveling machine. This machine will help Alexander manufacture furniture of better quality as well as allow him to speed up the manufacturing process.
The additional earnings from the loan will help Alexander buy a new car and, perhaps, build a garage. Alexander intends to develop his business; therefore, he will need the necessary equipment, and he is planning on turning to KIVA for support.
NB: the background information is in Russian

loans.use: to purchase an edge-beveling machine for his furniture factory

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Yin is 36 years old, married and has been blessed with two children, one of whom is employed in Phnom Penh while the remaining one is still attending school. Presently, she lives with her family in Kampong Chhnang Province. To earn a living, Yin runs a vegetable-selling business in a local market of the province. She grows her own vegetables for this business, but also buys vegetables in bulk from her frequent suppliers, so that she has various types of vegetables available to satisfy her customer's needs. She has been involved in this business for almost 2 years. 

Because Yin does not have a vehicle for household use, she has to spend more on transportation fees for transporting her vegetables to the marketplaces. Due to this matter, Yin would like to request a loan of KHR 2,000,000 in order to purchase a used motorcycle to support her current business. This loan will enable Yin to make her business more profitable. She hopes to expand her business in the upcoming years.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle to support her current business.

loans.name: Algirmaa

texts.en:
Algirmaa is 47 and lives with her husband in Ger, a slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her children are grown and live separately. Algirmaa has been running a fruit and vegetable retail business for 12 years. She rents a stall at Tosa fruit and vegetable market and buys her products from wholesalers. Her husband works for Ulaanbaatar city’s public trash collecting company as a controller and earns $210 a month.

They own a small plot of land with an old wooden house on it. The house is very old, and it needs renovation, especially insulation and a new roof. It loses heat very quickly during winter, and leaks during summer rains. A well-insulated house uses about two tons of coal for heating during winter, but Algirmaa’s house uses twice as much coal, and thus it makes twice as much heavy smoke polluting the air. Ulaanbaatar has been nominated by UNDP as the worst capital city regarding air pollution during winter. 

Algirmaa is asking for a loan to buy 250 roof tiles, 50 pieces of rock wool insulation for the wall and roof and other necessary tools. The whole project will cost 2,500,000 MNT, but she will cover some costs from her savings. After the completion of the project, the house should become more energy efficient, warm and water tight.

loans.use: To buy 250 roof tiles, 50 pieces of rock wool insulation for the wall and roof and other necessary tools.

loans.name: Gulzhakhon

texts.en: Gulzhakhon is a hardworking and honest woman. She is divorced and has four children. She started her business 12 years ago in order to keep her family in a good living condition. She is engaged in the selling of women’s clothing and fabrics. Her loving son helps her in business and they are trying to expand this business. Gulzhakhon would like to get a loan to purchase new women’s clothing and fabrics in order to refill her working capital. She hopes for your support and mercy.

loans.use: To purchase of women’s clothing and fabrics

loans.name: Roman

texts.ru:
Последний кредит, который Роман получил от КИВА, был направлен на приобретение пленки и удобрений. Более того Роман смог закупить арматуру для постройки теплицы и приобрести бытовую технику для своей семьи. Со времени получения предыдущего кредита КИВА у Романа возникали и неожиданные расходы: его жене сделали операцию весной.  

Роману понадобились дополнительные средства в размере 7 000 гривен для покупки удобрений и оплаты рабочим, которые трудятся в его теплицах. За счет того, что растения получат все необходимые удобрения для роста, урожай вырастет хорошим и, значит, Роман сможет начать раньше торговать ранними овощами.
texts.en:
The last loan Roman received from Kiva was used to purchase plastic greenhouse covering and fertilizers. Roman was also able to buy rebar for constructing his greenhouses, as well as some household appliances for his family.

Since his last Kiva loan, Roman has also incurred some unexpected expenses when his wife underwent surgery in the spring.

Presently, Roman needs additional funding in the amount of 7000 hryvnia to purchase fertilizers and pay salaries to his employees who work in the greenhouses. Thanks to the fact that his plants will have everything they need for growth, Roman will collect a good harvest and will be able to start selling his vegetables earlier.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay salaries to employees who work in his greenhouses

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.en: Twenty-five-year-old Eusebio is a fisherman from Bien Unido, Bohol. He is still single and supports his parents and siblings through fishing. Eusebio works hard to increase his income and save for his future family. He has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets and other materials. He hopes to have a successful fishing business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other materials.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s crockery selling business.

With the loan investment he will buy crockery of different varieties that will allow him to offer more variety of products to his clients and increase his sales and income.

He is very experienced and professional in his dealings and has been operating his business for the past many years. Shahnaz is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for him and bring positive changes in the life of her family.

She also works and makes boxes on order. She receives orders from different shoe selling shops and makes shoe boxes to financially support her family.

She believes in hard work and honesty and is confident about her family’s bright future.

loans.use: To buy crockery for her husband's crockery selling business

loans.name: Gongorsuren

texts.en:
Gongorsuren, 43, lives with his wife and two sons in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvs province, Mongolia. His wife is a chef. His elder son will soon go to college. His younger son is a secondary school student. 

Gongorsuren has graduated from a Mercy Corps. training program and has started a Buryat shoe-making business. He would like to operate a sustainable business and would like to have regular customers, but he doesn't have a sewing machine and manually makes his Buryat shoes, so he has very low productivity. He wants to buy a sewing machine to increase his productivity and business income. He is a diligent and humble man. He said, "I am planning to pay my son's college tuition by increasing my business income because my elder son will go to college this year."  He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for making shoes.

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.ru:
Виталий успешно вложил в развитие своего бизнеса средства двух КИВА кредитов. Он остался очень доволен тем, как своевременно мог получить эти денежные средства и реализовать их в торговле. За счет полученных средств Виталий смог увеличить свой доход на 1 000 гривен. Начал также делать дома ремонт с желанием обновить интерьер. 
Виталий хочет использовать кредит КИВА суммой в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить новые виды парфюмерной продукции для последующей реализации. Летом спрос идем совсем на другие, легкие ароматы, и Виталий, стремясь угодить вкусам покупателей, хочет предоставить в своем киоске соответствующий ассортимент. На данный момент Виталий подумывает о том, чтобы открыть еще одну точку, взяв на работу наемного работника, тем самым расширяя свое дело. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Vitalyi has been successful in investing his two previous Kiva loans into expansion of his business. He was very happy with the timely acquisition of these funds, which he put to good use. With his loans, Vitalyi was able to increase his profits by 1000 hryvnia. He also began repairs and renovations of his home's interior.

Vitalyi would like to use a new Kiva loan of 10000 hryvnia to purchase new kinds of perfumes for subsequent resale. During the summer season, distinct, lighter fragrances are in demand, and Vitalyi would like to offer these in his kiosque in order to cater to the tastes of his customers. Currently, he is also considering the possibility of opening another retail location and hiring an employee, thereby expanding his business.

loans.use: to offer new kinds of perfumes for sale in his kiosque

loans.name: Gennadyi

texts.ru:
Геннадий уже несколько раз пользовался кредитами КИВА. Он успел убедиться в эффективности этих кредитных услуг и решил снова обратиться за помощью именно к кредиторам КИВА. Предыдущий кредит от КИВА Геннадий использовал для приобретения дополнительных велотоваров, за счет чего у него повысилось количество покупателей. Получив прибыль, смог позволить себе, собрав все сбережения, приобрести автомобиль Ланос. 
В этот раз Геннадию необходим кредит в размере 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы пополнить количество товара (велотовары, хозтовары), расширив его ассортимент. В этому году у Геннадия два сына поступают учиться в ВУЗ, трудно будет учить сразу двоих, деньги нужны сейчас как никогда. Геннадий – трудяга. Он готов работать сверхурочно, лишь бы обеспечить свою семью и детей всем необходимым.
texts.en:
Gennadyi has received several Kiva loans in the past. He was very impressed with the effectiveness of these loans, and therefore decided to ask Kiva lenders for help once again. Gennadyi used his previous Kiva loans to purchase additional bicycle parts and accessories, thanks to which the number of his customers grew. By combining his new profits with previous savings, Gennadyi was able to purchase a Lanos automobile.

Presently, Gennadyi needs a loan of 20 000 hryvnia in order to further expand his assortment of bicycle parts and household goods. This year, two of his sons will begin their post-secondary education. It will be difficult to pay for their studies at the same time, and so Gennadyi needs money now more than ever.

Gennadyi is a very hard-working person. He is ready to work overtime in order to provide for his family and children.

loans.use: to expand the assortment of bicycle parts and household goods in his shop

loans.name: Sabina Natividad

texts.es:
SABINA NATIVIDAD tiene 26 años es soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 2 y 8 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en la ciudad de Montalvo Provincia de lo Ríos.

VRC. Las 3 cruces se dedican al cultivo de cacao, naranja y maíz. Sabina Barahona, se dedica a la siembra de cacao y maíz.

Solicita el crédito para comprar líquido mata maleza, insecticidas, urea, plantas de naranja. de la finca. Con el apoyo del crédito quiere limpiar la finca.

Realiza sus compra y ventas en la ciudad de Montalvo cada semana. El sueño de la señora es comprar mas terreno y hacer la casa.

El desafío al que se enfrenta la señora es falta de dinero. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer amistades y conversar con los vecinos.
texts.en:
Sabina Natividad is 26 years old and single with two children, ages 2 and 8. She lives with her husband and children in the city of Montalvo in the Los Rios Province. 

Members of the communal bank "Three Crosses" make a living cultivating cacao, oranges, and corn. Sabina makes a living planting cacao and corn.
