She believes that by building a cinder block wall in it's place, she will solve this problem. She will no longer have to mop all the time when it is raining. 

Elena is originally from the state of Nuevo León, but she has been living in Nuevo Laredo for over 40 years. She makes a living selling used clothing, but more than anything is supported on a weekly basis by her five children.

loans.use: to make an interior block wall, inside her home.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 34 years old. She is a single mother of two children who are both school-going. She sells cereals and has been in the business for the past six years. She gets a monthly income of 15,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from the business.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers. She will use the loan amount to purchase stock of maize, beans, and green grams (mung beans) for stock in her business.

She hopes to start wholesale distribution of cereals in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of maize, beans, and green grams for stock in her business.

loans.name: Lukas

texts.en:
Lukas is 27 years old. He is married to Esther and they have two children. He has operated a motorcycle transport business for the past two years. He earns a monthly income of 9,000 KES from the business.
This is his first loan from Kiva partner KADET. He will add the loan amount to his savings in order to purchase a second-hand motorcycle. With the anticipated profits from his expanded business, Lukas will set up a grocery store for his wife. He hopes to improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Tiribe, Kenya.  She’s the mother of three children, all of whom graduated from school. She works in the traditional art of dressmaking. With this activity she’s generated income to support her household.  Esther started learning this occupation precisely when she married her husband, who is a retail seller.  Her work has helped her family attain economic independence, supported her children’s well-being, and provided them with professional education so they can be successful in the future.

She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan.  She plans to use the money to buy raw materials and supplies to make uniforms for school children. Esther has orders, but she needs to buy her materials in large volume to earn good discounts so that her prices will be competitive. Her goal for later on is to attain good market position, to hire employees, and to dedicate herself to running her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies to make uniforms for school children

loans.name: Tumaini

texts.en:
Tumaini is married and has two children who are still too young for school. She lives in Kaloleni, Mombasa, where she works as a farmer and also owns a motorcycle taxi. For the past year, Tumaini has been selling vegetables such as potatoes and onions from her farm to support her family. 

Tumaini is requesting a Kiva loan to strengthen her transportation business and purchase another motorcycle taxi. Tumaini's loan will make her business successful and she hopes to provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her taxi business

loans.name: Robilinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Robilinda works hard to support her family.

Robilinda has a business of selling used clothing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. She is borrowing 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

Robilinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nematullo

texts.en:
Nematullo is a man who likes to work hard. His aim is to be successful in business, which is why he tries to do his best to develop his business. During the past 15 years he has been busy with his agricultural business. He grows watermelons, onions, tomatoes and other products. People who buy Nematullo’s products are very glad because they are of high quality. Every year, after Nematullo has collected his harvest he gives some part of it as a gift to local people. 
Nematulloe is married and has five children, who help him in his business. He wants to widen his business and is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers for the land where he works. He awaits your help.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Doña Ana tiene 48 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive en una aldea de Santa Cruz de Yojoa con su familia. Doña Ana tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, cultiva hortalizas como cilantro y granos básicos como el maíz, para vender. Esta es su fuente de ingresos de donde mantiene a su familia. Ha invertido varios préstamos a esta actividad y le han sido de mucha ayuda para estar siempre produciendo y sacando ganancias. Actualmente solicita el séptimo préstamo a ODEF y es por 20,000.00 Lempiras, el cual lo utilizara para comprar fertilizantes, pago de limpieza y extracción de la producción de sus cultivos. Este préstamo le ayudara a incrementar la producción y de sus ganancias podrá darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana, age 48, is married and has two children.  She lives with her family in a village in Santa Cruz in Yojoa.

Ana has devoted herself to agriculture for 20 years.  She grows greens like cilantro and basic grains like corn.  She grows these crops to sell.  This is her source of income to support her family.

She has invested various loans in this activity.  They have been a big help to always be producing and getting income.

She is currently requesting her seventh loan with ODEF for 20,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and to pay for clearing the land and harvesting her crops.  This loan will help her increase production, and with the income she will be able to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for clearing the land and harvesting her crops.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 53 years old and married with six children.

Consolacion earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Consolacion has been farming rice  for 20 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en: Mrs. Thanh was born in 1960. Her family is a normal family. Her husband and her son are factory workers. Her husband is retired. His pension is 2,500,000 VND per month. Her son has a salary of 3,500,000 VND. Mrs. Thanh’s job is making Vietnamese traditional cakes to sell in the market, and she gets 3,000,000 VND every month from this. She has been participating in SEDA's credit programs since 2006. The last cycle, she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid that loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy ingredients to make more cakes to sell. Then, she will be able to buy some furniture for her small house.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make more cakes to sell

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 51 years old and married with seven children. For the past two years, she has been a rice farmer in the Philippines. Amalia also earns additional income from vending food. 

Amalia is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Aquila

texts.en:
This is Aquila, 51, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Eduardincio and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Aquila operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Aquila hopes her business grows and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 30 years old and married with three children in school. She works very hard to provide for them.
Analiza runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, sugar, noodles, canned goods, etc. She has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy additional items to sell. In the future Analiza would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 25 years old. She is married to Isaac and they have two children. She operates a cafe and has been in the business for the past two years. She earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES from her business.
This is Sharon's first loan from Kiva partner KADET. She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers. She will use the loan to purchase sugar, salt and rice to be used in her cafeteria. She hopes to open a maize mill in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt and rice for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has a food business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.
Elizabeth has been in this business for seven years now, and also earns additional income from a coffee shop. In the future, she would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija y reside en San Juan Pueblo, Cortes.
Doña Josefina tiene un negocio de pulpería el cuál estableció hace 14 años. Ofrece productos alimenticios como: maseca, harina, pan, productos enlatados, golosinas, manteca, maquina de afeitar y también a implementado a su negocio la venta de sandalias.  Manifiesta que con los financiamientos que odef le ha dado a surtido de productos que no contaba para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes. Trabaja desde muy temprano para atender a sus clientes y así obtiene a diario los ingresos que le ayudan a solventar algunas necesidades del hogar.
Este es su préstamo numero nueve de 10,000 lempiras el cual invertirá en la compra de mas producto como, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, refrescos, carnes, etc. Para surtir mas su negocio y aumentar el inventario para que sus ganancias sean aun mejores.
La meta que tiene es tener el capital necesario para poder ayudar a su hija a graduarse en  la Universidad.
texts.en:
Josefina is a 43-year-old single mother with a daughter. She resides in San Juan Pueblo, Cortes.

Doña Josefina has a grocery business that she established 14 years ago. She offers food products such as cornmeal, flour, bread, canned goods, candy, and lard. Josefina also has a shaving machine and manages a business of selling sandals. She says that the loans from ODEF have helped her to stock with products she does not have in order to satisfy the needs of her customers. Josefina begins her work very early in order to serve her customers and generate daily income to help cover a few household needs.

This is her ninth loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL, which will be invested in the purchase of more products such as beans, rice, sugar, soft drinks, meat, and other items so that she can restock her business. By increasing her inventory, her earnings will improve. Her goal is to have the necessary capital to help her daughter graduate from the university.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, soft drinks, meat, and other items.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has been practising farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 22 years. She plants cash crops and has found this to be very profitable. She is 52 years of age and a single mother of one school-going child who is 15 years old.
Having paid back all her previous loans well and in good time, this will be her third loan with which she plans to buy fertilizer and farm chemicals. She also plans to use part of it for labour purposes. With the anticipated profits, she plans to pay her child's school fees.
In the future, Jane hopes to invest more in her farming business, provide for her and her daughter's needs, and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chemicals.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim operates an agro-vet store in Olkalou, where he sells veterinary products as well as farm supplies, such as fertilizer, farm chemicals, and seeds. He is 46 years old and married to Nancy. They have five children.

This will be his first loan, and he plans to use the loan to buy more veterinary products and fertilizer to sell in his business. This will enable him to meet his customers' needs and demands and also to make more income.

In the future, Ibrahim hopes to grow his business and open other agro-vet businesses in other centers of Olkalou. He also hopes to make more profit from his business and be able to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy more veterinary products and fertilizer

loans.name: Muqaddas' Group

texts.en:
Muqaddas is a mother with two daughters and two sons. Her two elder children are working and her younger children are still in school. Muqaddas works embroidering clothes and her husband is a factory worker who earns a low income. She is very good at her work and her embroidered clothes are very popular among her community clients.

Muqaddas is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to buy beads, embroidery thread, and frames for her embroidery business. She will use her loan to make better looking embroidered clothes and increase her sales and income. Muqaddas is a very confident lady who always tries new things in her business. She is confident about her business success after investing in her loan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery material for her business

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Rita; la socia continua dedicandose a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes , gallinas, ovejas,la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que mas le solicitan,la socia a la vez continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.
texts.en:
The member, Rita, belongs to Qori Orcco Communal Bank.  She lives in the district of Urcos in the province of Quispicanchis and department of Cusco.

She continues to raise small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, and sheep.  She raises these little animals to sell to the customers who most request them.  At the same time she continues with her grocery-store business, this being the way she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia de 40 años de edad es una humilde habitante  de la comarca la Ceiba-Teustepe, casada, su nivel académico es hasta el sexto grado de primaria, madre de 5 hijos de los cuales 4 están a su cargo, actualmente estudian su secundaria, ella de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción desde hace 4 años. Inicio su actividad   con ahorros que tenia el esposo, empezaron con poco inventario, luego con apoyo de instituciones financieras fueron invirtiendo mas en el negocio, compraron un camión para poder transportar sus productos a otras zonas, pero con eso no se conformo Sonia su deseo de ser alguien independiente y una gran comerciante la motivo a poner un segundo negocio, hoy en día  gracias a su esfuerzo  y arduo trabajo diario también tiene 6 meses de haber puesto su  pulpería en su casa de habitación, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de dos hijos que le ayudan a vender los materiales de construcción mientras la hija se encarga de atender a los clientes de la pulpería,  el esposo trabaja como conductor de una empresa privada para obtener otros ingreso, aporta con los gastos del hogar, su expectativa es incrementar el negocio de pulpería con nuevos productos.
Requiere del préstamo para comprar granos básicos, arroz, frijol, avena, azúcar, pan, cosméticos y medicamentos, para poder ofrecer variedad de productos, ella estima que el crédito será de ayuda pues podrá surtir su pulpería para mayor atracción de clientes, generándole a la vez mas ingresos, sus planes futuros es cancelar el crédito de las ganancias que le genere el negocio y poner su tercer negocio el cual seria  un comedor ya que ella es una persona con deseos de superación, aspira a ser una de las mejores comerciantes de la zona, su expectativa es mantener el negocio activo para poder salir adelante con su familia y tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Sonia, who is 40 years old, is a humble resident of the district of Ceiba-Teustepe. She is married and studied through the sixth grade. She has five children, four of which she is caring for, who are studying in secondary school. She makes a living in sales, selling construction materials, which she has been doing for four years. She started this business with savings that her husband had. They started with a small inventory, and later with the support of financial institutions, they were able to invest more in the business by buying a truck to transport their products to other areas. But that was not good enough. Sonia's dream was to be independent and a great businesswoman, with motivation to open a second business. 

Today, thanks to her efforts and her daily hard work, she has had a grocery store, which has been open for six months, which she runs out of her home. In her business she has the support of two of her children, who help her to sell the construction materials, while her daughter attends to the customers in the grocery store. Her husband works as a driver for a private company, to provide another source of income, and provide for the household expenses. Her goal is to increase business in the grocery store by adding new products.   

She has requested a loan to buy basic grains, rice, beans, oatmeal, sugar, cosmetics and medicines, to be able to offer a variety of products. She believes that the loan will be of help to stock her grocery store, to attract more customers, and at the same time generating more profits. Her plans for the future include paying off her loan with the profits generated from the business, and to open her third business, which will be a small restaurant, because she is a person who is very driven to get ahead. She aspires to be one of the best business owners in the area. Her expectation is to maintain the businesses and to keep moving forward with her family and to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, rice, beans, oatmeal, sugar, bread, cosmetics and medicine.

loans.name: Janepha

texts.en:
Janepha is 56 years old and married with three adult children, ages 38, 25, and 24 years old. For the past six years, Janepha has been selling cereals. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a field officer.

Janepha is requesting a loan from KADET LTD to purchase a stock of beans, maize, and green grams. In the future, she hopes to purchase a truck to aid in her business.

loans.use: to purchase beans, maize, and green grams for her business

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 42 years old. She is married to Enos, and together they have three children. She bakes cakes and has been in the business for one year.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to them by one of their field officers. She will use the loan to purchase sugar, salt, and rice to start up a retail shop where she can also sell her cakes instead of hawk them.

She hopes to own a large bakery and bake a variety of cakes.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, and rice to diversify her business

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is widowed. For the past 15 years, she has worked running a coffee shop in the Philippines. Clara works hard to support her family.

Clara is requesting a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy sugar, coffee, and utensils for her coffee shop. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, and utensils for her coffee shop

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is 58 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice and corn in the Philippines. Dionesia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Dionesia has been farming rice and corn for four years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mansur

texts.en:
Mansur is as good in business as in family. He is a very careful husband and father. 

During some years he is busy with his own business deal. He keeps livestock in the house. This is the main source of his income. 

Mansur has developed his business year by year and bought a car. Nowadays he works as a taxi man. This is an added source of his income. 

As Mansur wants to comfort his family with all the modern conveniences, he decided to repair his house. He is asking for a loan to buy building materials.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing his living-house.

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de restaurant,ella vende desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo al horno,tallarines con pollo entre otros platos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo,carne,verduras y arroz.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working in her restaurant business selling breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  She prepares various dishes, such as baked chicken, chicken and pasta, and others.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  With this business she gets her children ahead.  Her dream is to expand her restaurant.

She is requesting the loan to buy products for cooking such as chicken, meat, vegetables, and rice.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, vegetables, and rice.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mrs. Van was born in 1978. She has two children who are enrolled in primary school and secondary school. Her husband is a welder at Da Hoi. His income is 5,000,000 VND each month. Mrs. Van has a food stall in the market. She gets 3,000,000 VND each month. The total income of her family is 8,000,000 VND. She has been participating in SEDA's credit programs since 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid that loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to expand her stall and buy more ingredients.

loans.use: To expand her stall and buy more ingredients.

loans.name: Lia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lia;la socia continua dedicandose a la agricultura y la ganadería (productos lacteos),la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia,ella vende leche a todos sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para su chacra. 

La socia se compromete a cumplir ocn el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido y de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The member, Lia, belongs to Qori Orcco Communal Bank, located in the district of Urcos in the province of Quispicanchis and department of Cusco.  She continues working in agriculture and livestock (dairy products).  She has been in the business for years and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She sells milk to all of her customers who order it from her.  She is a responsible and hardworking person who very much wants to continue working on behalf of her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

She promises to make her payments in a disciplined manner by the established deadline.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Juana Natividad

texts.es:
La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de animales como patos,la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio ,tambien le va bien en su negocio de venta de salchipapas, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de papas ya aceite.
texts.en:
The member continues with her business buying and selling animals like ducks; she raises these young animals to later sell them to her customers upon request. She has been in this business for a good deal of time and it is going well, thanks to the effort that she puts into it. 

She is also doing well in her "salchipapas" [a popular dish of sausage and fried potatoes] business, and in this way she helps her family get ahead.

The member is requesting the loan for the purchase of potatoes and oil.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and oil.

loans.name: Susan Wambui

texts.en:
Susan used her previous loan amount to buy more goods to sell in her retail shop. It was profitable and she was able to pay back the loan well and in good time. 

She now runs a grocery business in Ndunyu Njeru town and she plans to use this loan amount to buy potatoes and cabbages to sell.

With the anticipated profits, she plans to pay school fees for her children and also boost her business by adding more grocery items like tomatoes and fruits.

In the future, Susan hopes to grow her business and establish one of the biggest grocery stores in the area.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and cabbages.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres unidas  es un grupo de la ciudad de Caacupé, son 13 mujeres todas amigas y vecinas que se unieron con el propósito de ayudarse las unas a las otras y por medio de ese trabajo salir adelante.
Nancy es una persona muy trabajadora y comenta que por medio de la venta de ropas que hace, ayuda a su familia y le da todo lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones ni necesidades.  Nancy dice que su sueño es tener una gran tienda para poder  ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con las cuales desea poder surtirse y de esa forma seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Women United is a group from the city of Caacupé. They are 13 women, all friends and neighbors, that came together with the purpose of helping each other and through that to get by.
Nancy is a very hardworking person and says that through the sales of clothing that she does, she helps her family and gives them everything they need for their life without deprivation or needs. Nancy says that her dream is to have a large store in order to be able to offer more convenience to her customers. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase clothes, with which she wants to be able to stock up and in that way continue working and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Guido Marcelo

texts.es:
Guido Marcelo tiene 21 años es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Montalvo Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 3 cruces se dedican al cultivo de cacao, naranja y maíz. Guido Marcelo se dedica a la siembra de cacao  maracuyá.

Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, fertilizantes. Con el apoyo del crédito quiere mejorar los cultivos.

Realiza sus compras y ventas en Montalvo. El sueño es realizar un curso para la policía. El desafío al que se enfrenta es poder seguir estudiando.

En su tiempo libre le gusta ir a las piscinas y pasear por el campo.
texts.en:
Guido Marcelo, 21, is single and has no children.  He lives with his parents in the city of Montalvo in Los Rios province.

He is a member of the communal bank "3 Cruces," where the members are farmers who cultivate cocoa, oranges and corn.  Guido Marcelo is a farmer who cultivates cocoa and passion fruit.

He is requesting a loan to buy urea, insecticides, and fertilizers.  With the support of this loan, he hopes to improve his crops.

He makes his purchases and sales in Montalvo.  He dreams of studying to become a policeman.  His challenge is to be able to continue his education. 

In his free time, he likes to go to the swimming pools and walk through the countryside.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticides, and fertilizers

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 49 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice and sugarcane in the Philippines. Nena is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

Nena has been farming rice and sugarcane for eleven years and also earns additional income from raising livestock and selling personal use products.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Lidier

texts.es: Lidier, tiene la edad  de 39 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y dos hijos, uno en la escuela y el otro en el colegio   actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar almacigo de café para su posterior siembra e  insumos como abonos y fumigaciones  y ayudarse con la mano de obra. El tiene pensado comprar  este almacigo para poder producir un poco mas y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica y poder pagar el estudio de los hijos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Lidier, 39 years old, is married, lives with his wife and two children, one in school and the other now in college. With the loan, he intends to buy a seedbed of coffee for further seeding and items like fertilizers and fumigation and help with manual labor. He has been thinking about purchasing this seedbed to be able to produce a little more and be able to generate more income and obtain a better quality to life and economic stability and be able to pay for his children's studies. It is the first loan that FUDECOSUR has received. He could not have had other loans before in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a seedbed of coffee.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 43 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Chona has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from food vending and frozen foods.

Chona aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 63 years old and married with two children. Teresita works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Teresita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soft drinks, cigarettes and other groceries. 

In the future Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rukiya

texts.ru: Rukiya is a hardworking and conscientious woman. She is married and the loving mother of four children. For more 21 years she is busy with the selling of shoes and clothing. She has started her business with the selling of foods and then gradually came to the sale of shoes and clothing. Her husband is baker. Rukiya would like to get a loan for purchasing of seasonal merchandise in order to increase her working capital. She hopes to your support which to allow her to improve her business and life.
texts.en:
Rukiya is a hardworking and conscientious woman. She is married and the loving mother of four children. For more 21 years she has been working with selling shoes and clothing. She started her business by selling food and then gradually went over to selling shoes and clothing. Her husband is baker. 

Rukiya would like to receive a loan for the purchase of seasonal merchandise in order to increase her working capital. She hopes for your support, which to allow her to improve her business and life.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing in order to increase her working capital

loans.name: Zukhrakhon

texts.ru: Зухрахон добрая женщина, она замужем и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Её муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Зухрахон занимается купле- продажей строительных материалов на рынке. Ранее она получала займы от «ИМОН Интернешнл» и займ помог ей продвинуть и расширить свой бизнес. Она очень благодарна за эту помощь. Данный момент с прибыли она строит дом и ей нужно поддержка, чтобы закупить строительные материалы. С этой целью она запрашивает займ в размере 5000 Сомони.
texts.en:
Zukhrakhon is a good woman, she is married and raising three children. Her husband is in Russia as a migrant worker. Zukhrakhon works with buying and selling building materials at the market. She received a loan from "IMON International" before, and the loan helped her advance and expand her business. She is very thankful for this help.

Currently she is building a house with her income and she needs support, in order to purchase building materials. To this end, she requests a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21-year-old single man who opened an international calls shop in June, 2011.  He is a hard working man who used to work as a salesman in a big mall. He insisted on improving himself and his living.
 
Ali applied for a Youth Loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to increase his sales of prepaid mobile telephone cards.  He will start selling mobile phones, too. His shop is located in a highly populated area, where most people need such a service.

Ali is planning to expand his business more and more so that he can get into the wholesale trade in the near future.

loans.use: To increase his sales of prepaid mobile telephone cards

loans.name: Ibrogim

texts.ru: Иброгим добрый и трудолюбивый человек. он женат и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Более 17 лет он занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания. Имеет свой магазин и имеет хороший опыт работы в данном бизнесе. Начинал свой бизнес с маленькой суммы. Иброгим имеет широкий ассортимент продуктов и всегда продает свежие продукты. В бизнесе помогают ему его заботливая жена и любящие дети.  Иброгим запрашивает займ для покупки продуктов питания с целью пополнения и увлечения оборотного капитала. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en:
Ibrogim is a good and hard working man. He is married and raising four children. He has been working with buying and selling food products for more than 17 years. He has his own store and has great experience with working in this business. He started his business with a small sum of money. Ibrogim has a wide assortment of products and always sells fresh products. His caring wife and loving children help him in his business. 

Ibrogim requests a loan for the purchase of food products with an aim to replenish and increase working capital. He hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her banana vending business.

Christina has been in this business for 3 years. Christina earns additional income from selling rice and a general store.

Christina has sustained her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her banana vending business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been a farmer in Nakuru town for the past five years. He plants cash crops such as maize and beans and it has been very profitable. He is 34 years old, married to Ruth and they have three children.

This will be his fourth loan from KADET LTD and he plans to use it to buy seeds for planting and also use part of it to pay laborers for ploughing the land. With the anticipated profits, Peter plans to pay school fees for his children.

In the future, Peter hopes to grow his farming business and make more income. He also hopes to form a farmers' union and establish a better business platform for farmers in terms of better prices for their produce.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay laborers.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James used his previous loan to buy farm inputs and pay labor costs. He was able to buy the inputs he needed and his business was very profitable. He repaid the entire loan in a timely manner. 

Besides flower farming, he now plants cash crops, which allow him to earn additional income and cater to his family's needs.

This will be his third loan. James plans to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds. Because it is a rainy season, he hopes to make more profits. He plans to use the profits from his business to pay school fees for his children.

In the future, James hopes to grow his farming business and make more income so that he can improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Dishon

texts.en:
Dishon is 51 years old.  He is married, with four children in school.  He sells cabbages.  He has been in this business for the past 22 years, and he earns a monthly income of KES 15,000 from the business.


This is his first loan from KADET LTD.  He was introduced to KADET by one of its field officers.  Dishon will use the loan to purchase more cabbages from farmers to sell in his business. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children.


He also hopes to purchase a truck to aid in his cabbage business.

loans.use: To purchase a greater stock of cabbages to sell

loans.name: Sakhibjamal

texts.ru: Сахибжамал 45 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей – младшей дочери 9 лет. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Сахибжамал занимается полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес 20 лет назад.   Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний  день,  Сахибжамал имеет в хозяйстве 2 коровы, 6 овец, и 0,85 га, где она выращивает арбузы, огрурцы и кукурузу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сахибжамал обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку удобрений и ядохимикатов.  Доходы от кредита Сахибжамал планирует частично вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства, чтобы оплатить контракт на учебу для старших сыновей.
texts.en:
Sakhibjamal is 45 years old, married and has four children - her youngest daughter is nine years old. As the main source of income for her family, Sakhibjamal works with field crop cultivation and livestock breeding, after having started this business 20 years ago. Thanks to persistent work Sakhibjamal currently has two cows, six sheep and 0.85 hectares of land on her farm, where she grows melons, cucumbers and corn.

With an aim to further develop her business, Sakhibjamal turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of fertilizers and pesticides. Sakhibjamal plans to invest the income from the loan partly in further expanding her farm, and to pay for the studies of her older sons.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Blandina

texts.en:
Blandina is a 51-year-old married woman and mother of eight children; two of her children are in school.

Blandina is in an agricultural business; she raises pigs in the Philippines. Blandina requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Blandina has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her pig business.

In the future, Blandina would like to save money so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jyldyzkan

texts.ru:
Жылдызкан 49 лет, вдова, имеет 6 детей. Жылдызкан в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1995 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Начав этот бизнес с покупки коровы на сумму в 15,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний  день  в хозяйстве Жылдызкан имеется 2 коровы, 2 теленка и 1 овца, а также 2,8 га орошаемой земли , где она выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячная прибыль от продажи молока составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жылдызкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку бычков на откорм и перепродажу.  Доходы от кредита Жылдызкан планирует вложить в оплату обучения для дочери.
texts.en:
Jyldyzkan is 49 years old, widowed, and has 6 children. As the main source of income for her family, Jyldyzkan has been raising livestock and growing crops since 1995. After starting her business with a sum of 15,000 som (KGS), Jyldyzkan presently keeps 2 cows, 2 calves and 1 sheep, and has 2.8 hectares of irrigated land where she grows beans. Her monthly profits from sales of milk total 10,000 som (KGS).

In order to continue developing her business, Jyldyzkan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves for fattening and resale. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into her daughter's education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who owns a food business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 9 years. Rosalinda earns additional income from a coffee shop.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

She dreams of saving money, so that she can expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 33 years old. She is married to Duncan and together they have a 10-year-old child. She operates a beauty salon and has been in the business for the past nine years.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD. She was introduced to us by one of our field officers. She will use the loan to purchase hair relaxers, hair weaves and hair conditioners for use in her salon.

She hopes to start a beauty and hair dressing college.

loans.use: to purchase hair relaxers, hair weaves and hair conditioners for use in her salon.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is 60 years old and married with 5 children.

Gaudiosa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store.

Gaudiosa has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Gaudiosa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 37 years old, from Nakuru and is married with three children who are aged between nine and three years old.

Julius has a charcoal business that he has been doing for the past 12 years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy more sacks of charcoal to add to his stock for sale.

He hopes to expand his business in the future and take care of his family well.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: David

texts.es: David, tiene la edad  de 29 años, está soltero,  vive con sus padres, actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar   insumos como abonos y algunas fumigaciones para el café y el maiz y ayudarse con la mano de obra. El tiene pensado comprar los insumos para mantener el café y la plantación de maíz en excelente estado y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
David, 29, is single and currently lives with his parents.  With the loan he plans to buy supplies such as fertilizer and some fumigants for the coffee and corn, and to help pay for labor.  He plans to buy the supplies to keep the coffee and the corn crop in excellent condition and to be able to generate more profit and have a better quality of life and economic stability.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  Previously he had not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for coffee and corn.

loans.name: Vinh

texts.en:
Vinh was born in 1957. She has two children, both of whom are married. 

Her husband retired with a pension of 2,000,000 VND. She earns 3,000,000 VND per month from her tailoring business. Her family's total income is 5,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in the SEDA crediting program since 2006. During the last cycle, she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy more cloth to sew and sell. Then she would be able to buy some furniture for her small house.

loans.use: to buy more cloth to sew and sell.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a 26-year-old single man from Nakuru. Denis has a grocery business that he has been doing for the past 6 years.

Denis has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy more onions, tomatoes and green peppers to add to his stock for sale. He says his business will do well after the loan and hopes to see his business expand.

He hopes to own a car in the near future.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, green peppers, etc.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 40 years old, married and supports a happy family of three. He has run a clothes shop for the last five years, earning a monthly income of 35,000 KES. 

This is his third loan of 70,000 KES from KADET.  He plans to restock his shop with new and used clothes for sale, a variety of clothes for men, women and children that will meet the demands of his growing clients. 

The anticipated profits will be used to purchase used clothes that are cheaper to buy. His future dreams is to expand his business and employ more workers.

loans.use: to purchase new and used clothes for sale

loans.name: Gulya

texts.ru: Гуле 37лет, замужем, имеет 6 детей. Гуля работает поваром в школе села Торткул и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Гуля занимается изготовлением хлеба и выпечки. Начав этот бизнес в 2002 году с суммы в 2,500 сом, потраченной на покупку мешка муки и жарочного шкафа, Гуля приложила все усилия для развития своего бизнеса в домашних условиях.  Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний  день,  Гуля арендует помещение и имеет в наличии духовку большого размера. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Гуля обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку духовой печи новой модели.  Доходы от кредита Гуля планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса и создание рабочих мест.
texts.en:
Gulya is 37 years old, married, and has six children. Gulya works as a cook at a school in the village Tort-kul, and as an additional source of income for her family, Gulya works with baking bread and pastries. After having started this business in 2002 with a sum of 2,500 som (KGS), which was spent on purchase of bags of flour and on ovens, Gulya has made every effort to develop her household business. Thanks to persistent work, Gulya currently rents premises and has an oven.

With an aim to further expand her business, Gulya turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of an oven of new model. Gulya plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her business and creating jobs.

loans.use: to purchase an oven for baking

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business. Daisy has been in this business for 5 years. Daisy earns more income from food vending.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Sadokat

texts.ru: Садокат трудолюбивая и активная девочка. Она обращалась в ООО МЗО «ИМОН Интернешнл» и прошла тренинг по «Старт-ап», получив займ она хочет начать свой бизнес по выращиванию скота. Она дома имеет все условия для содержания скота. Садокат запрашивает займ для покупки мелкого рогатого скота и начать свой бизнес в этом направлении, чтобы достичь свои цели. Она очень надеется на вашу доброту которая позволит ей начать свой бизнес.
texts.en: Sadokat is a hard-working and active young woman. She has contacted IMON International and took a course on business start-up. With her new loan, she would like to start her own business raising livestock. At home, she has all the necessary conditions to keep animals. Sadokat is requesting a loan to purchase sheep and goats and launch her animal raising business, in order to reach her career goals. She hopes very much for your help in helping her start her business.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 37 years old and married with 6 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Virginia has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from selling bananas.

Virginia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Mairambubu

texts.ru: Майрамбубу 52 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Майрамбубу занимается полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес  после распада Советского Союза.   Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний  день,  Майрамбубу имеет в хозяйстве 1 корову, 5 овцематок, 1 лошадь и 2 га земли, где она выращивает фасоль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Майрамбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку одной коровы и 10 овцематок.  Доходы от кредита Майрамбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Mairambubu is 52 years old, married, and has four children. As a main source of income for her family, Mairambubu works with field crop cultivation and livestock breeding, after having started this business after the collapse of the Soviet Union. Thanks to persistent work, Mairambubu currently has one cow, five ewes (female sheep), one horse and two hectares of land on her farm, where she grows beans. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Mairambubu turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of a cow and ten ewes. Mairambubu plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her farm.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and ten sheep

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea lives with her family in Kampong Cham Province. She is a married woman and responsible for two married and two single children. 

She cultivates rice crops in order to generate income. With this income, she is able to provide daily sustenance, clothing and allowances for her children. She has been in this type of business for many years and typically earns around USD 5.00 per day.

In order to improve and upgrade her standard of living, Chea is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 in order to purchase a motorcycle for personal and business use. She hopes to obtain the loan from our lender; this will be her seventh loan from HKL. 

Chea is very determined to make her business more successful and progressive in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for personal and business use.

loans.name: Bunavsha

texts.ru: Бунавша трудолюбивая и добрая молодая женщина, ей 19 лет. Муж является фермером. Она обратилась в ООО МЗО «ИМОН Инернешнл» и прошла курсы по «Старт- ап», чтобы начать свой бизнес в сфере пошива детской  и мужской одежды. Она серьёзно относится к бизнесу, она хочет  достичь высоты бизнеса и быть лучшей швеёй. Данный момент она хочет закупить машинку для вышивания. С этой целью она запрашивает займ в размере 2000 сомони.
texts.en:
Bunavsha is a hard working and good young woman, who is 19 years old. Her husband is a farmer. She turned to the organization "IMON International" and took courses on "Start-ups", in order to start her business in the area of sewing children's and men's clothing. 

Bunavsha is serious about business, and she wants to do well in business and be a better seamstress. Currently she wants to purchase a machine from embroidery. With this aim she requests a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni.

loans.use: To purchase of machine for embroidery

loans.name: Aizada

texts.ru: Айзаде 34 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Айзада занимается изготовлением национальных войлочных ковров «шырдак», начав этот бизнес  в 2000 году с суммы в 1,000 сом, потраченной на закуп войлока.   Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний  день,  Айзада имеет в оборотном капитале 50,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айзада обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку войлока.  Доходы от кредита Айзада планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса, а в будущем мечтает построить дом для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Aizada is 34 years old, married and has three children. As a main source of income for her family, Aizada works with manufacturing national felt carpets ("shyrdak"), after having started this business in 2000 with a sum of 1,000 som (KGS), which she spent on purchasing felt. Thanks to persistent work, Aizada currently has a working capital of 50,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further developing her business, Aizada turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of felt. Aizada plans to invest the income from the loan in expanding her business, and she dreams of building a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase felt for carpet manufacturing

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 47 years old and the single mother of three children. 

She runs an agro-vet business in the town of Naivasha where she sells veterinary products and farm products such as fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings. She has been in the business for the last four years and it has been very profitable.

This will be her fifth loan; she plans to build a biogas plant in her homestead with this loan. With the anticipated profits from her business she plans to pay school fees for her children.

In the future, Jane hopes to grow her business, make more income and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To build a biogas plant.

loans.name: Chiko

texts.en:
Chiko is a married man who lives with his wife and three children, ages 1 and 3 years old. 

Because of his need to generate an income so that he could improve his family’s wellbeing, Chiko began his business of buying and selling coconuts. His main clients are the neighboring community members. 

Chiko has been a part of Yehu Microfinance Trust for one year; the Trust made it possible for him to set up his business in a more comfortable environment. Chiko is now requesting a loan. He will use the money from his first Kiva loan to buy sacks of coconuts for resell. This loan will allow him to increase the opportunities in the market, such as responding to new customers that have been referred by the current buyers and capturing the attention of new buyers.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts for resell.

loans.name: Jiparakhan

texts.ru: Жыпаркан 31 год, замужем, воспитывает сына. Супруг находится на заработках в России. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Жыпаркан занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес  в 2007 году с суммы в 2,000 сом.  Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний  день,  Жыпаркан имеет в своем хозяйстве 3 дойной коровы с приплодом, 14 овец и 1 лошадь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жыпаркан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку одной дойной коровы и 10 овец.  Доходы от кредита Жыпаркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса, а в будущем мечтает купить машину для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Jiparakhan is 31 years old, married and raising a son. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. As the main source of income for her family, Jiparakhan works with livestock breeding, after having started this business in 2007 with a sum of 2,000 som (KGS). Thanks to persistent work, Jiparakhan currently has three dairy cows with offspring, 14 sheep and one horse at her farm. 

With an aim to further develop his business, Jiparakhan turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of a dairy cow and ten sheep. Jiparakhan plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her business, and she dreams for buying a car for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and ten sheep

loans.name: Santa Teresita Group

texts.es:
Las 19 integrantes del grupo santa teresita son de la ciudad de Caacupé, ellas son muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que se esfuerzan por poder ayudar a sus familias y darles lo que necesitan para poder vivir dignamente.
Geronima forma parte del grupo, y ella nos comenta que por medio de la venta de pollos ha ayudado a su familia a que puedan tener los medios suficientes para salir adelante. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo como microempresaria y seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos, con lo cual podrá comprar más pollos y de esa forma seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The 19 members of the group "Santa Teresita" are from the city of Caacupé. They are hardworking and enterprising women who strive to help their families and provide them with what they need to have a decent life.

Geronima is part of this group. She says that selling chickens has helped her family acquire sufficient income to get ahead. Her goal is to continue growing as a micro-entrepreneur and helping her family.

Geronima is requesting a loan so that she can buy more chickens. This will allow her to continue working and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Alan

texts.es:
Alan, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres en una casa en anticretico, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Fátima de la ciudad de La Paz.
El estudió Derecho y actualmente percibe ingresos ya que es abogado y trabaja por más de ocho horas en una empresa privada ya que debe ayudar a pagar los gastos de alimentación y servicios básicos de su familia es por eso que solicita el crédito, por que escribió un libro relacionado con su profesión y no le alcanza el dinero para las impresiones del libro.
El sueño de Alan, es mejorar sus ingresos y poder independizarse  definitivamente pues ya puso su propio buffet de abogado y está en la fase de conseguir más clientes para generar más ingresos y   de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la tercera vez que solicita el crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Alan is single, and he does not have children.  He lives with his parents in an “anticretico” [a special rental arrangement where rent is considered a loan to the property owner and is returned in full when the rental period is over].  The house is located in the Villa Fátima area of the city of La Paz.

He studied law, and he currently earns income as an attorney.  He works for a private company for over eight hours a day.  He needs to help pay his family’s food and basic services expenses, and that is why he is requesting the loan.  

He wrote a book related to his profession, but he does not have enough money to print the book.

Alan’s dream is to improve his income and be able to definitely become independent.  He set up his own law practice, and he is in the phase of getting more clients in order to generate more income.  This way he will improve his quality of life.

This is the third time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay the cost of printing a book that he wrote about his legal profession.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 37 years old, married, and blessed with three children that she supports. She owns rental houses that she operates earning a monthly income of KES 18,000. She applied for her second loan of KES. 100,000 from KADET. She plans to finish up the pending construction work and furnish her rental houses. 

The anticipated profits will be reinvested in constructing more houses. Her dream for the future is to expand her business and to support her family and the needy.

loans.use: To finish up construction and furnish her rental houses

loans.name: Ma. Jovy

texts.en:
Ma. Jovy is 43 years old and married with 4 children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Ma. Jovy has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods and groceries to sell in her store.

Ma. Jovy has been in this business for 3 years.  In the future, Ma. Jovy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods and groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan tiene 57 años de edad, es separado, tiene  tres hijos mayores que ya son independiente a él y que también lo ayudan en todo lo que hace. Don Juan empezó a trabajar como vendedor ambulante hace mucho tiempo. Llevaba todo tipo de productos a vender a cuotas, actualmente se dedica a los servicios de alquileres para todo tipo de acontecimientos ya sea sillas, mesas, cubiertos y otros.
 Todo esto logró comprarse gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo, además compró un camioncito  para poder satisfacer la necesidad de su clientela.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de más sillas que tiene de oferta., pues eso le será de más ayuda para poder seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece a Kiva y a fundación paraguaya por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Juan is 57 years old, separated, has three grown children that are  independent and also help him in everything that he does. Don Juan began working as a traveling vendor a long time ago. He carried all types of products to sell monthly, now he does rental services for a living for all types of events such as chairs, tables, coverings, etc.
   He managed buying all of this thanks to his work and effort. Additionally he bought a small truck in order to satisfy the needs of his customers. He is requesting the loan in order to purchase more chairs than he offers now. This will help to him in order to continue offering a good service to his customers. He is grateful to Kiva and the Paraguayan Foundation for the opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy chairs to rent.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 10 years, Daisy has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish to sell. In the future, Daisy would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina, 47 years old, is married and has 5 children, two of them in school. Gina works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 5 years, Gina has operated a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as detergent, canned goods and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business and to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Bengelita

texts.en: Bengelita, 45 years old, is married and has 1 child. Bengelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. Bengelita has been in this business for 9 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries to sell in her store. Bengelita hopes to save money to expand her business to continue sending her son to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza, 53 years old, is married and has 4 children. She works hard to provide for her family. Esperanza runs a direct sales business in the Philippines. She has sold Natasha shoe products for 10 years and also earns an income from her general store.

Esperanza has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional products to sell. She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additonal products to sell

loans.name: Moffat

texts.en:
Moffat is a 39-year-old retail shop proprietor in Kisauni, Mombasa. He is married. His business has been in operation for the past seven years and it is doing great. 

This is his second business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil, and washing detergents. 

He will use the anticipated profits to plough back into the business. He hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil, and washing detergents

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng, age 58, lives with her husband and children in Kompong Cham province. Two of her children are already married and the remaining two are still single. Heng earns a living by planting and harvesting rice on her own farmlands located near her house. She also runs a grocery store in the village to make additional income.

Heng would like to ask for a loan in the amount of KHR 3,000,000 to purchase grocery items such as noodles, chocolates, sweets, shampoos, detergent powders, spices, and canned foods to sell in her store. With the help of the loan, Heng will be able to satisfy her customers and add more customers to her business. She will use her generated income to support her children in their studies and is hoping to send them to college once they complete high school.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
This is Nida, 32, resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, a cook, and mother of two children. She,together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Nida operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell them with a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy higher quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands.  

Nida dreams to be able to give all her children a high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of household products and merchandise needed in her business

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen is 50 years old, married, and has been blessed with five children - five married children and one single children. She lives with her husband and children in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. The farming business is the only source of the family’s income. She, together with her husband, plants and grows rice and potatoes for sale. She is thankful to her business that allows her to provide basic necessities to her children.

At this time, she is asking for additional capital of KHR 1,000,000 to purchase potato plants and fertilizers for farming purpose. She believes that she can obtain a good harvest in during crop season through using the loan and her patience. In years to come, she wants to purchase extra farmland to increase her production.

loans.use: to purchase potato plants and fertilizers for farming purpose.

loans.name: Mary Boke

texts.en:
Mary has still been selling bananas for the past five years with great success. She buys bananas from upcountry (Kisii) and supplies them to her customers in Mombasa. 

This is Mary’s second business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use it to purchase more bananas. She will use the anticipated profits to open another business and to repay her loan. Mary hopes to purchase a piece of land and build her own permanent house.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, oranges, pineapples, mangoes, kale and tomatoes.

loans.name: Luiz Amado

texts.es: Luís Amado, tiene la edad  de 56 años, está divorciado,  vive solo   actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar almacigo de café para su posterior siembra en una pequeña propiedad de hectárea y media la cual se encuentra baldía y además comprar  insumos como abonos y fumigaciones y herbicidas  El tiene pensado comprar  este almacigo para poder sembrarlo en dicha propiedad y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica y poder pagar el estudio de los hijos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Luis Amado, 56, is divorced and currently lives by himself.  With this loan he plans to buy coffee seedlings to later plant on a small 1.5 hectare parcel of land that he has that is currently barren.  He will also use the loan to buy supplies such as organic fertilizers, fumigants and herbicides.  He plans to buy these plants so that he can transplant them on his own property, allowing him to generate more income and a have a better quality of life.  This way he can have economic stability and can pay for the education of his children.  This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not taken  loans from the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan with better terms and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Orias

texts.en:
Orias, 37, is married and has 5 children: Ameria, 10; Meyfira, 8; Angelica, 6; all attending elementary school;  Farel, 4 and Zefanya, 3 months old. Orias is a truck driver who also operates a kiosk business in front of his house in order to generate extra income. In his kiosk, Orias provides daily basic needs and mobile phone recharges. His wife assists him in looking after the kiosk when he is away at work. 

Orias is planning to add more stock to his kiosk as half of his business income has been used to purchase a new display window and a small cool box to store soft drinks. Orias went to TLM and applied for a loan of IDR 4,500,000. He would like to purchase more kiosk items such as instant noodles, snacks, frying oil, bath soap, soft drinks, mosquito coils, detergents, shampoo, etc.

loans.use: to purchase more items for his kiosk

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 29 years old, is married and blessed with one child. For the last 4 years, she has operated a tailoring and dressmaking business, making a monthly income of KES 8,000. 

Josephine has applied for her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to acquire more dress materials to meet her customers' demands. Josephine will reinvest the anticipated profits. Her future dreams are to do good business and to be prosperous

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials for dressmaking and tailoring

loans.name: Dafit

texts.en:
Dafit is a 40-year-old man who is married to Salomi, 37 years old. Dafit has three children: Andi, 17, in his second year of senior high school; Nening, 10, in 6th grade; Jen, 8 months old. Dafit supports his family by selling agricultural products such as bananas, chili, coconuts, etc. and he also produces coconut oil from his own farm.

Dafit is thinking of increasing his family's income by starting a new business - selling wood for building materials and furniture stores - as he has access to a wood seller from his village. Dafit plans to buy and resell the wood to a furniture store downtown. He is therefore requesting a loan from TLM of IDR 10,000,000. Dafit is hoping that the loan will help him improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase wood and resell it to the furniture store

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida, 62, is a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married and has children. She and her children manage their own household while operating the business. Aida works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Aida operates a biscuit retailing business. She buys biscuits from a wholesaler, repacks them and sells them per piece/pack for a profit. Products can range from crackers to cookies and other such products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options Aida offers. She also does direct selling for additional income. Aida's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Aida is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan, which she will use to buy more quantities and varieties of biscuit products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Aida hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future and her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of biscuit products

loans.name: Alvaro Jose

texts.es: Álvaro José, de 28 años de edad, casado con un hijo menor de edad, tiene pro profesión cadete del ejercito, el está solicitando  financiamiento para hacerle mejoras a su casa de habitación como es hacer división internas, ya que por falta de capital no las había hecho, en la actualidad está solicitando el financiamiento para la compra de material  de construcción como: bloques, cemento, cal, hierro, zinc, clavos, alambre, piedrin, entre otros.
texts.en: Álvaro José is 28 years old, married, and has a child who is still a minor.
