Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world.  This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities.  Also, in winter, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms.  Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm.  In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss and improve heating systems. We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health.

loans.use: To buy materials to insulate and repair her house.

loans.name: Belarmina

texts.en: Belarmina is 50 years old. She is from Cortes, Bohol. She is married with five grown children. Belarmina owns a sari-sari store that caters to the needs of her neighborhood. She sells basic household items like seasonings, canned goods, noodles, eggs, toiletries, snack food and soft drinks. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of canned sardines, cooking oil and soft drinks. She is hoping that with the loan, she will not be lacking items needed by her customers. Her income will be for her family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy additional canned sardines, cooking oil and soft drinks

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es: Flor  de 58 años de edad vive al sur occidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla y se dedica a una actividad comercial, pues tiene una miscelánea donde vende artículos variados, como accesorios femeninos y para el hogar, útiles de papelería y refrescos. Su negocio inició desde el 2006 vendiendo pocos productos y paso a paso fue incrementando su oferta y comprando vitrinas, que surtió de mercancías de las que sus clientes más solicitaban.  Sus ventas las realiza principalmente de contado, aunque tiene  también clientes a quienes les vende a crédito, en plazos cortos, de acuerdo a sus posibilidades de pago. Desde hace un tiempo, decidió potencializar aun mas el negocio y aprovechar su mercado, para vender refrescos y bebidas los fines de semanas. A Flor le ha ido muy bien y ha logrado levantar su vivienda actualmente. Su meta mas adelante es separar los dos negocios, adecuando las instalaciones con dos locales, en uno vendería las mercancías y en el otro los bebidas y refrescos. Sus negocios están creciendo y cuando se trata de comprar a Flor le resulta un gran desafío, adquirir todo lo que sus clientes le encargan. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos de papelería y refrescos, para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y lograr hacer una oferta con precios especiales, productos de sus compras en mayor volumen y de contado y esto es justamente lo que garantiza el éxito de la inversión con su credikiva.
texts.en: Flor is 58 years old and lives in the southwestern part of the city of Barranquilla. She is a salesperson and sells various merchandize like ladies accessories, items for the home, stationary items and refreshments. She began her business in 2006 selling some products and little by little she increased her wares and bought displays that she filled with merchandize that her customers needed most. Flor’s sales are mainly cash down although she also sells on credit to some customers on short terms depending on what they agree. Sometime ago, Flor decided to take advantage of the market and began to sell refreshments and drinks during the weekends. She has done very well and has been able to see her store grow. Flor’s goal is to separate the two businesses, by adapting two areas where she would sell merchandise in one and drinks and refreshments in the other. Her businesses are growing and she has to buy everything that her customers want so it is a great challenge to her. This is why she needs a credikiva, her first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, she will buy stationary products and refreshments to be able to meet and satisfy the needs of her customers. Flor wants to have sales with special prices, since she will be able to buy in greater quantities and this will guarantee the success her credikiva investment.

loans.use: buy stationary products and refreshments.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Don Juan tiene 45 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Desde los 10 años de edad él se dedica a la agricultura, debido a que su papá se desempeñaba en este oficio y por falta de recursos económicos no podían pagar a personas que le ayudaran a realizar el trabajo. Por lo que sus hermanos, él y su papá realizaban los trabajos. A los 28 años de edad se caso y procreo tres hijos, desde entonces se ha dedicado a cultivar lo propio para mantener a su familia. 

Él cultiva 28,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, los insumos agrícolas los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a tres kilómetros de su casa, luego debe pagar para trasladarlos hasta su casa; posteriormente paga otro transporte para llevarlos hasta donde tiene sus cultivos que esta a medio kilómetro de su vivienda. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundacion Campo, es para comprar los insumos agrícolas para el mantenimiento de los 28,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Esta inversión la realizara con el objetivo de aumentar su producción, mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia, brindándoles el estudio a sus hijos y seguridad.
texts.en:
Juan is 45 years old, married, and has three children.  He has farmed since he was ten years old because that was what his dad did for a living and, due to a lack of economic resources, they were not able to pay people to help them do the work.  That is why he, his brothers, and his dad did all the work.  He got married when he was 28 years old and had three children.  Since then, he has dedicated himself to working his own land to take care of his family.

He farms 28,000 square meters of corn.  He gets his farming supplies in a city that is three kilometers from his house, then he has to pay to ship them to his home.  After that he pays another shipping fee to take them where he has his crops, which is half a kilometer from his house.

The loan he is seeking from Fundación Campo is to buy farming supplies to maintain his 28,000 square meters of corn. He will make this investment with the goal of increasing his production, improving his family's quality of life, and offering his children an education and security.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to maintain his 28,000 square meters of corn

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es: Banco comunal el progreso esta conformado por nueve integrantes y son: Maria Emperatriz, Francisca Betania, Manuel Antonio, Ramona Antonia, Blanca Azucena, Rosa Emilia, Maria de los Angeles, Luisa Amanda, Juan Doroteo, tienen diferentes actividades economicas. Luisa Amanda es la cordinadora del grupo la que velas por lo interese y responsabilidades de cada una de las integrantes con respecto al fiananciamiento, tiene por actividad ecomica una pulperia ubicada en su cas de habitacion el financiamiento lo reguiere para invertir en la misma y comprar productos de consumo diario para el hogar como: aceite por galon, azucar, detergente, papel sanico, pasta de dientes, frijoles, huevos, leche, pastas, hielo, bolsas de gabacha, entre otros.
texts.en: The communal bank El Progreso is comprised of nine members: Maria Emperatriz, Francisca Betania, Manuel Antonio, Ramona Antonia, Blanca Azucena, Rosa Emilia, Maria de los Angeles, Luisa Amanda, and Juan Doroteo, all of whom have different businesses.  Luisa Amanda is the coordinator of the group and oversees the issues and responsabilities of each member from a financial aspect.  She runs a grocery store out of her house and is requesting a loan to buy household daily consumption items such as oil by the gallon, sugar, detergent, toilet tissue, toothpaste, beans, eggs, milk, pasta, ice and bags, among other things.

loans.use: To buy oil in gallons, sugar, detergent, toilet tissue, toothpaste, beans, eggs, milk, pasta, ice, bags, etc.

loans.name: Edwin Yovany

texts.es:
Edwin tiene 28 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Desde que era un niño se dedica a la agricultura, fue su papá quien le enseño. Edwin siembra desde hace 15 años, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, quienes le ayudan a trabajar. 

Comienza sus actividades diarias a las 4:30 a.m. a ordeñar sus vacas, luego las lleva al terreno a pastorear que esta a tres kilómetros de su vivienda. Posteriormente se dirige junto con su familia a trabajar en los 21,000 metros cuadrados de terreno hasta el mediodía; para continuar trabajando como jornal hasta las 5:00 p.m. cuanto termina se retira a su vivienda a descansar. 

Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, él camina cuatro kilómetros hasta llegar a la parada del autobús, para abordar el autobús que lo conduzca al lugar donde realiza sus compras. Posteriormente, se traslada con sus insumos a pie hasta llegar a su casa.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundacion Campo, es para comprar dos vacas. Su objetivo es incrementar su producción de leche y a vez sus ingresos  económicos, que le permitan comprar materiales de construcción para construir su vivienda, puesto que vive en una casa de lámina. Él desea aumentar el número de animales, para producir más leche que le permita brindarle el sustento a su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin, 28, is married and has two children.  He has worked in farming since he was a child, and it was his father who taught him the trade.  For 15 years Edwin has been in business, and he lives with his wife and two children, who help him at work.

He begins his daily activities at 4:30 a.m. when he milks the cows.  Then he takes them out to pasture three kilometers from his home.  Later he and the family work on the 21,000 square meters of land until noon.  Then they continue the workday until 5:00 p.m., when they go home to rest.

In order to buy farm supplies he walks four kilometers to the bus stop and takes a bus to where he shops.  Then he carries the supplies home.

The loan he is requesting through Fundación Campo is to buy two cows.  His goal is to increase milk production as well as his income so he can buy construction materials to build a house.  The one he lives in is made of sheet metal.  He wants to increase his livestock and produce more milk to be able to support his family.

loans.use: To buy two cows.

loans.name: Gudber Gualnerger

texts.es:
GUDBER GUALNERGER tiene 21 años, es soltero vive con sus familiares, en Guaranda Provincia Bolívar.

GUDBER GUALNERGER es asistente de ventas en una fabrica, además se dedica a la agricultura.

Solicita el señor el préstamo para comprar abonos, líquidos mata maleza, urea. Con el apoyo del crédito quiere mejorar la producción.

Realiza sus compras y ventas en la ciudad de Guaranda cada semana. El sueño del señor es incrementar los cultivos.

El desafío al que se enfrenta el señor es seguir trabajando para poder reunir y comprar un bus interprovincial.

En su tiempo libre hace de todo un poco, en especial disfruta cuando son las fiestas de carnaval.
texts.en:
Gudber Gualnerger is 21 years old, single, and lives with his family in Guaranda in the province of Bolívar.

Gudber Gualnerger is an assistant salesperson in a factory and he also farms for a living.

He is asking for this loan to buy fertilizers, liquid weed killer, and urea.  He wants to improve his production with the help of the loan.

He buys and sells in Guaranda every week.  His dream is to increase his crops.

The challenge he faces is that of continuing to work to be able to save up and buy an interprovincial bus.

In his free time he does a little of everything; he especially likes to have a good time during Carnaval.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, liquid weed killer, and urea

loans.name: Khishigdelger

texts.en:
Mrs. Khishigdelger, 27, is a vendor of eyeglasses in the supermarket. She lives with her husband and three-year-old daughter in a small old house with her parents. Actually, her house is too small for five people to live together and it loses heat through the wall and windows. So, she decided to build one more room as an enlargement to her house and insulate the wall with bricks or cement. She really hopes that her home will be comfortable to live in after the renovation. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to buying the building materials to insulate the wall and make other repairs to her bad house.  

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world.  This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities.  Also, in winter, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms.  Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm.  In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss and improve heating systems. We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health.

loans.use: To buy the building materials to make wall insulation and other repairs to her bad house.

loans.name: Ledis

texts.es: Ledis de 29 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad  con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 1 y 2 años, con quienes sueña ver convertidos en profesionales exitosos. Ella tiene un negocio, que inició  como una forma de generar ingresos y apoyar los gastos de su hogar. Esta actividad la  inició cuando una amiga la contactó con una firma que comercializa productos de consumo masivo, mediante guías especializadas o catálogos; con el primer impulso que Ledis le dio a las ventas, le empezó a ir bien, y gradualmente fueron aumentando los pedidos de las mercancías que ella promocionaba en su catalogo y pagaba de contado, para finalmente vendérselos a crédito a sus clientes, en plazos pactados de acuerdo a las posibilidades de cada comprador. Últimamente su clientela ha crecido y ella continúa haciendo pedidos a esta empresa, pero los distribuye tres veces al mes, porque debe esperar recuperar el dinero que tiene en sus cuentas por cobrar, debido a que su capital de trabajo, ante la creciente demanda, no es suficiente para aprovechar cada promoción que se presenta. Esta es la razón por la cual está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará ropa y calzado bajo el pedido de sus clientes.  Su principal sueño es terminar sus estudios y continuar con sus proyectos laborales, para ver a su familia crecer cada día con mayor bienestar.
texts.en:
Ledis, 29, lives in the southern part of the city with her husband and two children, ages 1 and 2, who she wants to become successful professionals.  She has a business she began in order to generate income to help cover household expenses.  She started it with a friend who contacted her about selling mass consumption products through specialized magazines or catalogues.  When Ledis began selling it went well, and gradually orders for merchandise began increasing and she paid cash for goods she sold to customers on credit, based on individual payment capability.  

Lately, her customer base has increased and she continues ordering from the same company, but distributes three times a month because she must wait to collect from her accounts receivable.  Because of the growing demand and her lack of working capital, she is unable to take advantage of discount offers.  Therefore, she is requesting a CrediKiva loan which is her first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She plans to use it to buy clothing and shoes based on customer orders.  Her main goal is to finish her education and continue with her work projects, so she can see her family live a better lifestyle day by day.

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes based on customer orders.

loans.name: Felicita Mabel

texts.es:
La señora Felicita es de la Ciudad de Santaní, es soltera y nos cuenta es propietaria de una despensa y a la venta de bebidas en general, en su propia casa, cuenta con clientela bien formada con buen ingresos mensuales. 
Es un señora muy trabajadora, responsable y muy honesta, según cuenta empezó con un pequeño kiosco vendiendo comidas rápidas. Su sueño de siempre era de tener una despensa bien surtida con muchos clientes. Agradece a la fundación paraguaya porque gracias a su ayuda está cumpliendo su sueño.
La señora Felicita acude a la fundación y a Kiva para solicitar un crédito, el cual desea usar para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, panificados, carnes y demás insumos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes  y aumentar sus ventas diarias la que le motiva cada día para poder salir adelante.
texts.en: Felicita is from the city of Santaní City. She is single and runs a store selling beverages, within her home. She has formed a customer base and brings in a good monthly income. She is a very hardworking, responsible and very honest lady. She tells how she began with a small kiosk selling fast food. Her dream was always to have a well stocked store with many customers. She is grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya because thanks to their help she is fulfilling her dream. Felicita has approached the Foundation and Kiva to request a loan, which she wants to use for the purchase of drinks, dairy products, baked goods, meat and other stock to meet the needs of her customers and increase her daily sales that motivate her every day to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy stock for her store

loans.name: Esmilda

texts.es: Esmilda de 52 años de edad es comerciante se dedica al negocio de pulpería desde hace 20 años, originaria de Estelí,  madre de 5 hijos de los cuales dos están a su cargo, ella realizo estudios hasta segundo año de secundaria pues su situación económica no le permitió culminar sus estudios. Esmilda inicio su actividad con dinero que le dio su anterior esposo para obtener otros ingresos para la familia, este ha sido su primer negocio en el cual se siente satisfecha porque le genera ingresos diarios además cuenta con clientes fijos, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de sus hijos que le ayudan en los tiempos libres, también cuenta con otros ingresos pues recibe remesas de uno de los hijos que esta fuera del país. Solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería en general, arroz, azúcar, jabón, pan, avena, aceite, camisas y pantalones, el cual estima será de ayuda porque podrá ofrecer  a sus clientes otro tipo de productos además de los productos básicos, sus planes futuros es ampliar el área del negocio y crecer en productos hasta llegar a poner su miscelánea, sus metas próximas es   realizarle mejora a su casa de las ganancias que le genere el negocio para  vivir mejor, mantener su negocio activo para poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Esmilda, 52, has been running a grocery store for 20 years.  She is from Estelí and the mother of five children, two of which are still in her care.  She studied until the second year of secondary school but was unable to finish her education because of her economic situation.  

Esmilda started her business with money given her by her previous husband in order to have extra income for the family.  This is her first business and she is very satisfied because of the daily income she makes and the fixed customers she has.  Her children also help out at the store in their free time.  And her other children send money from abroad.

The loan she is requesting is to buy general merchandise such as rice, sugar, soap, bread, oats, oil, shirts and pants.  This will help her offer customers more variety of products.  Her plans for the future include expanding her business to grow into a variety store.  Her near-term goal is to use profits from her business to renovate her house for a better lifestyle, and to keep her business going to support the family.

loans.use: To buy general goods such as rice, sugar, soap, bread, oats, oil, shirts and pants.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: Con su credikiva anterior, Ramiro compró muchos repuestos que vendió y ofreció con ello un efectivo servicio, pues daba respuesta inmediata a sus clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará repuestos de automoviles, pues aumentaron su demanda y tambien necesita comprár productos de sincronización, con los cuales planea aumentar sus ingresos. Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: mucho  gradecimiento por el  apoyo recibido, Ramiro está muy satisfecho, porque este crédito le ayudó a mejorar el servicio al clientes, con un buen surtido  y espera seguir contando con su ayuda.
texts.en:
With his previous CrediKiva loan, Ramiro bought many spare parts which he used to provide effective, immediate service to his customers.  The current loan he is applying for is to buy auto spare parts, because of an increase in demand, and synchronization products to increase income.

His message to Kiva lenders is the following:  Many thanks for the support received.  Ramiro is very satisfied because the loan has helped him improve customer service by adding more variety, and he hopes to continue receiving your support.

loans.use: To buy auto spare parts and synchronization products.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El comité La Amistad” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que se han unido con la intención de ayudarse las unas a las otras y de esa forma poder salir adelante.
Isidora es parte del grupo y comenta que por medio de su trabajo ha podido ayudar a las demás personas de su familia. Es una persona muy sacrificada y con muchas ganas de seguir con lo que está haciendo. Es comerciante, pues se dedica a las ventas en su despensa bien surtida y gracias a eso puede salir adelante y ayudar a su familia con los gastos del día adía.
Isidora solicita el crédito para la compra de yerba, azúcar, leche, panificados, y demás insumos para poder salir adelante y también para poder ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The La Amistad Communal Bank was formed through the union of several neighbors from the city of Santaní.  These women are heads of their families who got together in order to help each other and be able to get ahead.

Isidora is part of the group and she tells us that, through her work, she has been able to help the people in her family.  She is a very selfless person who really wants to keep doing what she is doing.  She is a shopkeeper, as she sells from her well stocked shop for a living and, thanks to this, she is able to get ahead and help her family with their everyday expenses.

Isidora is asking for a loan to buy herbs, sugar, milk, baked goods, and other supplies to be able to get ahead and also to be able to offer her customers more variety.

loans.use: to buy herbs, sugar, milk, baked goods, and other supplies

loans.name: Evila Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Evila tiene 58 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos. Ella desde muy pequeña a trabajado arduamente, su mamá  la abandono y por ser la mayor de sus hermanos. Se vio obligada a trabajar prestando sus servicios para otras personas. A los 19 años de edad se caso y procreo cuatro hijos, su compañero de vida la abandono debido a la guerra civil que se dio en el país en la década de los 80. Con mucho esfuerzo trabajo junto a sus hijos dedicándose a cultivar lo propio para sostener a su hijos.  

Ella cultiva 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz en compañía de sus hijos. Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, recorre nueve kilómetros hasta llegar al lugar donde realiza sus compras. Luego paga un medio de trasporte para trasladarse con los insumos hasta su casa. Posteriormente le paga a un carretero para que le lleve los insumos hasta donde tiene sus cultivos que esta a un kilómetro de distancia.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundacion Campo, es para comprar los insumos agrícolas para brindarle mantenimiento a sus 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Su objetivo es aplicar los mejores fertilizantes para incrementar su producción y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, para tener mayores posibilidades de desarrollo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Evila is 58 years old and has four children. From a very young age she has worked very hard since her mother abandoned her and she had to take care of her siblings since she was the oldest and was forced to work for other people. Mrs. Evila got married at 19 and had four children; her life partner abandoned her because of the civil war that erupted in her country during the 1980s. With a lot of hard work and with her children she dedicated her time to cultivate some land to care and give her children what they need.

Mrs. Evila harvests 21,000 square meters of corn with the help from her children. To buy agricultural materials she has to travel nine kilometers to make her purchases, pays for transportation to carry the merchandize to her home and later on pays a carter to carry the items about a kilometer where her crops are.

The loan from Fundacion Campo is to buy agricultural products to provide maintenance to her 21,000 square meters of corn. Her goal is to put better fertilizers to increase her production, improve the quality of life of her family and have greater possibilities to get ahead in life.

loans.use: buy agricultural products to provide maintenance to her 21,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Altanzaya

texts.en: Mrs. Altanzaya, 26, is unmarried and sells casual clothes in the shopping center in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives with her parents and they both are retired. They own an old house and a small plot of land in the ger district, an area of city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. In the last several years, her house has not had any repairs or renovation and now it has too much heat loss and emissions through the ceiling and roof. It costs too much for smoky coal to warm her home in winter. So, she decided to repair the ceiling and roof. Now she needs a loan to buy building materials to insulate her house to reduce the emissions.

loans.use: To buy building materials to insulate her house

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo está constituido por 16 integrantes muy activas y muy trabajadoras quienes han sobresalido siempre en todos los ciclos por su dinamismo y unidad. Ellas desean seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
Eliodora es una persona muy trabajadora, que todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas del día ya que desde temprano sale a vender la leche que tiene. Es una persona con muchos ideales, metas y objetivos, por los cuales día a día lucha para poder cumplir.
En vista a sus metas es que sigue trabajando, y por ello solicita el préstamo para la compra de leche, con lo cual podrá seguir vendiendo y cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 16 very active and hardworking members who have always excelled in all their loan cycles because of their dynamism and unity.  They want to keep working and, in this way, be able to reach the highest level of their program.

Eliodora is a very hardworking person who starts work in the very early hours of the day every day, as she goes out early to sell the milk she has.  She is a person who has many dreams, goals, and objectives and she struggles day after day in order to achieve them.

She keeps on working with her goals in mind, which is why she is asking for this loan to buy milk, with which she will be able to keep selling and satisfying her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell

loans.name: Tsogtgerel

texts.en:
Mr. Tsogtgerel, 39, runs the freight transportation around Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He lives with his wife and his two children in a common apartment. He bought his apartment in 2007 and since then he has not made any repairs to it. During winter time, his rooms become cold because of the heat loss through the windows and door and he uses a furnace that uses smoky and toxic coal to heat his rooms. He wants to replace the windows and door with new ones. The loan will dedicated to buying the building materials to insulate and repair his house. 

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world.  This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities.  Also, in winter, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms.  Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm.  In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss and improve heating systems. We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health.

loans.use: To buy building materials to insulate and repair his house.

loans.name: Hanny Group

texts.es: Los integrantes siguen trabajando es su actividad que tienen, ellos quieren decirle a Kiva y a Visión Fund “gracias por sus préstamos, les agradecemos su interés en ayudarnos a crecer los negocios. El señor Baldomero tiene 42 años de edad, el es casado, el tiene 4 hijos 3 varones y una mujeres, estudian 2 de sus hijos la preparatoria, el tiene una tienda de abarrotes, el solicito su préstamo para comprar jabón, escobas, pino azúcar, huevo, haba, frijol para surtir su tienda de abarrotes,  el inicio hace 2 meses este negocio para obtener ingresos para sus hijos que están estudiando,  a él le gusta atender bien a sus clientes, el utiliza las ganancias para invertir en mercancía y para la alimentación de la familia. El está feliz con el préstamo que va a recibir va a coamprar mercancia para ampliar su negocio. sus sueños y esperanzas son abrir otra tienda y que la familia este bien.
texts.en: The members have kept working on their individual jobs and want to tell Kiva and Vision Fund, “thank you for your loans, we are grateful for your interest in helping us expand our businesses.” Mr. Baldomero is 42 years old, married and has 4 children, 3 boys and 1 girl, two of them are high school. He has a small grocery store and needs the loan to stock it by buying soap, brooms, sugar, eggs, broad beans, and beans. Mr. Baldomero began his business 2 months ago to have income for his children who are in school. He enjoys taking good care of his customers and uses his earnings to buy merchandize and feed his family. He is happy with the loan that he will receive and will buy merchandize to expand his business. Mr. Baldomero’s dreams and hopes are to open another store and that his family is well.

loans.use: buy soap, brooms, sugar, eggs, broad beans, and beans.

loans.name: 3.8.161.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa Lê has a service business repairing electronics. She is requesting a loan to purchase electrical and electronic devices to resell.

Hoa Lê is 28 years old and married with one child. She is the group leader of the 3.8.161.Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of three members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

In 2011, Hoa Lê joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hoa Lê has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women  Hoa Lê has been involved in this business for four years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hoa Lê hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase electronic devices to resell.

loans.name: Milagro De La Paz

texts.es:
La señora Milagro tiene 45 años de edad, tiene dos hijos uno de 10 y otro de 12 años de edad. Ella  se dedica al comercio informal de refrescos naturales, yuca, panes, entre otros. Tiene seis años de realizar esta actividad, comenzó en el momento en que su esposo la abandono, para formar una familia. 

Entonces ella quedo sola con sus dos hijos pequeños, por lo que se vio obligada a buscar algo que le generara ingresos para sus hijos. De esa manera empezó a realizar ventas para obtener el ingreso diario, ya que antes solo se dedicaba a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa y al cuido de sus hijos; pero luego todo cambio y se convirtió en madre y padre a la vez. 

Ella compra la mercadería en la ciudad más cercana, en cantidades menores, para brindarles lo necesario a sus hijos. El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundacion Campo, es para comprar verduras, frutas, pan, entre otros y medicina para uno de sus hijos, ya que tiene problemas de salud. Por esa razón, ella necesita invertir en su negocio para obtener mejores ingresos. Pues debido a su situación económica no puede tener el dinero por junto para trabajar y solventar la dificultad con su hijo. Ella manifiesta que desea ver a sus hijos desempeñándose en la sociedad, de forma independiente y siendo útiles a la sociedad. Ella dice que es un gran reto pero confía en Dios poder lograrlo.
texts.en:
Milagro is 45 years old.  She has two children, one 10-year-old and one 12-year-old.  She sells natural soft drinks, yucca, bread, and other things informally for a living.  She has been doing this for six years now, having started when her husband abandoned her to start a new family.

At that time, she was left alone with her two small children and so she had to find something that would make money for her children.  That is how she began to make sales and earn a daily income, as before all she did was take care of the housework and watch her children, until everything changed and she became their mother and father at the same time.  

She buys her merchandise in the closest city, in small quantities, in order to provide her children with what they need.  The loan she is seeking through Fundación Campo is to buy vegetables, fruit, and bread, among other things, and to buy medicine for one of her children, as he has health problems.  That is why she needs to invest in her business to make more profits, as her financial situation does not allow her to have enough money to work and cover her son's problem.  She tells us that she wants to see her children do well on their own and be useful in society.  She says that this is a huge challenge, but that she trusts in God that she will be able to overcome it.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, and bread, among other things, and to buy medicine for one of her children, as he has health problems.

loans.name: Yarley Emilse

texts.es: Yarley con su anterior credikiva compró  mercancia variada como ropa, calzado, perfumes, repuestos para vehiculos y electrodomésticos. Ahora tiene nuevos encargos como articulos de perfumeria, cosméticos y ropa, por eso acude por segunda vez a un credikiva, al que aspira a multiplicar mediante su disciplinado trabajo. Su mensaje sus financiadores es el siguiente: " Estoy muy agradecida por la ayuda recibida y espero seguir contando con el respaldo de ustedes para mejorar mi calidad de vida. "
texts.en: With her last loan, Yarley bought various merchandise such as clothing, shoes, perfumes, spare auto parts, and home appliances.  Now she has new orders for things such as perfume, cosmetics, and clothing.  That is why she is seeking a Kiva loan for the second time, which she hopes to multiply through her disciplined work.  Her message to her lenders is the following, "I am very thankful for the help I have received and I hope to continue to county on your support to improve my quality of life."

loans.use: to buy perfumes, cosmetics, and clothing

loans.name: Rosalbina Maria

texts.es: Rosalbina de 56 años de edad  se dedica a la elaboración de productos en cuero, cuerinas y similares también   vende  mercancía variada, especialmente ropa y accesorios  que combina con los productos de cuero, plástico y lona que elabora, entre los que se encuentran el calzado, los bolsos billeteras etc.  Su actividad como comerciante la inició desde hace 13 años cuando quedó sin empleo y   compró un catalogo y empezó a ofrecerle a sus vecinas, amigas, conocidas, y excompañeras de trabajo mercancías sencillas. Con este negocio organizó su primera clientela y posteriormente empezó a realizar cursos de fabricación de productos de cuero como carteras, billeteras y posteriormente empezó a producir y a vender en compañía de su familia. Poco a poco sus ventas se han incrementados, porque aprovecha  cada temporada para hacer sus mejores diseños y así mismo sus mejores ofertas, por eso constantemente requiere tener un capital de trabajo adicional, mientras recoge su dinero, procedente de sus cuentas por cobrar. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprará sintéticos, cuero y lona, para fabricar calzado y también comprará ropa para ofrecerla en un kit acorde a las vacaciones del primer semestre del año. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local, para ubicar un almacén con sus propios diseños y las mejores promociones que fidelicen  a sus clientes.
texts.en: Rosalbina is 56 years old and makes leather, faux-leather and similar items to make her wares, she also sells various merchandize like clothing and accessories that she combines with her leather, plastic and canvas items like shoes, handbags, wallets, etc. that she makes herself. Her work as a salesperson began 13 years ago when she became unemployed and bought a catalogue and started selling simple merchandize to her neighbors, friends, acquaintances and ex-workmates. With this business she had her first customer and began some courses to learn how to make leather products like handbags and wallets, later on she began to make and sell them to her family. Little by little Rosalbina’s sales have increased because she takes advantage of each season to make her best designs and sales. This is why she constantly needs extra work capital while she collects from previous sales and wants a credikiva, to buy synthetic, leather and canvas materials to make shoes and buy clothing to offer a kit to sell during the first vacation of the semester of the year. Rosalbina’s future goal is to have a store with her own designs and to have better sales to gain her customers’ loyalty.

loans.use: buy synthetic, leather and canvas materials to make shoes and buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize, beans, onions etc

loans.name: Joseph William

texts.en:
Joseph William  is a 28-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 2 children between the ages of 2 and 5 years old. One of the children goes to school. 

Joseph runs a hardware and has been in business for four years. He has one employee, and he heard about Finance Sudan through the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 1500 SDG to purchase iron sheets, nails, blocks, etc and increase his business.

In five years, he wants to build a permanent house and open a new branch of his shop. His major challenges include inflation in the market. 

He is happy for Kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, nails, blocks, etc

loans.name: Houbo Antoine

texts.fr: Houbo Antoine est âgé de 40 ans et vit au Bénin. Houbo Antoine est marié à un certain Henriette. Le couple a sept enfants à leur charge, dont six représentent leurs propres enfants et certains sont scolarisés. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Houbo Antoine a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire, puis a appris la coiffure. Houbo Antoine exerce ce métier depuis plus de vingt ans. Cette activité lui permet ainsi de subvenir aux différents besoins du ménage. Houbo Antoine désire faire la réfection de son atelier, pour ainsi accroître sa clientèle et mieux répondre à leurs différents exigences. Pour cette raison, Houbo Antoine sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Houbo Antoine is 40 years old and lives in Bénin. Houbo Antoine is married to a woman named Henriette. They have seven dependent children, six of whom are their own children. Several of the children attend school, and the children live with their parents. The couple meet the household expenses between them.
Houbo Antoine left school after primary education, and learned hairdressing. He has engaged in this activity for over twenty years. This business allows him to cover the living costs of the household. 
Houbo Antoine wishes to renovate his salon, with a view to increasing his customer base and meeting their various requirements. For this reason, Houbo Antoine is seeking a second loan with ALIDé. The first one has been fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase a hair steamer and hairdressing products.

loans.name: Modjirola Rosalie

texts.fr: Modjirola Rosalie est âgée de 48 ans et vit au Bénin. Modjirola Rosalie est mariée à un certain Philippe. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Modjirola Rosalie exerce depuis quatorze ans comme activité, la vente de tissus et de sacs par le système de distribution. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Modjirola Rosalie contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Modjirola Rosalie sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Modjirola Rosalie is 48 years old and lives in Bénin. She is married to a man named Philippe. They have two children living at home, both of whom attend school. The children live with their parents. Between them, the couple cover the various household expenses.
To assist with the family's living requirements, for the last fourteen years Modjirola Rosalie has sold fabrics and bags via a distribution system. Thanks to the income this activity generates for her, Modjirola Rosalie is able to contribute to meeting the family's expenses.
In order to meet the demand from her ever increasing customer base, Modjirola Rosalie is seeking a first loan with ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and bags.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 48 years old, single, and supports a family of three. She has run a grocer shop for the past 20 years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,000. 

She is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, as she plans to restock her shop with more cereals and vegetables. The anticipated profits will help in the expansion of the stall.  Her future dream is to improve on her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of assorted vegetables and cereals for sale.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is 69 years old with three grown children. She is from Panglao, Bohol. She has been in the business of raising hogs for eight years now. Cornelia  is asking for a loan to buy piglets and quality feed for her hogs. 

She is eager to make her business more successful so she can have good profits and can eventually save enough to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy piglets and quality feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Moussédikou

texts.fr: Moussédikou est âgé de 49 ans et vit au Bénin. Moussédikou est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Nassifatou. Le couple a quatorze enfants à leur charge, dont onze représentent leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Moussédikou vend depuis une vingtaine d'année, des produits vivriers (maïs, mil) dans sa boutique. Moussédikou s'approvisionne dans le nord du Bénin. Grâce aux revenus que lui génèrent ces activités, Moussédikou contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Moussédikou sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux crédits reçus antérieurement par Moussédikou ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Moussédikou is 49 and lives in Bénin. Moussédikou is married to a retailer by the name of Nassifatou. They have fourteen dependent children, eleven of whom are their own children. All the children attend school, and live together with their parents. Between them, the couple cover the various household expenses.
To assist with the family's living requirements, for the last twenty or so years Moussédikou has sold foodstuff products (corn, meal) in his shop. Moussédikou buys his goods in the north of Bénin. Thanks to the income this activity generates for him, Moussédikou is able to contribute to meeting the family's expenses.
In order to meet the demand from his ever increasing customer base, Modjirola Rosalie is seeking a third loan with ALIDé. The two loans previously received have both been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and meal.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy, 23, lives in the town of Kaloleni, Kenya in a family house.  In his store, he does mobile battery charging for the neighboring families for their daily use. Jimmy is a hardworking person who is always involved in productive activities. Previously, he was a farmer and sold a variety of farm produce, such as green vegetables and tomatoes. 

To further establish his business, he is seeking a Kiva loan through Yehu Microfinance for his first financing. With this loan, he will purchase a battery charging machine and mobile batteries and mobile phone chargers in higher volume than he normally does. This is so that he can buy at a substantial discount and continue being competitive by taking advantage of the market in order to support himself and make each day more successful.

loans.use: to purchase battery chargers, mobile phone cases, and power extension cables.

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr: Béatrice est âgée de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Béatrice est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Moussiliou. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé et à leur charge. Béatrice vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Béatrice a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire, puis a appris la coiffure. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Béatrice exerce depuis douze ans le métier de coiffure. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Béatrice contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Béatrice sollicite pour une première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Béatrice is 37 years old and lives in Bénin. Béatrice is married to a trader by the name of Moussiliou. They have one child, who attends school. Béatrice lives together with her child and her husband. Between them, the couple cover the various household expenses.
Béatrice left school after primary education, and learned hairdressing. To contribute towards covering the family's expenses, she has been a hairdresser for twelve years. Thanks to the income this activity generates for her, Béatrice contributes to meeting the family's expenses. In order to meet the demand from her ever increasing customer base, Béatrice is seeking a first loan with ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and beauty products.

loans.name: Lydie

texts.fr: Lydie est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Lydie est mariée à un certain Constantin. Le couple a deux enfants, tous à leur charge et dont un est scolarisé. Lydie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants,Lydie vend depuis sept ans environs, des vêtements, des chaussures et divers autres articles dans sa boutique au Bénin. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Lydie contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Lydie sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Lydie is 32 years old and lives in Bénin. Lydie is married to a man by the name of Constantin. They have two dependent children, one of whom attends school. Lydie lives together with her children and her husband. Between them, the couple cover the various household expenses.
To contribute towards covering her own, and the children's, expenses, Lydie has sold clothing, shoes and various other items in her small store in Bénin for about seven years. Thanks to the income this activity generates for her, Lydie contributes to meeting the family's expenses. In order to meet the demand from her ever increasing customer base, Lydie is seeking a first loan with ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a photocopy machine and A4 paper.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is the woman pounding fufu (a starchy dumpling made from cassava, yam, plantain or rice that is eaten with soup or stew). She operates a chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold); this she has done for two years. The foods she serves are fufu, banku (a local dish made from corn dough and served hot with soup) and rice balls. 

She is married with five children. Ekua uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase  foodstuffs and other ingredients to prepare her food for sale. With the new profit, Ekua plans to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs and other ingredients to prepare her food for sale.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa cooks banku and serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce at Asafora, near Cape Coast. She is  a widow and has 5 children. Adwoa has been into this business for 20 years now. She uses her income to in the general upkeep of her family. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to mount a better stall for the sale of her cooked banku and fish.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her banku to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama extracts palm oil and kennel oil, which she sells at Mfuom, which is near Elmina.  Ama is married to a farmer and has two children.  She uses her income to support her husband in feeding and clothing their children.  Ama will use her loan to purchase more palm fruit and palm kennel to make oil. With her profit, she wishes to buy a machine so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruit and palm kennel to extract oil from to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives with her husband and three children at Aboadzi, near Takoradi. She sells ladies' accessories such as earrings, necklaces,  hairbands, etc. She has done this for some time now. Elizabeth uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. 
Elizabeth will use her loan to purchase a larger variety of ladies accessories to satisfy customer demand. With her new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of ladies' beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Orietta

texts.es: Orietta de 47 años de edad  se dedica a la venta de mercancías como prendas de vestir exterior e interior; negocio que inició posterior a la separación de su esposo, pues necesitaba generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos, a quienes debía dar bienestar. Ella empezó con pocos productos y un capital muy pequeño, pero su trabajo disciplinado y de mucho esfuerzo muy pronto dio sus frutos, los cuales hoy se ven reflejados en sus relaciones comerciales, cuenta  con una clientela fija y proveedores que en ella confían. Con su negocio ha mejorado sus ingresos y ahora su meta se dirige a lograr tener un almacén bien surtido y posicionado. Su mayor  desafío es tener un suficiente capital de trabajo para atender la continua demanda de sus clientes y mas adelante tener un almacén bien surtido que impacte su mercado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará blusas, suéteres, jeans en mayor volumen y con precios de oportunidad, porque en el mercado hay una gran variedad de estos productos con descuentos, que solo puede aprovechar si tiene el suficiente dinero en sus manos.
texts.en: Orietta is 47 years old. She sells merchandise such as underwear and outerwear. She started this business after seperating from her husband because she needed to generate income to support her children and for their wellbeing. She started with few products and a little capital, but her hardwork and discipline quickly had results. These are now seen in her business relationships. She has regular customers and suppliers who trust her. With her business, she has improved her income and now her goal is to be bale to have a well stocked and well placed store. Her biggest challenge is having enough capital to meet her customers' demands and in the future having a well stocked store that impacts her market. Right now she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan she has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it she will buy blouses, sweaters, and jeans in greater quantities, because in the market there is a wide variety of these products with discounts and she can only take advantage of that if she has enough money in her hands.

loans.use: to buy blouses, sweaters and jeans in greater quantities.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica used her previous loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables which she sold and got a good income. She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD which is a top-up loan product.

Veronica will use the loan to buy more assorted vegetables and fruits from farmers for sale in her business. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop which will help her cater for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy fruits and green vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 33 years old, married to Peter and blessed with four children who are 16, 13, 8 and 5 years old. She runs a grocery stall a business she started three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has requested her first loan of KES 12, 000 to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. The anticipated profits will aid her in buying additional stock for her business. 

Her dream is to own a car in and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 27-year-old mixed crop farmer married to Timothy who is a businessman. They are blessed with three children. She has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 6,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Lucy will use the loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. 

She hopes to start a poultry keeping business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 49-year-old business lady and a single mother of two children. She has been raising and selling poultry for the past 10 years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Lydia will use the loan to buy broilers and feed. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. 

She hopes to own a big poultry farm.

loans.use: to buy broilers and feeds

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 43-year-old businesswoman who is married to Francis, a businessman. They are blessed with three children. 

Nancy has been running a medical clinic for the past seven years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Nancy will use the loan to purchase a piece of land, which she will use in the future. With the anticipated profit from the clinic business, she will educate her children. 

Nancy hopes to build rental houses and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land.

loans.name: 3.8.162.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiền works in agriculture farming food. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.  Hiền is 36 years old and married with one child.  She is the group leader of the 3.8.162.Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of nine members.  She lives with one dependent and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hiền has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She has been involved in this business for six years.  The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 50 years old enterprising business lady, married to Lawrence, a business man, and they are not yet blessed with children. She has been running a green grocer business in an open air market for the past 21 years with a monthly income of KES.19,200 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase fresh vegetables and fruits. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will use to add more stock of variety of fruits and vegetables. She hopes to buy a piece of land for farming.

loans.use: to purchase fresh vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 33 years old and married to Tiberious, and blessed with two children under the age of ten. Joy runs a hotel, a business she started seven years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

She has requested for a third loan worth KES 50,000, in order to purchase a refrigerator and a microwave oven. The profit she earns will aid her in repaying her loan. 

Her dream is to one day open a much bigger hotel.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and a microwave oven.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 52 years old from Nakuru and has four children. Dorcas has a clothing business and a cereals business. She has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy maize and green grams to add to her stock.


She hopes to boost her business and venture into cattle rearing.

loans.use: To buy maize and green grams cereals to add to her stock.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen vive en la linda ciudad de Pisco, conocida por sus lindas playas sus atractivos turísticos como las Islas Ballestas y el candelabro de Paracas, asimismo se desarrolla la pesca y la agricultura , en especial el cultivo de algodón,. Maíz, entre otros. Carmen vive al lado de su esposo y juntos tienen un pequeño de 5 años de edad, el cual es su motivo de salir adelante cada día y dar lo mejor de si para demostrarle que con trabajo y honradez se puede lograr salir adelante. Ella es una madre muy amorosa y le gusta preparar postres en sus tiempos libres ya que tiene muy buena sazón para ello y también aprovecha en algunas oportunidades para poder cocinar uno de sus platos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres Carmen solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de enfermería.

Carmen trabaja desde hace 3 años y con mucho ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta de calzado con el cual apoya puede aportar a su hogar y puede solventar junto a su esposo a su familia; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes, ofrece productos de calidad y sobre todo es muy conocida y por ellos clientes siempre regresan. 

Carmen está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar zapatos para varones en especial porque se acerca el día del padre y  con ello podrá tener mayor variedad de modelos para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos; así de esta manera podrá seguir creciendo y seguir dándole muchas ganas a su trabajo para poder conseguir cumplir su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena profesión a sus hijos y crecer aun mas en su negocio”.
texts.en:
Carmen lives in  the beautiful city of Pisco, known for its lovely beaches and its tourist attractions such as the Islas Ballestas and the Paracas Candelabra. There is also fishing and farming there, especially cotton farming and corn, among others. Carmen lives with her husband and they have a 5 year old little noy. He is their reason for getting ahead and giving the best of themselves to show him that with hard work and honesty you can get ahead. She is a very loving mother and she likes to make desserts in her free time since she is a good cook. She also likes to take the chance to make one of her favorite dishes, such as the delicious "Arroz con Pato”. Because her parents had few financial resources, Carmen was only able to go to high school, but she would have liked to have studied nursing.

Three years ago Carmen was able to start her business selling shoes with some savings she has. With her business, she has been able to support her home with her husband and family. She believes that her business is going well for her because she is friendly to her customers, she has quality products, and above all she is well known and her customers always return. 

Carmen is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to buy men's shoes especially since Fathers' Day is coming up. This way she will have a wider variety of styles to offer her customers and be able to improve her income. This way she can keep growing and working enthusiastically to be bale to make her biggest dream come true: "give her children a good education and grown even more in her business".

loans.use: to buy merchandise (shoes for Fathers' Day)

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina, aged 38, is from Cortes, Bohol. She is married with three children aged 3, 6 and 14. She has been selling home-cooked food for six years now. Crispina is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like seasoning, meat and vegetables so she can always cook for her customers. 

She is determined to work hard and earn more for her family's needs, especially her children's education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like seasoning, meat and vegetables

loans.name: Protus

texts.en:
Protus lives in Kaloleni, Kenya.  He is a good entrepreneur and, for two years, he has owned his own business. He operates a motorcycle spare parts shop, selling to his neighbours and passersby. 

Today, his dreams continue to grow and his goals are to continue increasing his income so that he can expand to a wholesale shop and be very successful.

Protus's market is growing and so is the amount of capital that he needs to continue providing the products his customers demand. This will be his first loan from Yehu Microfinance Trust. He will use it to buy motorcycle spare parts that he will promote in his business with special discounts. He wants to offer great prices to his customers so that he can continue earning their loyalty, and this is why he will be successful in investing his Kiva loan in his business.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts for resale

loans.name: Ana Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Ana tiene 39 años de edad ,es casada y tiene tres hijas.  Ella se dedica a la venta en un cafetin de el centro escolar de su comunidad. ella es una persona trabajadora y responsable con mucho esfuerzo ha podido sacar adelante a su familia junto a su esposo administran el chaleth desde ya hace muchos años y con este tipo de trabajo han podido dar el estudio a sus hijas tanto asi , que la primera de ellas esta culminando sus estudios en la universidad.

Ana junto a su esposo compran los materiales que utilizan en la ciudad mas cercana que esta ubicada a unos 6 kilometros de su casa y como el acceso a la zona es un poco malo solo corren autobuses cada dos horas y cuando el invierno es muy fuerte hay unos que no salen; asi que a ella le toca pagar un automovil expreso y le sale mas caro para trasladar su mercaderia desde la ciudad hasta su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar mercaderia para su cafetin y asi poder surtir la demanda que tiene con los alumnos de el centro escolar cuando tienen sus momentos de receso, ella siente que no es capaz de abastecer todo lo que ellos le demandan.

La necesidad que sera satisfecha es que ella podra comprar mas mercaderia y asi podra abastecer la demanda que tiene en el cafetin de parte de los alumnos con una mejor facilidad.

Su vida mejorara grandemente, ya que si ella surte mas su negocio las ventas aumentaran y asi podra obtener mas ingresos de dinero y un mejor margen de ganancia por sus ventas.

En el futuro ella quiere poder tener mas surtido su cafetin y tambien poner una pequeña tienda en su casa para que las personas que no tienen acceso a el centro escolar puedan tambien comprar su producto sin tener que entrar al centro de estudio. Tambien ella queiere ver a sus hijas formadas en sus estudios y que se puedan desempeñar en la sociedad como personas muy reconocidas y respetadas por los pobladores de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Ana is 39 years old. She is marrried and has three daughters. She has a coffee shop in a community school center. She is a hardworking and responsible person who has been able to get her family ahead with a lot of hard work. Her husband manages the shop and over many years with this work thay have been able to educate their daughters. Their oldest is finishing college.

Ana and her husband buy their materials in the closest town, which is 6 kilometers from their house. Access to the area is very bad because the buses only go by every two hours and when there is a hard rainy season sometimes they don't go by at all. Then she has to pay for an express delivery service and it is more expensive to transport her merchandise from the town to her house. 

The loan she is asking for is to buy merchandise for her coffee shop and thus meet the demand she has from the students from the education center when they have breaks. She feels that she is unable to stock everything they want.

The need that will be satisfied is that she will be able to buy more merchandise and meet the demand that she has in the coffee shop from the students more easily. 

Her life will improve gradually, since if she stocks her business more her sales will increase and thus she will have more income and obtain a wider profit margin with her sales.

In the future, she wants to have a better sticked coffeeshop and also be able to open a small store in her house so that the people who don't have access to the educational center can also buy her products without having to go into the school. She also wants her daughters to be educated so they can be  well known and respected people in their community.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her coffee shop.

loans.name: Ban's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village located in the Sangke district of Battambang province, Ban is 58 and widowed. She has eight children, two of whom are dependent on her. She has struggled as a widow to earn a living through farming rice and raising pigs. She has been in this business for ten years to support her big family. 

Ban received her first loan with VisionFund three cycles ago and has successfully repaid her loans. The past loans have helped her better support her family. Now she and her group member who is just with VisionFund this loan cycle are applying for a loan to buy fertilizer for farming and to use a portion of it to buy feed for her pig business. With this loan, she hopes to earn a larger income so as to expand her current business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pig feed

loans.name: Balla

texts.fr: Balla est un jeune commerçant qui tient une alimentation en centre ville dans sa localité.Il s'est lancé dans le commerce après avoir quitté les études il y a trois ans.La bonne localisation de l'alimentation lui vaut une grande clientèle.Il parvient ainsi à générer des revenus assez intéressants qui lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires, sanitaires et d'habillement des membres de sa famille et de lui - même.Il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter des denrées alimentaires et renforcer ainsi son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Balla is a young merchant who has a grocery store in the center of his town. He got started in commerce after having left school three years ago. The right location of his grocery store has won him a large customer base. He thus manages to generate fair-enough revenues enabling him to cover his needs and those of his family in terms of food, healthcare, and clothing. 

Balla is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to buy grocery supplies and thus to bolster his business capital.

loans.use: to buy food supplies

loans.name: Sros' Group

texts.en:
Sros is 32 years old and married. She lives with her two dependent children, who are still in school, in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district, Cambodia. She is a grocery seller who has been in this business for six years. She sells seasoning, soap, candy, cake, etc. With her current business, she is able to earn a daily income of 15,000KHR to support her family and she manages to save around 6,000KHR each day.

This is the first loan for Sros’ group of three members with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  Sros, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy more grocery items for her store and also to buy zinc for her house building. With this loan, she hopes to grow her business and earn more income so as to keep her children in school and build more savings for the future.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to sell

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: 3.8.163.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Liên works in agriculture farming food products. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Liên is 50 years old and is married with no children. She is the group leader of the 3.8.163.Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of seven members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Liên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future. 

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Aged 44, Kong is a married mother of five children and resides in a rural village located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has been farming rice and planting cassava as the main source of family’s income for almost twenty years to make a living. The current business earns her about 42,000KHR per day to spend for daily basic needs.

Kong has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and completely paid back the loans with VisionFund. She used the loans successfully to better support her family and she feels empowered after the loans. Now leading her group member who is just with VisionFund to apply for a loan of 1,000,000KHR each, Kong, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her business. She hopes to increase her crop yields and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her business

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es: Luz Mery en el año 2000 en su condición de separada y madre de 2 hijos pequeños, hoy en las edades de  17 a 15 años, debió asumir sola su roll de generadora de ingresos, para lograr el bienestar de su familia; por eso empezó vendiendo pasabocas fritos, los cuales le produjeron su propia posibilidad de tener dinero para sostener sus hijos. En la medida en que sus hijos crecieron ella necesitaba resolver mas necesidades básicas y con esta sola tarea no alcanzaba a lograrlo. Por eso se fue a las colmenas (pequeños puntos de venta) del centro de la ciudad y empezó a trabajar en una de ellas como vendedora. Con esta experiencia en el mercado, dos años después decidió independizarse con un dinero, una parte ahorrada y la otra producto de un préstamo de alto costo, que invirtió en la compra de calzado, dándose a conocer  en su clientela y entre sus proveedores,  que empezaron a facilitarle crédito; cuando se estabilizó un poco, logró reunir dinero y alquiló una colmena, donde vendió mucha mercancía económica durante un periodo de tiempo,  hasta que se organizó con su cónyuge y este compró vitrinas para que trabajara cerca a sus hijos, que ya eran 3 y necesitaban de su atención cercana y aunque al principio atendía los dos negocios, al final se decidió por el que estaba ubicado en su casa. Así nació su hoy miscelánea, ubicada en su residencia, donde vende de todo un  poco  y allí ha construido una clientela con la cual se encuentra posicionada. En la actualidad su meta es ampliar su negocio, teniendo un stock de mercancía de mucha rotación, para más adelante lograr el máximo aprovechamiento de su infraestructura, ofreciendo servicios de impresión. Ella poco a poco está dando pasos importantes y por eso se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para acceder a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprara pantalones, jeans, camisas para hombres  y detalles femeninos, pues se acerca el mes de Julio, fecha en la que se marca  el incremento del volumen de sus ventas y Luz Mery quiere estar lista para hacer su mejor ejercicio comercial.
texts.en:
In the year 2000, as a separated mother of two young children (who are now 17 and 15), Luz Mery needed to assume the role of sole income generator in order to provide for her family.  For this reason, she started selling fried snacks which enabled her to make money with which to support her children.  As her children grew, she needed to cover more basic needs and with this one job she couldn't manage it.  For this reason, she went to 'las colmenas' (small sales locations) in the city center and started to work in one of them as a sales assistant.

With this market experience under her belt, two years later she decided to start working for herself with some money she had (some was savings and the rest was from a high-cost loan).  She invested in buying footwear and became known among her customers and suppliers who started to provide her with credit.  When she had stabilized a little, she managed to get some money together and rent a 'colmena' (small sales location) where she sold a lot of merchandise over a period of time until she made an arrangement with her husband who bought display cases so that she could work near her children, who were 3 and needed her close attention.

Although at first she served in both businesses, in the end she chose to keep the one that was located at home.  This is how the general store she has today was born.  Her store is located in her home and there she sells a little bit of everything.  She has gained a customer base and a position in the market.  Luz Mery's current goal is to expand her business and to have a stock of merchandise that has a high turnover so that, in the future, she can make the most of her infrastructure and start offering printing services.  Luz Mery is gradually taking important steps and this is why she has approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to take out her first Kiva loan.  She will use the loan to buy men's pants, jeans and shirts, and women's accessories as the month of July is approaching and this is a time of year when her sales increase.  Luz Mery would like to be ready to make her best sales.

loans.use: to buy men's pants, jeans and shirts, and women's accessories

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 33 years old business lady.  She is married to Simon who is a businessman.  They are blessed with two children aged five and two years.  

Esther has been selling second hand clothes for the past four years, and earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES, which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced to KADET by a staff member.  Esther will use the loan to purchase towels, and sweater tops to stock and sell.

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, she will open another business. Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children through the university level and to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase towels, and items of clothing to stock and sell.

loans.name: Natali

texts.es:
Natali es una mujer de 26 años, vive en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su pequeño hijo, ella es una persona muy alegre, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño, lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Administración; en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear con las acogedoras calles de la ciudad en compañía de su pequeño y en algunas ocasiones engríe a su familia cocinando unos riquísimos Tallarines rojos.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su familia, Natali puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de cosméticos y artículos de belleza, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 8 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender  a un promedio de 12 clientes, ella tiene su pequeño negocio en su casa y también realiza sus ventas ofreciendo sus productos por catálogos a sus vecinos y amistades; ella cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a que sus clientes la recomiendan por sus buenos precios y trato amable.
Natali se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una vitrina exhibidora y mas cosméticos y productos de belleza; de esta manera Natali tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá incrementar sus ventas e ingresos económicos, con los cuales desea poder brindar una buena educación y calidad de vida para su pequeño y para sus padres, quienes siempre la han apoyado.
texts.en:
Natali is a 26-year-old woman who lives in her parents' home in the city of Ica, in Parcona district, together with her young son.  She is a very cheerful, hard-working and enthusiastic woman who puts all her efforts into providing for her little one.
