Unfortunately, owing to her need to work and cover her expenses, Natali was not able to study for a degree but she would have liked to have studied Administration.  In her free time, she enjoys going for walks though the welcoming city streets together with her young son and she sometimes delights her family by cooking delicious 'tallarines rojos' (red spaghetti).

On her own initiative, and thanks to the support of her family, Natali set up a small business selling cosmetics and beauty products.  She works around eight hours a day in her business and can serve an average of 12 customers.  Her small business is located in her home and she also makes sales by offering her products through catalogs to her friends and neighbors.  She believes that her business is doing well as her customers recommend her because of her good prices and kind service.

Natali is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy a display case and more cosmetics and beauty products.  This will give her a better-stocked business and she will be able to increase her sales and income.  This, in turn, will allow her to provide her little one with a good education and provide both him and her parents, who have always supported her, with a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a display case, cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Dominique

texts.fr:
Dominique eest une jeune femme de 27 ans, mariée mère de trois enfant qui vont à l'école. Elle gère une petites structure pas très loin de son domile dans laquelle elle vend les téléphones portables et accessoires depuis un an. Son petit capital ne lui permet pas d'acheter assez de marchandises, elle est obligé à chaque fois de faire écouler tout son stock avant de s'en procurer un autre d'où sa rupture permanente de stock. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour pourvoir augmenter son capital et donc son stock, ce qui lui permettra de renouveller son stock sans attendre que l'ancien soit totalement écouler.
Elle réinvestira une partie du bénefices dans sa boutique et économisera l'autre pour les rentrées scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en: Dominique is a young woman, who is 27 years old, married and mother to three children who all go to school. She has a small shelter not far from her home, where she has been selling cell phones and accessories for the past year. Her small capital does not allow her to buy sufficient goods and so she obliged to sell all her stock each time before getting more in; this means that she has a permanent lack of stock. She is requesting this loan so that she can increase her capital and thus her stock; this will enable her to renew her stock before she has totally run it down; She will reinvest part of her profits in her shop and save the rest for the beginning of her children's next school year.

loans.use: to increase her stock of cell phones and accessories

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 33 years old.  He is married and supports a happy family of two.  He runs a retail shop that sells new mobile phones, phone accessories and repair parts.  He has been in business for the last two years and earns a monthly profit of 10,000 KES. 

This is his seventh loan from KADET LTD and he intends to use it to purchase new phones, repair parts and other accessories to meet the growing needs of his clients. This loan will help Moses increase both his sales and his inventory.  The anticipated profit will support his plan to expand his business. 

His future plans include continuing to do good business and to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones, phone accessories and repair parts.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel, aged 58, is from Panglao, Bohol. She is in the business of selling fresh fish and coconut wine in her community. Isabel would like to ask for a loan to buy more fish and coconut wine to sell, and piglets to start a hog-raising business. Once she is able to increase her capital, this will enable her to increase her profit and give her family a healthy diet.

In the future, she plans to improve her hog-raising business to better save for old age.

loans.use: to buy fish and coconut wine to sell, and piglets to raise for resale

loans.name: Nadupoi

texts.en:
Nadupoi is 62 years old, married and blessed with four children that she supports. For the last 11 years, she has worked in animal trading and she earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES. 

She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD in the amount of 60,000 KES.  She plans to purchase more animals to fatten and later resale at a profit as well as to purchase animal drugs to prevent from attack by local diseases.  She will reinvest the anticipated profits in her business.

She dreams to improve her family's standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase animals to fatten and resell at a profit

loans.name: Edder

texts.en:
Edder is 32 years old. She is a single mother of one child. She is a farmer besides operating a dressmaking shop. She has been a farmer for the past four years. She gets a monthly income of KES 20,000 from both her businesses.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET LTD, by credit officers. She will use the loan amount to  purchase fertilizer and seedlings for her farm and also use part of it to purchase clothing material for her dressmaking shop.

She hopes to be a leading farmer in her area and also see her child through education.

loans.use: Purchase farm inputs and stock her dressmaking business

loans.name: Mouinatou

texts.fr: Veuve âgée de 42ans, Madame Mouinatou a 02 enfants qui ont 18 et 15ans.  Elle est couturière de profession et vend en même temps des articles de mercerie depuis 1995. Son activité se fait à domicile et elle s’approvisionne au Grand Marché. Pour assurer les besoins primaires de la famille vu qu’elle prend seule en charge ses enfants, elle a sollicité de WAGES un troisième crédit afin d’acheter des articles de mercerie, pour mieux vendre et réaliser des bénéfices. Elle veut diversifier l’activité, se prendre en charge et assurer plus les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Mouinatou is a 42 years old and a widow. She has two children who are 18 and 15. 

She is a seamstress by trade and has also been selling sewing supplies since 1995. She works from home and buys her supplies at the Grand Market. 

As she is the only earner, she has requested a third loan from WAGES to help her meet her family's basic needs. She will use it to buy sewing supplies so that she can increase sales and make a profit. 

She would like to diversify her business, become financially independent and provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies.

loans.name: Natividad Group

texts.es:
Felicita tiene con 57 años de edad y vive felizmente casada con el señor Ignacio quien es empleado de una ferretería en su comunidad. La pareja tuvo seis hijos aunque actualmente solo vive con una de sus hijas. También tiene una nieta que cursa 3° del preescolar, se llama Alma y tiene cinco años de edad.

Felicita es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de pan y lleva trabajando 25 años en dicho negocio. Ella cuenta que vende únicamente bajo pedidos y elabora su pan cada tres días. Unas de sus metas es poder poner un negocio en el mercado municipal y tener ayudantes pues la actividad en ocasiones exige más de lo que puede dar de acuerdo con su edad. Felicita piensa comprar con el siguiente préstamo más insumos para la elaboración de pan: harina, azúcar, leña , manteca etc.

Felicita es una de las integrantes del grupo “Natividad”, dicho grupo está integrado por 8 mujeres y 2 hombres muy trabajadores y responsables. A continuación serán mencionados junto con cada una de las actividades que realizan: Roberto tiene un taxi local, María Leonor vende verduras, Antonio vende electrodomésticos, Teófila vende pan, Tania Margarita y Felicita también venden pan, María Félix vende lencería, Reyna vende oro, María del Carmen vende perfumes y, finalmente, Hildeberta vende comida.
texts.en:
Felicita is 57 years old and happily married to Ignacio who is an employee in a hardware store in their community.  The couple have six children, though they currently only live with one of their daughters.  They also have a granddaughter who is in the third year of pre-school.  Her name is Alma and she is 5 years old.

Felicita is a saleswoman.  She sells bread and has been in this business for 25 years.  She says that she only sells to order and makes her bread every three days.  One of her goals is to be able to set up a business in the town market and have assistants because sometimes the business demands more than she can manage on account of her age.  Felicita is planning to use her loan to buy more supplies for making bread (flour, sugar, firewood, butter, etc.)

Felicita is one of the members of the 'Natividad' group.  This group is made up of 8 women and 2 men, all of whom are very hard working and responsible.  Here follows a list of all the members and their business activities: Roberto has a local taxi, María Leonor sells vegetables, Antonio sells electrical appliances, Teófila sells bread, Tania Margarita and Felicita also sell bread, María Félix sells lingerie, Reyna sells gold, María del Carmen sells perfumes and, finally, Hildeberta sells food.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making bread (flour, sugar, eggs, firewood, etc.)

loans.name: Sarat's Group

texts.en: Sarat is married and has two children who are in school.  To support the family, Sarat and her husband do rice farming.  They also raise pigs.  Sarat has been with VisionFund for two loans cycles, both of which have been paid.  Now, Sarat is leading a group of two members to apply for another loan.  She will use her portion for land preparation and to buy more piglets and fertilizers for her rice paddy. Sarat really hopes this loan would allow her to raise healthy pigs and grow good yield crops so that she can sell them for a higher price and therefore her children can be in school until the end.

loans.use: to spend on land preparation and to buy fertilizers for her farm and piglets.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 31 years old, married to Cynthia, and they are blessed with four children who are all going to school. He is an electronics technician who has been doing repairs for the past 10 years. His monthly income is KES 25,000.

Andrew has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET, which he plans to use to buy spare parts to fix home appliances for his clients. The anticipated profits will be reinvested. His future dream is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase parts for repairing home appliances

loans.name: Lennox

texts.en:
Lennox is a single man who is 23 years old. He lives in Kaloleni, Kenya. Lennox has sold livestock at the market and operated a retail shop for the past 12 years. His business has allowed him to get ahead and to earn enough income to have some comforts. His goal is to expand his business. 

Lennox is currently planning to take out his first Kiva loan which will be his first funding through Yehu Microfinance Trust. He will use it to buy retail shop items like maize flour, wheat flour and sugar and also cattle for resale. He generates good profits when he buys in bulk, which is what he plans to do in this instance.

loans.use: To purchase retail shop items like maize flour and also cattle for resale

loans.name: Las Reynas Group

texts.es:
Las Reynas son un grupo solidario integrado por 6 mujeres que está cumpliendo con su quinto ciclo en esta institución. Ellas se han distinguido por ser un grupo muy bueno y unido durante este tiempo superando todas las adversidades que se les han presentado en el tiempo que han estado juntas. 
Yuri es una de las mujeres del grupo. Ella tiene 30 años y está casada. Su esposo, es albañil y cuando a ella se le ha dificultado juntar el dinero para dar el pago él la apoya para que no tenga problemas. Yuri junto con su esposo tiene tres hijos de 10, 7 y 2 años. Los dos hijos más grandes estudian la primaria mientras que el más chico el próximo año va a entrar al kínder.
Yuri hace dos años decidió comenzar a vender tamales para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos en su hogar. Yuri vende sus ricos tamales por medio de pedidos a sus vecinas y amigas. De hecho, ella pidió este crédito para comprar los ingredientes para poder hacer unos tamales para completar unos pedidos que tenía. Ella espera seguir vendiendo tamales y algún día buscar tener un pequeño puesto en algún lugar alguno de los mercados locales.
texts.en:
Las Reynas is a community bank of six women who are on their fifth loan cycle with the institution.  They have stood out as being a very good and united group, overcoming all the difficulties that they have faced during the time that they have been together.

Yuri is one of the members of this group.  She is 30 years old and married.  Her husband is a builder and whenever she has had any difficulties getting enough money together to make her repayments, he has supported her so that she doesn't have any problems.  Yuri and her husband have three children who are 10, 7 and 2 years old.  Their two older children attend elementary school whilst their youngest will start Kindergarten next year.

Two years ago, Yuri decided to start selling tamales in order to support her husband with their household expenses.  She sells her delicious tamales to order, to friends and neighbors.  She requested this loan to buy the ingredients she needed to make tamales in order to fill some orders that she had.  She hopes to continue selling tamales and, some day, to have a small stall in one of the local markets.

loans.use: to make tamales to fill some orders

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both of her children go to school. She does not take care of other additional family members. She sells secondhand shoes at the market and operates her business on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last year. 

She has requested a loan of 1,200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bales of secondhand shoes. Her major business challenges are thieves and seasonality. She is aspiring of importing used shoes and also to expand her business into wholesale. 

She lives in a rented house where the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Ma. Gemma

texts.en:
Ma. Gemma, aged 44, is from Baclayon, Bohol. She has been selling women's accessories for 11 years now. Ma. Gemma has three children to support who are aged 8, 11 and 19. She is asking for a loan to buy hair clips, bangles and other accessories, and to pay for tuition.

In the future, she would like to have a better place to accommodate more customers and to have a larger income. Right now, her profit is for her family's daily consumption and school fees.

loans.use: to buy hair clips, bangles and other accessories, and to pay for tuition

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Jose Antonio es un joven de 23 años de edad muy trabajador con conviviente y con 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia la cual esta ubicada en la parte rural del Norte de Peru. La actividad que desarrolla la titular es la prestación de servicio publico en su mototaxi donde transporta pasajeros a caseríos cercanos. Ademas cuenta con animales menores ovinos y pavos, tiene mas de 5 años en su negocio y su conviviente lo apoya en sus actividades.

El servicio que presta Jose Antonio es particularmente importante dado que conecta a gente de la parte rural del distrito con otras comunidades. Jose ahora busca un crediro que invertirá en la compra de alimentos para ganado y así venderlos a un mejor precio, ademas de realizar mantenimiento de su mototaxi. Jose ya ha demonstrado su responsabilidad anterior mente con el puntual pago del prestamo anterior con Edpyme Alternativa con el apoyo de Kiva.
texts.en:
Jose Antonio is a very hard-working young man of 23 who lives with his partner and has two children.  He lives in his own home which is located in the rural part of North Peru.  Jose Antonio's business is providing a public transport service with his motorcycle taxi, transporting passengers to nearby villages.  In addition, he also keeps sheep and turkeys.  He has been in his business for more than five years and his partner supports him in his work.

The service that Jose Antonio provides is particularly important because it connects people from the rural part of the district with other communities.  He is now looking to take out a loan to invest in buying feed for his livestock so that he can sell them at a better price.  He would also like to service his motorcycle taxi.  Jose has already shown his responsibility by repaying his previous Kiva loan through Edpyme Alternativa punctually.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his animals and to service his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Nhan's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Sangke district of Battambang province, Nhan, aged 43, is married with five children, three of whom are dependent on the family. Rice farming is her primary source of income for the family. She supplements this by raising chickens and selling duck eggs as a secondary source of income to make a living. She has been in this business for 10 years earning a daily income of around 22,800 KHR to support her family's daily living. 

Nhan’s group consists of four members who are all female. They have completely repaid their past loans with VisionFund. Nhan has used her past loans successfully to better support her family and business. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. 

As the leader, Nhan is going to use her portion to purchase seed rice for her rice farming and use a portion to buy feed for the chickens she is raising. With this loan, she hopes to grow more rice and to grow her business so as to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy seed rice and chicken feed

loans.name: Savuon's Group

texts.en:
Savuon is 30 years old and married. She lives in a rural area of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has one son who is dependent on her. To make a living, she has been farming rice for 10 years as a primary source of the family’s income. 

This will be Savuon's fifth loan while it will be her group member's fourth loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Savuon has used the loans successfully to support her living costs and business. The current business earns her about 56,000 KHR per day and she is able to save around 10,000 KHR each day. 

Now, she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, Savuon will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seed rice for her rice farming. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seed rice for her rice farming

loans.name: San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
San Sebastian es el nombre de un grupo Solidario de Credituyo que está cumpliendo con su primer ciclo en esta institución. Este grupo está compuesto por 6 mujeres emprendedoras que viven en la zona  poniente de la ciudad de Monterrey. Ellas escogieron este nombre ya que la mayoría de las personas de este grupo son vecinas y vive en la colonia de Villas de San Sebastián.
Norma es una de las mujeres del grupo. Ella es casada y tiene 46 años. Ella junto con su esposo, son los padres de una familia numerosa y unida. Ella y su esposo siempre se han preocupado por el bienestar de sus hijos y trabajan mucho en conjunto, el esposo es plomero y trabaja por su cuenta y siempre le ayuda mucho a ella cuando le va mal en su negocio. Ellos tienen 6 hijos; 3 hombres y 3 mujeres.  La mayoría de sus hijos ya están casados, sólo tiene dos solteros, uno que tiene 18 años y está trabajando y el más pequeño, de 10 años que está estudiando y actualmente es el único que depende de ellos. 
Norma  tiene 2 años vendiendo zapatos por catálogo y ropa usada en diferentes mercados. Ella ocupa este crédito para poder surtir zapatos ya que ahorita es temporada de graduaciones y tienen una gran cantidad de pedidos pendientes. Ella espera seguir adelante con el negocio de los zapatos ya que le deja muy buenas comisiones. En un futuro ella desea dejar de vender ropa usada y comenzar a comprar ropa nueva ya que menciona que esta se está vendiendo mejor que la ropa usada.
texts.en:
'San Sebastian' is the name of a Credituyo community bank which is starting its first loan cycle with the institution.  The group is made up of six entrepreneurial women who live in Poniente district, in the city of Monterrey.  They chose this name because most of the people in the group are neighbors and live in Villas de San Sebastián.

Norma is one of the women in this group.  She is 46 years old and married.  She and her husband are the parents of a large and united family.  She and her husband have always looked after their children's welfare and work hard together.  Norma's husband is a plumber and he always helps her a lot when things are going badly in her business.  The couple have six children: three sons and three daughters.  Most of their children are already married.  Only two of the children are still single: one is 18 years old and working and their youngest, who is 10 years old, is in school.  Currently, the youngest is the only one who is dependent on them.

Norma has been selling shoes through a catalog and used clothing for two years in different markets.  She is taking out this loan so that she can stock up with shoes because they make her good commission.  In the future, she would like to stop selling used clothing and start selling new clothing because she says that it sells better than used clothing.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y sin hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres con su hermana mayor, en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.

La actividad que desarrolla la titular es la venta de cerveza, chicha y piqueos en propio domicilio, en donde atiende preferentemente los días sábados, domingos y lunes y cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona. Tiene una experiencia de más de 5 años. Ella tiene quiero hacer un prestamo para la compra de cerveza para tener en stock. Precisamente su negocio a mostrado mejorias gracias a su trabajo duro y a un previo prestamo que recibio de Edpyme Alternativa gracias al apoyo de Kiva.
texts.en:
Georgina is 28 years old, single and doesn't have any children.  She lives in her parents' home with her older sister.  They live in the rural part of Tambogrande district but they have electricity.

Georgina's business is selling beer, 'chicha' (a corn-based drink) and snacks from home.  She mainly serves her customers on Saturdays, Sundays and Mondays and she already has an established customer base.  She has more than five years experience.  Georgina is taking out a loan to buy beer to have in stock.  Her business has improved thanks to her hard work and a previous loan that she received from Edpyme Alternativa with Kiva's support.

loans.use: to improve her business and buy beer

loans.name: Segundo Saturnino

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 37 años de edad y esta buscando sacar su segundo prestamo con el apoyo de Kiva, dado que el primero lo ayudo a consolidar su negocio. El quiere seguir mejorando el bienestar de su familia dado que vive con su conviviente y con 1 hijo a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su conviviente y su menor hijo. La casa está ubicada en Tambogrande, al norte del Peru, en la parte rural de este distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.

La actividad que desarrolla el titular es la crianza de ganado menor (ovino y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Complementariamente es técnico agropecuario y trabaja haciendo podas e injertos en las plantas de mango de las diferentes parcelas y fundos agrícolas. Cuenta con más de 6 años de experiencia en la ganadería y agricultura. El destino del crédito será para la ampliación de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Segundo is 37 years old and is looking to take out his second loan with Kiva's support as his first loan helped him to consolidate his business.  He would like to continue improving his family's well-being.  Segundo lives with his partner and has one child in his care.  He lives in his own home together with his partner and son.  Their house is located in the rural part of Tambogrande district, in the north of Peru, though they do have electricity.

Segundo's business activity is raising livestock (sheep and farmyard birds).  When the animals have reached an ideal size and weight, he sells them in the local market.  In addition, he is also an agricultural technician and works pruning and grafting mango plants on different farms and plots of land.  He has more than six years experience in livestock raising and farming.  He will use his loan to improve his home.

loans.use: to make some improvements to his living room floor and his kitchen roof

loans.name: Proscovia

texts.en: Proscovia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, and all her children go to school. She does not take care of any additional family members. She sells bananas at the market on a retail basis. She also sells charcoal at her home to earn some additional income. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of   green bananas and bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to buy a plot of land so as to build her own house and also to become a wholesaler. She lives in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is taking care of her mother and father.

She has been selling charcoal in a kiosk away from home at retail for two years. She also sells dried fish. The number of days she works in a week greatly depends on availability of charcoal and fish.

 She has requested a loan of UShs 200,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more fish and sacks of charcoal. Her challenges include seasonality in the supply and associated high prices. Her dream is to be able to accumulate profits that will enable her to acquire land. She joined MCDT because of the interest they have in serving the poor and at affordable rates. She rents a house and has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense is rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and dried fish

loans.name: Run's Group

texts.en:
Run, a 46-year-old married mother, lives with her eight children, four of whom are dependents working at the family’s business in a rural village of the Dambae district, Cambodia. Run has been farming rice and cassava for 20 years, earning a daily income of 55,000KHR to support her family.

This is the first loan request for Run’s two-member group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Run, the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her business and rubber trees for planting. With this loan, she hopes to grow her business and earn more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her business.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, one of whom goes to school. She does not look after any dependants. For the past year, Justine has been selling green bananas from her home. She works seven days a week and depends entirely on this business. Justine's major business challenges include ever-rising prices and the scarcity of supply especially during the rainy season when the upcountry roads are impassable. She joined MCDT to save every day in order to pay her loan obligations. Justine rents a house with access to electricity or running water and her major monthly expense is school fees.

Justine is requesting for a loan of  300,000 UGX loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. Her dream is to save enough capital to rent a stall in the market where the demand for the green bananas is higher.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a widow and has six children, five of whom are in school. Mwaka is a fishmonger, a business she has run for 15 years. She also sells coconuts and other vegetables when in season. Mwaka started the business from $35 and has seen it grow to a capital of over $120. She learned of Milango from her friends.

Mwaka is applying for a loan of 21,500 Kenya shillings to purchase fish. Her main challenges include the high cost of products and transportation.
She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children’s school fees and has an ambition of being a wholesale supplier of fish and other groceries.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Kanipu

texts.en:
Kanipu is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is single and has owned a cereals stall for thirty years. In this stall, she sells most cereals which the residents then use to make meals e.g. maize, millet, beans, etc. During rainy seasons, she also sells green groceries. 

Kanipu is applying for a loan of 73,050 to buy more vegetables and fruit for wholesale purposes. 

Her future ambition is to start three other centres beside this current business. Kanipu expects to achieve this through the income obtained from this business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fruit for wholesale purposes.

loans.name: Maria Lina

texts.en:
Maria Lina, 46 years old, lives in Cortes, Bohol with her family. She is a married mother of six children, her oldest 26 and her youngest 13. Maria Lina makes baskets for a living, usually spending her day weaving fiber to make them. She is requesting a loan to buy more materials such as fiber that she can process. Her hard work is for her children's needs.

In the future, she would like to see her children successful in their studies with a chance at a good life.

loans.use: to buy more materials such as fiber.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité "Las Emprendedoras"tiene mas de 2 años de formación y trabájo con al Fundación Paraguaya, sus integrantes son mujeres jefas de familia que se esfuerzan al máximo para poder ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Silvia es una  integrante de éste comité, se unió al grupo por la necesidad de tener una ayuda que le permita generar mas ingresos , para solventar los diversos gastos del hogar , y tambien la educación de sus hijos , ya que és madre soltera y jefa de hogar. Anhela un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerza todos los días en la venta de pescados para que de esa forma pueda darles  la oportunidad de estudiar y lograr un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pescados, con lo que podrá abastecerse y de esa forma cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee “Las Emprendedoras” was established more than two years ago and has been working with Fundación Paraguaya ever since. These members are female heads of household who strive very hard to help their families.

Sra. Silvia is a member of this committee. She joined the group because she needed help with generating more income in order to cover various household expenses and her children’s education. Silvia is already a single mother and the head of her household. She wants a better future for her children, so she strives hard every day by selling fish. Working in this manner gives her children the opportunity to study and achieve a better future.

Silvia is requesting a loan in order to buy fish. This will replenish her inventory so that she can satisfy the demand from her customers.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
Martha Elena tiene 41 años de edad, esta casada, con 3 hijos dependientes. Vive en casa propia, la cual reside en el distrito de Tambogrande al norte del Peru y cuenta con servicios básicos de luz y agua.

Lentamente Martha a logrado desarrollar un bodega de venta de abarrotes, bebidas y golosinas. Ademas brinda servicio de fotocopias al lado de instituto agropecuario hace aproximadamente más de 15 años. Esta fue una inversion la cual demuestra su abilidad para los identificar oportunidades de negocios y trabajo duro. Atendiendo todos los días en su propio domicilio, para lo cual cuenta con clientela establecida. Cuenta con buen nivel de inventario en negocios. 

Solicita crédito para la compra de mercadería en abarrotes como (arroz, azúcar, aceites, articulos de primera necesidad, accesorios etc), ademas para mantenimiento de maquina fotocopiadora. Clienta es conocida en la zona y ya cuenta con clientela establecida.
texts.en:
Martha Elena is 41 years old, married and has three dependent children.  She lives in her own home, in Tambogrande district, in the north of Peru.  She receives basic services (electricity and water).

Martha has slowly managed to develop her store where she sells groceries, drinks and candies.  She has also been providing a photocopying service beside an agricultural institute for more than 15 years.  She has shown her ability to identify business opportunities and to work hard.  She works in her own home every day and has an established customer base.  She has good stock levels.

Martha is requesting a loan to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, basic household products, accessories, etc.  She will also have her photocopier serviced.  She is well known in her area and already has an established customer base.

loans.use: to buy groceries and to have her photocopier serviced

loans.name: Scolasicah

texts.en:
Scolasicah is from Tiribe, Kenya.  She is married and lives with her family in a house she owns that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She operates two different businesses.  One is a motorcycle taxi service and the other is a food stall business that she has been working on for one year.  She remarks that her job in the motorcycle taxi business is very difficult because, during the rainy season, she faces many obstacles since she has fewer passengers due to the cold weather.  Her dream is to buy more motorcycles to work and thus grow her business a bit more every day. 

She is requesting this loan in order to buy replacement parts for her motorcycle taxi, since it is essential to her job.  She is happy with opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for her motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es:
Evaristo tiene 51  años de edad,  esta casado, con 3  hijos uno de ellos aun dependiente. Cliente vive en la zona rural del distrito de Morrope en una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 20  familias que cuenta con servicios de  luz. La actividad que desarrolla es venta de crianza y  comercialización  de animales(contando con ganado vacuno caprino y aves de corral),  la cual realiza desde hace 10 años. El negocio esta situado en su domicilio y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Ademas, el cliente siembre menestra el cual es una parte del rubro que esta buscando expander.   

El destino del crédito será para invertir ena la culminacion de la construccion de su domicilio y compra de menestra en chacra.  Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización debido a la experiencia en el manejo de su negocio, los mecados donde lleva su menestra de manera semanal, es el mercado de abastos de Piura.
texts.en:
Evaristo is 51 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is still dependent on him.  He lives in the rural area of Morrope district, in a small community of approximately 20 families which has electricity.  Evaristo's business is raising and selling livestock (he keeps cows, goats and farmyard birds).  He has been in this business for ten years.  His business is located at home and he learned from his parents which means that he knows this work inside out.  In addition, he also grows pulses (legumes).  This is the part of his business that he is looking to expand.

Evaristo will invest his loan in finishing the building of his house and in buying pulses from farms.  There is competition in this business but there is also a large market and he has experience.  He takes his produce to the wholesale market in Piura once a week to sell.

loans.use: to finish building his house and to buy pulses (legumes)

loans.name: Chhun's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Chhun is a 37-year-old mother of four dependent children -- one daughter and three sons. Three of them are still in school. She and her husband earn a living as farmers, farming rice and planting cassava. She has been in this business for almost 20 years, earning about 20,800KHR per day to spend for daily expenses. 

Chhun is in her third loan cycle with VisionFund, while her fellow group member is just with VisionFund this loan cycle. The past loans from VisionFund have helped better support her family and enabled her to send her children to school. 

Now leading her group of two to apply for a loan, Chhun will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. With this loan, she hopes to make more income from her current business and also hopes to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Maria Ysabel

texts.es:
Maria Ysabel tiene 33 años de  edad, esta casada con 3 hijos dependientes. Su casa se ubica en Tambogrande en la parte rural del Norte de Peru. Vive en casa propia con esposo que le ayuda con las tareas del campo y aportando también  ingresos al hogar. 

La actividad que desarrolla la titular es la crianza de animales ovinos, porcinos, crianza de aves de corral, ademas se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace mas de 4 años para diversificar su ganancias. Para seguir consolidando sus actividades ella desea invertir en compra de un lote de mercaderia de productos de belleza y compra de  de alimento balanceado para animales. Tiene deseos de seguir emprendiendo en el crecimiento del negocio y en la mejora del nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Ysabel is 33 years old, married and has three dependent children.  Her home is located in Tambogrande, in the rural part of North Peru.  She lives in her own home together with her husband who helps her with the farm work and also contributes income to the household.

Maria Ysabel's business is raising sheep, pigs and farmyard birds.  She has also been selling beauty products for more than four years to diversify her profits.  In order to continue consolidating her businesses, she would like to invest in buying beauty products and also nutritionally-balanced feed for her animals.  She would like to continue growing her businesses and improving her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and also nutritionally-balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Sophout's Group

texts.en:
Sophout, 57, is a citizen from a village located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a married mother of four children. Rubber tree and cassava planting is the main source of her family’s income. She and her husband have been in this business for almost 25 years, earning about 49,000KHR per day to make a living. 

Sophout’s group consists of two members, and she is in her first loan cycle as a client. Her fellow group member has been with VisionFund for one other loan cycle. She is leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,000,000KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farming. She hopes to grow her business and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farming.

loans.name: Sroeun's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Sroeun is a 44-year-old mother of four children -- one daughter and three sons. Sroeun and her husband are hardworking farmers. The main sources of the family’s income are rice farming, vegetable planting and pig raising. They have been in this business for 19 years, earning a daily income of around 24,000KHR. 

This is the second loan for Sroeun’s group of three members with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Having completely paid back her first loan, she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy more piglets for her pig-raising business. She hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income to make her living conditions better.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for her pig-raising business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Argedis

texts.es:
Argedis es otro ejemplo de personas responsables, que luego de sacar y pagar un primer prestamo en Edpyme Alternatica con el apoyo de Kiva, busca un nuevo credito que le siga ayudando a mantener su oficio y lidear con los problemas de seasonality.  

El es hombre trabajador de 30 años de edad, quien vive con su esposa e hijo en una pequeña comunidad rural perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande al Norte del Peru. El se dedica a la crianza de ovinos y a la agricultura. Cuenta con terreno agrícola en el cual siembra limón y mango que cosecha semanalmente y asiste diariamente. 

La venta de animales y de sus frutos le permite a Argedis darle ciertas comodidades a su familia. Sin embargo, él tiene muchos deseos de darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Cliente invertirá en compra de fertilizantes para limón y compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales y venderlos a un mejor precio, su conviviente lo apoya en sus actividades que realiza.
texts.en:
Argedis is a responsible person.  He took out and repaid his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa, with Kiva's support, and is now looking to take out a new loan which will continue helping him to maintain his business and deal with seasonality problems.

Argedis is a hard-working 30-year-old man who lives with his wife and child in a small rural community in Tambogrande district, in the North of Peru.  His business is raising sheep and farming.  He has farmland where he grows lemons and mangoes which he tends to daily and harvests weekly.

Selling his animals and fruit allows Argedis to provide his family with certain comforts.  However, he has a great desire to provide his family with a better quality of life.  He will invest this loan in buying fertilizers for his lemon crops and nutritionally-balanced feed for fattening his animals so that he can sell them at a better price.  His wife supports him in his work.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced animal feed and fertilizer for his lemon crops

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es: JOSE DANIEL TIENE 54 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVE CON SU CONYUGUE Y TIENE HIJOS DISIPADOS. VIVE EN ZONA RURAL Y TIENE BUENAS RELACIONES CON SUS VECINOS Y BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES. EL SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ABARROTES EN GENERAL ,DESDE HACE MAS DE 11 AÑOS,EN SU PROPIO DOMICILIO. EN PARTE EL HA PODIDO SACAR ADELANTE ESTE NEGOCIO PRECISAMENTE GRACIAS AL TRABAJO DURO Y A CREDITOS PREVIOS CON EDPYME ALTERNATIVA. EN ESTA OCASION EL PRESTAMO LO NECESITA PARA  COMPRA DE MERCADERIA (ABARROTES), ASI TENER MEJORES INGRESOS  Y PODER MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en: José Daniel is 54 years old.  He lives with his wife and has children who no longer live at home.  He lives in a rural area and has good relations with his neighbors and good personal references.  He has been selling groceries from his home for more than 11 years.  He has managed to make progress in this business thanks to his own hard work and previous loans from Edpyme Alternativa.  On this occasion, he needs a loan to buy merchandise (groceries).  This will make him better income and he will be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his grocery store

loans.name: Samean's Group

texts.en:
Samean is 33 years and married. She resides in a village of the Dambae district where crop farming is a common way to make a living. She has four children dependent on her, and they are still in school. Like other villagers in her village, Samean and her husband have been farming rice on 1 hectare of farmland and planting cassava on 1 hectare of farmland for 12 years. As a farmer, she has been challenged with low income due to the drop of cassava’s price. 

This is the second loan for Samean’s group of two members, who are both female. She has used her first loan successfully to support her living and children’s education. Now requesting a loan with VisionFund, Samean, who is the leader, wants to use her portion to purchase fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her crop healthfully and increase her income so as to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Sitha's Group

texts.en:
Sitha is 31 years old and married, with three dependent children who are still in school. Her family's source of income is from rice farming and cassava planting. Having been in this business for several years, she is able to earn about 25,000 Riel (KHR) per day. Her main challenge for her family's business is the drop of cassava's price which has decreased her income. 

Sitha's group consists of two members who live in the same village of the Dambae district. This is her fifth loan while her group member is just starting with VisionFund with this loan. After the four loans, she is confident that she will gradually make her standard of living better. 

Sitha, who is the leader of the loan group, is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and will also use a portion of it to pay for labor. She hopes to make more income from her current business so as to keep her children in school until graduation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sreynan's Group

texts.en:
Sreynan is 29 years old and married, with four dependent children who are still in school. She lives with her family in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. Her family's income is from rice farming and cassava planting. Having been in this business for several years, she is able to earn about 36,700 Riel (KHR) per day. Her main challenge for her family's business is the drop of cassava's price which has decreased her income. 

Sreynan's group consists of two members who live in the same village. This is her third loan from VisionFund but the first for her group member. After the past loans, she has been able to better support her family and afford to buy some household necessities. 

Sreynan, who is the loan group leader, is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and sell them for a good price to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y habita conjuntamente con su esposo en casa propia en un distrito de mas de 10 mil habitantes. Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, venta de cerveza en su domicilo desde hace mas de 3 años.

El prestamo lo solicita para invertirlo en su negocio, especificamente para la compra de cerveza, maiZ duro, y para compra de sillas y accesorios para  la venta y de esa forma tenga mas ingresos para el sustento de su familia, y por ende una mejor condicion de vida en la zona. Esta cliente es recurrente y desde el dia en que empezò a trabajar con la entidad, la vida de la cliente a cambiado, pues es mas conocida y su ventas son mejores y por ende tiene mas ongresos.

Uno de sus objetivos primordiales es captar mas clientes y que la venta  sea al 100%, por lo que para lograr todo esto, se esfuerza con mucha responsabilidad y trabaja de sol a sol. El mercado es potencial para la inversion en este tipo de negocio, pues en su mayoria los pobladores, especificamente las ama de casa son la que venden la chicha y lo realizan por turno y eso es bueno, pues no tienen que competir, y las perspectivas del mercado es un buen nicho para que  obtengan mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Teodora is 28 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  She has two children in her care.  The family live in their own home, in a district of more than 10,000 inhabitants.  Teodora has been selling 'chicha de jora' (a corn-based drink) and beer from her home for more than three years.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.  In particular, she will buy beer and corn.  She will also buy chairs and sales supplies so that she can make more income with which to support her family and, consequently, enjoy better living conditions.  Teodora is a longstanding client and, from the day she started working with the entity, her life has changed as she is better known, her sales have improved and she makes more income.

One of Teodora's main aims is to attract more customers and for her sales to be at 100%.  In order to achieve all this, she works hard and responsibly from morning til night.  The market is right for an investment in this type of business as it is mainly local residents, specifically housewives, who sell 'chicha'.  They do so in shifts and this is good because it means that they don't have to compete.  It is a good market niche for making more income.

loans.use: to buy beer, corn, chairs and sales supplies

loans.name: Georgi

texts.ru:
Георгий занимается сельскохозяйственным бизнесом в деревне Севакар, Сьюникского региона, на протяжении 6 лет. Георий разводит крупный рогатый скот, кур и пчел, выращивает овощи и фрукты. 
Полученную сельскохозяйственную продукцию: молоко, сыр, яйца, мед, фрукты и овощи, Георгий продает в городе Капане, региональном центре Сьюника. Продукция Георгия всегда пользуется большим спросом, так как он держит качеству своей продукции на очень высоком уровне. Особенным спросом пользуется мед, так как он очень полезен и натурален. 
  
Георгию необходим кредит в размере 1.000.000 драм для приобретения грузового автомобиля, при помощи которого он будет перевозить улья со своей фермы в горы, а также сено с полей для своих коров, быков и телят. 
 
Георгию 31 год, он окончил Ереванский сельскохозяйственный университет. Георгий женат и у него есть четырехлетняя дочь. Параллельно с ведением сельского хозяйства, Георгий работает лесником. Жена Георгия работает в детском саду. Также с ними проживают родители Георгия: отец помогает ему в ведении сельского хозяйства, а мать работает медсестрой.
texts.en:
For the past 6 years, Georgi has been a farmer in the village of Sevakar, Syuniksk region. Georgi raises cattle, chickens and bees, and grows fruit and vegetables. He sells his products - milk, cheese, eggs, honey and produce - in the city of Kapan. Georgi's products are always in high demand as he consistently maintains their high quality. His honey, particularly, is very popular, as it is organic and very good for health.

Georgi needs a loan of 1,000,000 dram to purchase a truck, which he will use to transport his beehives from his farm into the mountains, and also to bring hay from the fields for his cows, bulls and calves.

Georgi is 31 years old. He graduated from the Yerevan Agricultural University. Georgi is married and has a four-year-old daughter. In addition to being a farmer, he works as a forester, while his wife works in a kindergarten. Georgi's parents live together with their family: his father helps with farming, while his mother works as a nurse.

loans.use: To buy a truck for his agricultural business

loans.name: Yanine

texts.es: La Sra. Yanine tiene 24 años y tiene 2 hijos que son de las edades de 6 y 3 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona este de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Yanine va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa de invierno por mayor y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es compra de mercadería ropa de invierno, la Sra. Yanine  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener más cobertura de mercado y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir mejorando su trabajo su deseo para su negocio es tener una gran tienda donde pueda distribuir ropa por mayor.
texts.en: Yanine is 24-years-old and has a partner and two children who are three and six-years-old.  She works selling clothing in her retail stall which is located in the eastern zone of the city of Santa Cruz.  This loan is her first with this organization.  Yanine will use the loan to buy winter clothing at wholesale prices and in this way increase her working capital.  Her reason for requesting the loan is to buy winter clothing merchandise.  Yanine has faced challenges in her business such as having greater coverage of the market and will use these benefits to continue improving her business.  Her hope for her business is to have a large store where she can distribute clothing at wholesale prices.

loans.use: to buy wholesale winter clothing.

loans.name: Marylin Esther

texts.es: Marylin   está muy agradecida con el apoyo económico que recibió de Kiva en su anterior crédito, porque con él aumentó su volumen de compras de calzado, cosméticos y electrodomésticos que vendió y aumentó su cartera de cuentas por cobrar. En la actualidad se prepara para recibir un nuevo credikiva con el cual responderá a los pedidos de sandalias femeninas, masculinas e infantiles, artículos en plata. Con ello planea aumentar aun mas su capital de trabajo y ganar un poco mas que antes; por eso envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores:    “Estoy muy emocionada con el apoyo económico que estoy recibiendo de Kiva y la FMSD, espero seguir progresando con la continuidad de este apoyo. “
texts.en:
Marylin is extremely grateful for the financial assistance she received from Kiva in her previous loan, as using that loan, she increased her purchase volumes of footwear, cosmetics and electrical household appliances which she sold and thereby increased her portfolio of accounts receivables. 

She is currently preparing to receive a new Kiva loan with which she will meet orders for women's, men's and children's sandals and silver articles. In this way, she plans to increase her working capital even more and earn more than before. She sends the following message to her financial backers: "I am so thankful for the financial support that I am receiving from Kiva and FMSD, I hope to carry on progressing with the continuing support."

loans.use: to purchase men's, women's, and children's sandals, and silver items

loans.name: Seang's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Seang is a 52-year-old father of six children, two of whom are dependent, working at the family’s business. His family’s income is mainly from cassava planting on two-hectares of farmland. He has been in this business for almost thirty years, earning about 26,700 KHR per day to spend for daily expenses. 

Seang is in his third cycle loan with VisionFund and he completely paid back the past two loans, which have helped his family have sufficient food to eat. He and other two members who are first and second cycle client are applying for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, he will use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland. With this loan, he hopes to make more income from his current business and also hopes to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Anzazi

texts.en:
With her previous loan, Anzazi bought sacks of potatoes, tomatoes and onions as well as fresh vegetables that she sold, increasing her working capital slightly. Now she is applying for a new Kiva loan, because her buyers have requested more products, as they are an established clientele, and Anzazi's working capital is insufficient to meet the growth in demand.

This is the reason why her Kiva loan will be successful, because she will respond to the demand by buying fruits and vegetables from the harvest, at a good price and above all very fresh. Anzazi tells the lenders that her Kiva loan will be very useful to her. She says thank you for helping her.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables including tomatoes and cabbages for resale

loans.name: Ches' Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Ches is aged 39 and married with five children, three daughters and two sons. Her family’s income is mainly from cassava planting on three-hectares of farmland to support her big family. Having been in this business for almost twenty years, she is able to earn about 27,800 KHR per day to spend for daily expenses. 

This is the first loan for Ches with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group member who has been with VisionFund two loan cycles to apply for a loan of 1,000,000KHR and 1,400,000KHR respectively. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it for labor. With this loan, she hopes to increase her cassava crops so as to make more income and also hopes to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
A farmer from a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Ny is 54 years old and married. She has seven children, five daughters and two sons, who are farmers and students. To make a living to support her big family, she and her husband have been farming rice and planting cassava for twenty years. Her current business earns her about US$10 per day but she is only able to save around US$3 each day. 

Ny has been with VisionFund for one cycle already and she completely paid back the loan, which has helped better support her business and family. Now requesting a loan of US $1,500 with VisionFund, Ny will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it for labor. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields and earn a larger income so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Masudi

texts.en:
Masudi, 43, is the father of four children. He lives in Kaloleni, Kenya.

He has operated a business of making metal boxes for sale. He gained important experience in handling metal products while he was working as a constructor and mason previously. 

Masudi's business has allowed him to get ahead, to have a dairy farm, and to earn enough income to have some comforts. His goal is to expand his business more so that his children can obtain a good quality education and be successful in whatever they endeavor. 

Masudi is currently planning to take out his first Kiva loan of KES 40,000, which will be his third funding through Yehu Microfinance Trust. He will use it to buy plain metal sheets for making boxes. He generates good profits when he buys in bulk, which is what he plans to do in this instance.

loans.use: To purchase plain metal sheets for making metalic boxes for sale.

loans.name: Stanely

texts.en:
Stanley is 23 years old. He sells second-hand caps to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years. 

He operates his business in a competitive environment. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has become business-oriented because he has been trained on business management. 

He hopes to have a stable family and business in five years. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy caps.

loans.use: To buy second-hand caps.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 24-year-old single man. He describes himself as aggressive, determined and visionary. 

He operates a retail business and retail store where he sells building blocks, ballast, sand and household items. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located at a conducive business environment and his primary customers are contractors. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more sand, ballast and stones.

James has taken two earlier loans that he managed to repay well. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a contractor and buy land for his family.

loans.use: to buy more sand, ballast and stones.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 47 years old. He is married to Belita and together they have three children who are 17, 12 and 7 years old.

He sells animal feed and has been in the business for the past four years.

This is his second loan. He paid his previous loan well and on time. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers. 

He will use the loan amount to purchase more animal feed for stock in his business to sell to his customers, who are mostly farmers.

He hopes to purchase a truck to aid in transportation of the animal feed.

loans.use: to purchase more animal feed for resale.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia es socia del Bancomunal Cusi Urpi y tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera y madre de una hija. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 15 años y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de yogurt y cremolada.  Durante este tiempo que viene trabajando con FINCA Perú, Lidia ha aprendido la importancia de ahorrar, de ser puntual y responsable. Su sueño para el futuro es tener más sucursales de su negocio y repartir las cremoladas y yogurt por mayor. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en su negocio, comprando ingredientes para la elaboración de yogurt y cremoladas como leche, conservantes, frutas.
texts.en: Lidia is a partner in the Communal Bank Cusi Urpi and is 35 years old, and a single mother of one daughter. She has been a partner with FINCA Peru for 15 years and is dedicated to selling yogurt and smoothies. During the time that she has worked with FINCA Peru, Lidia has learned the importance of saving, being punctual and responsible. Her dream for the future is to make more branches of her business and sell more smoothies and yogurts. The loan she is asking for will be invested back in her business to purchase ingredients to make yogurt and smoothies like milk, conserves and fruit.

loans.use: purchase ingredients to make yogurt and smoothies like milk, conserves and fruits.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es: Rufina es socia del Bancomunal Cusi Urpi y tiene 68 años de edad, es viuda. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 4 años y se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras, pan y abarrotes. Durante todo este tiempo trabajando con FINCA Perú, Rufina ha aprendido la importancia de ahorrar y a ser responsable. Su sueño para el futuro es progresar al lado de sus tres hijos que todavía están en el colegio. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para vender como frutas, verduras, arroz, leche, azúcar.
texts.en:
Rufina, 68, is a member of the “Cusi Urpi” communal bank.  She’s a widow.  She’s been a member of Finca Perú for the last four years and she sells fruit, vegetables, bread and groceries.

During all this time working with Finca Perú, Rufina has learned the importance of saving and to be responsible.  

Her dream for the future is to make progress alongside her three children who are still in school.

She will use the loan she’s requesting to buy merchandise to sell like fruit, vegetables, rice, milk and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables, rice, milk, and sugar for her store

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es: Aurelia es socia del Bancomunal Santa Elena y tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente y es madre de una hija. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años y se dedica a la venta de comidas. En todo este tiempo Aurelia ha aprendido a ahorrar y a ser responsable en el manejo de su dinero. Su sueño para el futuro es tener una casa propia donde pueda ciar a su hija. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para preparar la comida como arroz, fideos, verduras, menestras, carne.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a member of Bancomunal Santa Elena and is 38 years old. She lives with her partner and is the mother of one daughter. 

She has been a member of FINCA Perú for three years and she works selling food. In that time, Aurelia has learned to save her money and to manage her money responsibly. Her dream for the future is to have her own house where she can raise her daughter. 

She will invest the loan that she is requesting in the purchase of ingredients to prepare food, such as rice, pasta, vegetables, legumes, and meat.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for preparing food, such as rice, pasta, vegetables, legumes, and meat.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Maria de 29 años de edad, casada y con 4 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en Tambogrande en la parte  rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz. Ella es una cliente recurrente y el prestamo anterios le sirvio para mantener un ganado de buena calidad.  

Precisamente, la actividad que desarrolla la titular es la crianza de ganado menor (ovino y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado local; cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia en la ganadería. Su esposo cuenta con una chacra propia en la cual tiene mango en producción y también cuenta con una mototaxi en la cual trabaja por las tardes.
texts.en:
Luz Maria is 29 years old, married and has four children in her care.  She lives in her own home with her husband and children.  The house is located in the rural part of Tambogrande district but they receive electricity.  Luz Maria is a long-standing client and she used her previous loans to maintain good-quality livestock.

As mentioned, Luz Maria's business is raising livestock (sheep and farmyard birds).  When they reach an ideal size and weight she sells them in the local market.  She has more than three years experience in livestock raising.  Her husband has his own farm where he grows mangoes.  He also has a motorcycle taxi that he works with in the afternoons.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her livestock

loans.name: Trob

texts.en:
Trob is 48 years old, residing in a rural area of Dambae district, Cambodia. She is married with four children, two daughters and two sons, who are still in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and planting cassava to support her family. She has been in this business for twenty years earning about 26,000 KHR per day from her current business. 

This is the first loan for Trob with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR, she wants to use this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it for labor. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 29 years old. He does tailoring to earn a living. He has been in the business for five years. He runs his business in a competitive environment with reliable customers. He hopes to become more developed and to expand his business in five years. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 46 years old, married, and has eight children. He does carpentry to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years and has one employee. Besides carpentry, he also does crop farming to generate extra income. 

Previously, Robert had acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him grow his business. He has been empowered economically because he has been trained in business management skills. He hopes to expand his business in five years. He needs a loan of 40,000 KES to buy a power saw.

loans.use: to buy  a power saw.

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Foday. He is married and has four children, age 16, 13, 9 and 6. He has three additional dependents who live with him. They are his wife and two brothers The two brothers are staying with him for schooling.  

In 2001, Foday established his patient drugs business. He began his business just to enable him to provide support to his children and that is his only source of income. 

Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about SLL 630,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Foday requires a loan in order to buy panadol, Pinoplex, ampicillin and amoxilin. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 320,000. 

In the future, Foday plans to increase his stock level by seeking more funds from ARD, and to own a house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy patient drugs.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 45-year-old married man. He has eight children with ages ranging from 12 years to 23 years. He describes himself as focused and humble. 

He provides services of grinding maize into flour. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located at a conducive business environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of funds for improving the business. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy maize for grinding into flour for selling. His business goal is to run an improved business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have expanded his business.

loans.use: to purchase maize for grinding into flour.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is a married man and has one child aged one year. He resides in a rental house with no access to electricity or piped water. His monthly expenses include food and expenses for the family. 

For the past seven years, Issa has operated a welding business. He also generates additional income by selling timber at his workshop. Issa has applied for a loan of 20,000 KES from Yehu Microfinance Trust to buy more plain sheets for making metal boxes. Issa sells to all categories of people and works six days a week. His major business challenges include seasonality and the high cost of purchasing plain metal sheets. Issa hope to see his business expand to be a wholesaler of metal in the future.

loans.use: Purchase plain metal sheets for making metal boxes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more household items.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en:
Eddy is 30 years old and lives in the town of Luwero, in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children, 2 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Eddy has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells soft drinks. 

To help expand his business, Eddy has requested a loan of 2500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soft drinks for resale. This will help Eddy to generate greater profits and improve his standard of living. Eddy hopes that, in the future, he will be able to provide the products to his customers at a cheaper price. 

Eddy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Eddy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, like soda, for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Trabajadoras 2, es el grupo de mujeres de la ciudad de Concepción. El comité cuenta con 19 integrantes en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad a la que se dedican por más pequeña que sea.
Leonidas es una de las miembros del grupo, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que siempre se esfuerza al máximo por poder ayuda a su familia. Ve en el programa de la fundación, una gran oportunidad de progreso para ella y sus amigas.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, como camperas, camisas, pantalones, buzos, medias y demás, ya que con ello podrá tener mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradecen por la ayuda que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Trabajadoras 2 [Working Women 2] is a group of women from the city of Concepción. The bank has 19 members who all have some small activity to which they dedicate their time, no matter how small it is. 
Leonidas is one of the members of the group. She is a very hard-working and enterprising person who always works as hard as she can so that she can help her family. She considers the foundation's programme to be a great opportunity for her and her friends to make progress.
She is requesting the loan to buy clothes of all kinds: jackets, shirts, trousers, jumpers, stockings and more, so that she has a wider variety of products to offer her clients. All of the women are grateful for the help which they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason is 42 years old and has two children. He sells spare parts to earn a living. He has been in the business for seven years and has one employee. He runs his business in a conducive environment with reliable customers. 

Jason had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped him grow his business. He has also been empowered economically because he has been trained in business management. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He needs a loan of 100,000 KES to buy spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Soeung

texts.en:
Soeung, 46, lives with his family - his wife and children - in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. He is married with four children, one of whom is already married. He has been a rice farmer for almost 27 years with experience. He plants and harvests rice alongside his wife for sale each harvest season, which usually occurs twice a year. With the income from the business, he is able to provide daily sustenance for the family and send his children to school.

He has applied for a loan of KHR 300,000 to purchase farm supplies and pay for the operating expenses. He hopes that he can further improve his rice farming business through his effort and with the help of the loan. In the future, he wants to purchase extra plots of farmland to expand his business and thereby increase his household income.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and pay for the operating expenses.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 23 years old. He sells caps to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years. He operates his business in a competitive environment. 

Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has improved on his savings skills because he has been trained on financial management. 

He hopes to have a stable business in five years. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy caps.

loans.use: To buy caps.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John does photography for a living. In addition, he entertains kids. He does not have a permanent place of business, so he uses his motorbike to move from one customer to another. He has been in the business for seven years. He describes his business to be improving. He dreams of having a permanent photo studio in the future as he progresses. He needs a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy a camera.

loans.use: To buy a camera.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 48 years old and lives in the town of Bombo, in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, 1 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her stationery shop, which sells books, pens and does printing. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more printing papers and books for resale, and will help Aisha to generate greater profits. Her business has increased from what it was before. Aisha hopes that, in the future, she will be able to get another loan from BRAC so as to expand her business and buy another printing machine. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Aisha, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more printing papers and books for resale.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 27 years old, married and has five children. He operates a mobile business of selling clothes. He has been in the business for five years and has one employee. Besides this business, he also has a retail shop which his wife operates. 

Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, Christopher has improved on his savings because he has been trained in financial management. He hopes to have a stable family and operate a wholesale business in five years. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 51 year old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 18 years to 25 years. She describes herself to be creative and focused. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located within a productive area and her primary customers are co-operatives. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the  business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to pay for rent on a piece of land for planting napppier grass for her cows. Her business goal is to double her dairy cows from two to four within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be  a large scale farmer.

loans.use: to pay rent of land for planting nappier grass for the cows.

loans.name: Lubwama

texts.en:
Lubwama is 49 years old and lives in the town of Bombo, in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children. For the past 12 years, Lubwama has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells electronic items. 

To help expand his business, Lubwama has requested a loan of 3000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more electronic items for resale, and will help Lubwama to generate greater profits and start up other businesses with in the town. Lubwama hopes that, in the future, he will be able to increase his stock and that will attract more customers. 

Lubwama is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lubwama who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more electronic items for resale.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
