Alma is thirty nine years old and married. She has three children who are attending secondary and primary public schools. For the moment, she is the only financial provider for her family and this is a stressful time for her and the whole family. 

Alma has been in the livestock/dairy business for the past sixteen years, selling milk to local dairy farms and animals. She has been able to build a steady clientele that has continued to grow rapidly in the last few years. To keep up with the demands of her customers, she is now applying for a loan for the first time to replace the mature and unproductive cows with younger milking cows. To make it happen, Alma is seeking Kiva lenders’ support in this matter.

loans.use: to replace mature & unproductive cows with younger ones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more home products.

loans.name: Leidy Soledad

texts.es: Leidy tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y sin  hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa de padres, la cual esta ubicada en la parte urbana de Tambogrande y cuenta con servicios basicos. La actividad que desarrolla Leidy es la venta de cerveza en su domicilio. Esta joven emprendedora ha hecho esto desde hace mas de 2 años. También se desempeña como asistente en municipalidad de Tambogrande. Solicita crédito para la adquisición de capital de trabajo en la compra al por mayor  de cajas de cerveza. Clienta ya es conocida en la zona, cuenta con clientela establecida.
texts.en: Leidy is 22 years old, single and doesn't have any children in her care.  She lives in her parents' home which is located in the urban part of Tambogrande and has basic services.  Leidy's business is selling beer from home.  This young entrepreneur has been in her business for more than two years.  In addition, she also works as an assistant in Tambogrande municipality.  She is requesting this loan to buy crates of beer wholesale.  She is already well-known in her area and has an established customer base.

loans.use: to purchase beer for resale

loans.name: Gibrilla

texts.en:
This is 31 year-old Gibrilla. He is married and has two children, age 7 and 4. 

In 2001, Gibrilla established his ladies and gents wearing and traveling box business. He began his business because he wanted to engage himself in an economic activity and that is his only source of survival. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,500,000. 

Gibrilla has already received and successfully repaid a loan, and now he requires a new loan in order to buy jeans trousers costing SLL 2,000,000, traveling boxes costing SLL 1,500,000 and polo costing SLL 1,000,000. 

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. In the future, Gibrilla plans to establish a boutique, to complete the construction of his house and to educate his children.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy jeans trousers costing SLL 2,000,000, traveling boxes costing SLL 1,500,000 and polo costing SLL 1,000,000.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 31 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, with three of them currently in school. For the past six years, Mary has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar, and soap for resale, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to stock more items for her clients. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar, and soap for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cereals.

loans.name: Vida Nueva Group

texts.es:
El comité "Nueva Vida"  surge con la esperanza de progreso que tienen cada una de las miembros. Ellas, gracias al programa comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras han logrado ir creciendo y de esa forma ayudan a sus familias. Las señoras valoran la importancia de un crédito y la oportunidad  de estar en un comité.
Gregoria forma parte del grupo, y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de comidas de todo tipo, y le va bien porque sus comidas son muy ricas y gustadas por sus clientes. Gracias a su buena sazón ha logrado formarse una buena clientela que siempre acude a ella y compra sus alimentos.
Ella desea seguir creciendo y solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo las comidas que vende. Quiere poder comprar verduras, hortalizas, condimentos y demás, ya que esto le ayudara mucho.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Vida" Group began because of each member's hope of progress.  The women, thanks to the program called Mujeres Emprendedoras, have succeeded in growing and they now can help their families.  The women value the importance of loans and the opportunity to be part of the group.

Gregoria is a member of the group and says that she sells all types of food.  It is going well because her dishes are delicious and loved by her customers.  Thanks to her good recipes, she has successfully formed a great clientele that always comes to her to buy her dishes.

She strives to continue growing and she is asking for this loan so that she can buy ingredients to be able to continue making and selling her dishes.  She wants to be able to buy vegetables, condiments and more, and this will really help her out.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, and more.

loans.name: Phyllis

texts.en:
Phyllis is a 55-year-old married woman. She has a son who is 35 years old. She describes herself as a social and creative woman. 

Phyllis operates a retail business where she sells bananas. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located near a market and her primary customers are local residents within the environs. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy bananas for resale. Her business goal is to be a supplier of bananas within five years. She hopes that in the future, she can run a banana processing plant so as to add value to the bananas flavor.

loans.use: to buy bananas for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 28 years old, married, and has three children. She operates a beauty salon and has one employee. She describes her business environment as busy with available customers. She has been in the business for five years. She also does pig farming. She has previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which has helped her grow her business.

Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save because she has been trained in financial management. She dreams of becoming successful in the future and buyin five pigs. She needs a loan of 50,000 KES to buy a blow dryer, hair oil, and a pig.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer, hair oil, and a pig.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 30 years old and lives in the town of Maganjo, in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children. For the past 2 years, Fred has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale, and will help Fred to generate greater profits and pay for his family's medical expenses. Fred hopes that, in the future, he will be able to expand his business into a whole sale shop. 

Fred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Fred, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is from the village Nagvazao, West Georgia. He is 41 years old, married and lives with his family: his wife Marina, a 10 year old daughter and his parents. He has requested loan from a local financial institution several times for an agricultural business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income of the family is a small dairy farm with 2 milk cows. Gela and Marina produce traditional West Georgian cheese and sell it in the village. Total average monthly income for the family is 300 Laris, including pensions of Gela’s parents. It is hardly enough for food, for a four member family. According to Credo estimations, Gela’s family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Gela has requested loan from Credo for constructing a greenhouse. His loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Gela will purchase wooden materials and polyethylene cover for the greenhouse. He will grow greens (in winter and spring months) and cucumbers (during summer and fall seasons) in the greenhouse. He will work hard in the greenhouse during whole year to get quality harvests. Gela will sell harvested products on the open market in the nearby town. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will increase the average monthly income of the family by 60 – 70%. The family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs. This will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is from the village of Tskhratskaro, West Georgia. He is 45 years old, married and lives with his family: his wife Ekaterina, his 83 year old father and two children (9 and 7 years old). The children go to school. David has requested loan from local financial institutions several times for his trading business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is a small dairy farm with two milk cows. David and Ekaterina produce cheese and sell it in the village. The total average monthly income of the family doesn’t exceed 300 Laris, including the monthly pension of David’s father. It is hardly enough to pay for food for a five member family. According to Credo estimations, David’s family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

David requested a loan from Credo to start-up trade with clothing. His loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

David will purchase clothes in Tbilisi (the capital city of the country, about 300 km from his village) for wholesale prices and resell them in his village and nearby villages. It will be hard work for David, but according to estimations, his business will be profitable and increase the income of the family by 50 – 60%. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. The family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs, in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for trade.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 40 years old. She is a single mother of three children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 5 years.She gets a monthly income of 15,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from her business.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to us by one of our field officers. She will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, and pesticides to use in the farm. 

Beatrice hopes to purchase another land so as to expand her farming.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is from the village of Kvitiri, West Georgia. She is 26 years old, married and lives with her big family: her husband Lasha, two daughters (3 and 1 years old), parents-in-law and the grandmother. She has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for agricultural business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of the income for the family is small scale family farming. They grow greens on a family-owned plot of land. Lia’s parents-in-law sell harvested greens at the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. It is hardly enough to pay for food for a seven member family. According to Credo estimations, Lia’s family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Lia has requested a loan from Credo for constructing a greenhouse. Her loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Lia will purchase iron materials and glass for the greenhouse. She will grow greens (in winter and spring months) and cucumbers (during summer and fall seasons) in the greenhouse. Lia and Lasha will work hard in the greenhouse during the whole year to get quality harvests. Lia’s parents-in-law will sell the harvested products at the open market in the nearby town. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will increase the average monthly income of the family by 50%. The family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy family members’ daily needs, in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is 45 years old and lives in the town of Maganjo, in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children, 2 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Kenneth has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells clothes and door curtains. 

To help expand his business, Kenneth has requested a loan of 3000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more curtains and clothes for resale, and will help Kenneth to generate greater profits and increase the capital into the business. Kenneth hopes that, in the future, he will be able to open up a boutique shop that sells clothes. 

Kenneth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Kenneth, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more curtains, clothes for resale.

loans.name: Akarapuara Group

texts.es:
El grupo Akarapuara está integrado por 10 mujeres de la ciudad de Curuguaty, que actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo y con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio están saliendo adelante y se están ayudando las unas a las otras. Es un grupo muy unido y que se destaca por el trabajo que hacen.
Lucia tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, ya que siempre y a toda hora tiene muchos clientes. Gracias a su buena onda con sus clientes ha logrado salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para llenar su despensa, con leche, embutidos, queso, fideos, azúcar y demás insumos, ya que son los que más salida tienen.
texts.en:
The Akarapuara Group is comprised of 10 women from the city of Curuguaty and they are now in their second loan cycle.  With a lot of effort and sacrifice, they are getting ahead and they are supporting each other.  This is a very close-knit group that is known for hard work.

Lucia has a store in which she works every day and she begins working early in the morning.  She always has a lot of customers at all hours.  Thanks to her good attitude and her great customer service, she has managed to get ahead.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy supplies to stock her shelves.  She needs milk, sausages, cheese, noodles, sugar, and other supplies, since these are the most purchased items.

loans.use: to buy milk, sausages, cheese, noodles, sugar, and other supplies.

loans.name: Karisa

texts.en:
Karisa is a 29 year old livestock seller in Kilifi. He is single. He has been selling goats for the past seven years successfully. 

This is Karisa’s third loan from KADET LTD. for financing his business. He plans to buy more goats to rear and later sell to his customers. 

He will use the proceeds to buy more livestock. He hopes to have a successful business and to be financially stable in life.

loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Savai's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Savai is aged 31 and married with four children, three sons and one daughter. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and planting rubber trees and sometimes she and her husband work for others for a fee to better support their family. Having been in this business for almost eleven years, she is able to earn about 8,900 KHR per day to spend for daily expenses. 

This is the first loan for Savai’s group of two members with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan of 500,000 KHR each, Savai will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it for labor. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields so as to make more income and also hopes to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Thei

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Thei is aged 28 years old and married with two dependent children, one son and one daughter, who are still in school. He and his wife earn a living through farming rice and planting cassava. He has been in this business for almost five years and this business earns him about 18,000 KHR per day to spend for daily expenses. 

This is the first loan for Thei with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR, Thei is going to use this loan to buy fertilizers for his farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor and build his house. With this loan, he hopes to increase his crop yields so as to make more income and also hopes to have a decent house to live in.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a hardworking man and lives in Kaloleni, Kenya. He is married with two children aged 5 and 8. He sells cloth retail, a business which he started six years ago. He is located nearby the market where little by little he has gained clients' trust and affection. With this business Hamisi is able to sustain his family and he has high expectations for growing this business since he works hard every day. 

Today his main clients are neighbors and passersby. However he wants to take more opportunities. His investment plan consists of diversifying his merchandise, adding more products requested by clients such as shoes, etc. This will improve his working conditions and amplify his product selection according to his clients' demand. This is why he is requesting a Kiva loan to expand his business. He believes he can succeed due to the high demand, his strength in his performance, and his work discipline. All of these qualities will help his business grow.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of cloth for resale

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is from Martvili District, West Georgia. She is 67 years old, married and lives with her husband: Valenti. Leila and Valenti have requested loans from local financial institutions several times for their agricultural business start-up, but without any success. Their loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Valenti and Leila are refugees from the Abkhazia Region, as a result of the armed conflict in 90s. The main source of the income for the family is a small vineyard with 200 vine trees. Valenti produces wine and sells it on the local open market. In addition, the family gets monthly social assistance for refugees and a pension. The total average monthly income doesn’t exceed 270 Laris, including pensions and social assistance. According to Credo estimations, Leila's family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Leila has requested a loan from Credo for purchasing a milking cow. Her loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Leila will purchase a milking cow. She will place the cow in the old cattle-shed, located in family yard. Leila will milk the cow twice a day and produce cheese. She will be able to sell, on average, 20 kg of cheese per month on the local open market. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will increase the average monthly income of the family by 40 - 45%. The family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs, in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Mwatumu

texts.en:
Mwatumu is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be polite, ambitious and kind. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables such as onions, tomatoes, kales, etc. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located at a busy competitive area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Mwatumu describes her biggest business challenge to be shortage of stock for resale. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more vegetables for selling. Her business goal is to be a supplier of vegetables within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to finance the education of her children with the profits generated from her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
El Sr Benjamin tiene 36 años, está casado con la Sra. Clavelina de 32 años, viven en casa propia en la ciudad de Caacupé, donde ambos se esfuerzan y se ayudan por salir adelante.
El Sr. Benjamin se dedica a la producción y ventas de ladrillos comunes, y nos dice que cuenta con su propio transporte para las ventas de sus ladrillos. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos distribuye en muchas zonas y eso le está ayudando a ir creciendo e ir mejorando día con día.
El solicita le crédito para la compra de arcilla, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes. Su meta es seguir trabajando y creciendo para poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Benjamin is 36 years old, he is married to Clavelina (she is 23 years old), and they live in their own home in the city of Caacupé where they both work hard and help each other to get ahead.

Benjamin makes and sells bricks and he tells us that he uses his own vehicle in order to sell them.  Thanks to the good quality of his products, he distributes them throughout the region and this is helping his business grow and things are improving day by day.

He is seeking a loan to buy clay with which he will be able to continue working and supplying the bricks that his customers need.  His goal is to continue working and growing and to be able to continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy clay for making bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate her restaurant and purchase more chairs and tables.

loans.name: Zippora

texts.en:
Zippora is a married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 14 years to 24 years. She describes herself to be humble and caring. She operates a retail store where she sells items such as sodas, soap, flour, salt, cooking fat etc. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located within a strategic business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Zippora will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more household necessities. Her business goal is to expand her business  within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will run a big shop and cater for her family's financial needs.

loans.use: to buy more household items.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 52 years old and married to Agnes. They are blessed with five children, the youngest being 3 years and eldest 24 years. He sells poles, a business he started 3 years ago, and earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

He has requested for a first loan of 30,000 KES to purchase more poles for sale. The profit he makes will aid him educate his children, cater to their basic needs, and purchase a piece of land.

His dream is to see his children get the best possible education as he continues with his business.

loans.use: To purchase more poles for resale.

loans.name: Lailah

texts.en:
Lailah is 45 years old and lives in the town of Maganjo in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Lailah has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which sells chicken. 

To help expand her business, Lailah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicken feed and help Lailah generate greater profits and put more capital into her business. Lailah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a big chicken farm. 

Lailah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program.  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lailah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more chicken feed for her poultry farm

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip is a married man. He has 2 children, ranging in age from 14 years to 28 years. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a farm where he sells maize and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a residential area, and his primary customers are local residents. He says his biggest business challenge is the harsh climate, which affects his crops. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. His business goal is to improve his business over the next 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have increased his working income to over a million Kenyan shillings.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martín, es casado y tiene seis hijos que están en etapa escolar y viven en una habitación en alquiler ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz; la habitación tiene paredes de ladrillo y es por eso que solicita el crédito para comprar estuco, calaminas, clavos y otros accesorios para la refacción del techo y las paredes de la habitación por que se encuentran muy deteriorados; la inversión que haga será como parte de pago de los alquileres que paga por dicha habitación.
El estudió solo hasta terminar la secundaria y actualmente trabaja como albañil por más de diez horas al día ya que es el único que aporta para los gastos de alimentación, educación y gastos médicos de su familia ya que tampoco cuentan con seguro médico.
El sueño de Martín, es tener su casa propia o tener un anticretico para dar más comodidad a su familia ya que son ocho integrantes y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Martín is married and has six children who are school age; they live in a rented dwelling located in the city of La Paz’s Pasankeri zone.  The dwelling has brick walls and this is why he’s requesting the loan to buy stucco, plywood, nails and other supplies to repair the roof and the walls of the dwelling that are deteriorated.  The investment he makes will count toward the rent he pays for said dwelling.

He only completed secondary school and is currently working in construction more than ten hours per day since he’s the only one that contributes towards his family’s food, schooling and medical expenses since they do not have medical insurance.

Martín’s dream is to have a house of his own or to have an ‘anticrético’ [Anticrético is a transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] to provide more comfort for his family which now counts 8 members thus improving their quality of life.  This is the first time he’s requested credit from IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Gerardo Rubén

texts.es:
El Sr. Gerardo es vendedor de queso, y comenta que gracias a un préstamo recibido de Kiva y de fundación paraguaya ha podido salir adelante e invertir en sus negocios. Su sueño es poder seguir creciendo y algún día poder tener un gran negocio.
El solicita nuevamente un crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de queso, con lo cual podrá seguir ganado y ayudando a su familia. Agradece por la nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Sr. Gerardo operates a cheese sales business.  He says that a loan he received from Kiva and Fundacion Paraguaya funded his business and allowed him to pull himself up.  For the future, he wants to build a larger business. 
Sr. Gerardo is applying for a new loan that he will use to stock his business.  The investment will make it possible for him to continue the business and support his family.  He is grateful, he says, for your help.

loans.use: to buy cheese for retail cheese business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 35 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 7 years, Jane has been working hard to manage her bakery, where she bakes bread and sells it. 

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more flour for making bread.  The loan will help Jane to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Jane hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a big factory that makes bread in town. 

Jane is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program.  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jane who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more flour for making bread

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru: Мастура очень веселая женщина, ей нравиться работать в салоне, так как каждый день она кому то приносит радость делая красивые прически и стрижки. У нее очень веселая компания сотрудников, с которыми она не скучает. У Мастуры 2 детей, ее муж работает в магазине продавцом. В этом году она планирует улучшить условия своего салона, что бы привлечь больше клиентов. В этом салоне она работает боле года, и уже имеет достаточный опыт в этом деле. Настоящий кредит получает для приобретения мебели для салона.
texts.en:
Mastura is a very happy woman. She likes working in a beauty salon because she can always make someone's day brighter by giving them a beautiful haircut or hairstyle. Additionally, she works with a fun group of her colleagues who always keep things interesting. Mastura has two children, and her husband works as a salesperson in a store. 

This year, Mastura is planning to improve her salon in order to attract more clientele. She has been working in this salon for over a year, and has sufficient experience in this business. She will use this loan to purchase furniture for the salon.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for her beauty salon

loans.name: Munavar

texts.ru: Мунавар проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 55 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сама она занимается растениеводством. Мунавар арендует небольшой участок земли, где выращивает овощи и бахчевые культуры. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 22 года. Кредит берет для закупа топлива.
texts.en: Munavar lives in the Shahrituz region. She is 55 years old, married, and has four children. Munavar's husband works on an orchard farm, while she cultivates crops. Munavar rents a small plot of land where she grows vegetables and melons. She has been engaged in this activity for 22 years. Munavar is taking this loan to purchase fuel.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for her farm

loans.name: Bakhtiniso

texts.ru: Бахтинисо проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 27 лет. Она не замужем. У нее имеется высшее экономическое образование. Она два года проработала по профессии. На сегодняшний день Бахтинисо занимается торговлей. Она открыла продуктовый магазин. В этой области она уже три года. Кредит берет для закупа продуктов и одежды с целью увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Bakhtiniso lives in the Shahrituz region. She is 27 years old and single. Bakhtiniso has a post-secondary degree in economics and has worked as an economist for two years. Presently, Bakhtiniso is engaged in trade and for the past three years has been running her own grocery store. She is taking this loan to purchase food products and clothing in order to expand the assortment of her merchandise.

loans.use: to stock up on food products and clothing

loans.name: Forukhjon

texts.ru: Форухжон житель района Шахритус. Ему 25 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Он более пяти лет занимается животноводством. Форухжон в основном разводит мелко - рогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа овец.
texts.en: Forukhjon lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 25 years old, married, and has a child. For over five years, Forukhjon has been raising livestock, primarily sheep and goats, for sale. He is taking this loan to purchase sheep.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Atchadé Gabriel

texts.fr: Atchadé Gabriel est âgé de 46 ans et vit au Bénin.Atchadé Gabriel est marié à une marchande du nom de Élisabeth. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Atchadé Gabriel vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Atchadé Gabriel exerce depuis une quinzaine d'année, le métier de soudure et de meunier. Grâce aux revenu que lui génère cette activité, Atchadé Gabriel contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Atchadé Gabriel sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement par Atchadé Gabriel ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Atchadé Gabriel is 46 years old and lives in Bénin. Atchadé Gabriel is married to a merchant named Élisabeth. The couple has five children, all in school. Atchadé Gabriel lives together with his wife and his children. The couple takes care of the diverse household responsibilities together.

To meet his needs and those of his children, for about 15 years Atchadé Gabriel has been practicing the professions of welder and miller. Thanks to the income that this business generates, Atchadé Gabriel contributes to his family's different expenses.

To satisfy the needs of his ever growing clientèle, Atchadé Gabriel is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the third time. The loans previously received by Atchadé Gabriel were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy a corn mill.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 30 year old married woman. She has a son who is 10 years old. She describes herself to be hardworking and self-motivated. She operates a retail store where she provides M-PESA services, a popular system of money transfers tied to mobile phones. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located in a conducive business environment, and her primary customers are local residents . She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add more cash to her M-PESA "float." Her business goal is to improve her business services over the next 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will run another M-PESA retail store.

loans.use: to add to the float of M-PESA retail store.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, a 35-year-old widow, has three children with ages ranging from seven to ten years. Describing herself as an aggressive woman, she works hard to support her family, operating a retail store where she sells clothes and provides M-pesa services. In business for three years, her store is located in a business area, and her primary customers are local residents. Her biggest challenge is insecurity within the area.

Gladys will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes and add capital to her M-pesa services. Her goal is to expand her business within five years, and she hopes to open another retail clothes store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and increase the float for her M-pesa services.

loans.name: Dania Group

texts.es:
La señora Jacinta es uno de los miembros del grupo Dania el cual esta integrado por 9 personas, cada una de ellas tiene una actividad económica la cual realizan con la intención de tener un ingreso de dinero extra y así poder contribuir con los gastos de su hogar, ellas son 9 personas emprendedoras, alegres y trabajadoras. Este grupo esta ubicado en una comunidad la cual se encuentra rodeada de huleras y su gente se dedica a la recolección de la resina de estos arboles  para posteriormente venderla.
Doña Jacinta tiene la edad de 47 años solo estudio la primaria y esta casada con el señor Apolinar, ella platica que siempre tuvo la inquietud de trabajar para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar pero el no quería que descuidara su casa, entonces le pidió su apoyo para abrir  una pequeña refresqueria en su casa, ella ya tiene 10 años con su negocio y cuando inicio solo vendía refrescos pero con el paso del tiempo a invertido mas en la compra de frituras, dulces y galletas ya que es lo que mas se vende con los niños de su comunidad. ella dijo "me gusta tener mi negocio porque trato con mis vecinos todos los días y mas con los niños que vienen a comprar sus dulces, yo quiero agradecer por el apoyo que nos dan ami y mi grupo con este crédito para que el negocio mejore". Ella invertirá este crédito en la compra de variedad refrescos, dulces, frituras y galletas para resurtir su negocio. Un crédito de fundación realidad no solo le ayudara a surtir su negocio sino que con sus ganancias podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida. Doña Jacinta espera en un futuro poder surtirse de abarrotes para que su negocio prospere.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son:
Mirna venta de productos del hogar
Gabriela venta de tortillas
Araceli venta de ropa interior
Gregoria venta de refrescos
Liliana venta de carne
Francisca venta de refrescos
Armando venta de refrescos
Piedad venta de ropa

loans.use: to stock her soft drinks and snacks business.

loans.name: Sharifjon

texts.ru: Шарифчон проживает в городе Худжанд. Ему 22 года. Он холост. Шарифчон четыре года как работает оператором в интернет-кафе. Он берет кредит для приобретения одного компьютера.
texts.en: Sharifjon lives in the city of Khujand. He is 22 years old and single. For the past four years, Sharifjon has been operating an internet cafe. He is taking this loan to purchase an additional computer.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his internet cafe

loans.name: Usar

texts.ru: Усар житель района Шахритус. Ему 26 лет. Она женат. У него один ребенок. Его жена работает преподавательницей в средней школе. Сам он занимается животноводством. В этой области он восемь лет. Кредит берет для закупа коз и овец.
texts.en: Usar lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 26 years old, married, and has a child. His wife works as a high school teacher, while Usar raises livestock. He has been doing this for the past eight years. Usar is taking this loan to purchase goats and sheep.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep

loans.name: Abumuslim

texts.ru: Абумуслим проживает в районе Файзабад. Ему 24 года. Он холост. У него имеется продуктовый магазин, где он работает продавцом. Торговлей Абумуслим занимается более семи лет. Он берет кредит для покупки продуктов.
texts.en: Abumuslim lives in the Fayzabad region. He is 24 years old and single. Abumuslim owns and operates a grocery store. He has been in sales for over seven years. Abumuslim is taking this loan to stock up on food products.

loans.use: to stock up on dairy products, meat, butter and sweets

loans.name: Hindéwé Firmin

texts.fr: Hindéwé Firmin est âgé de 29 ans et vit au Bénin. Hindéwé Firmin est marié à une marchande du nom de Pauline. Le couple a deux enfants à leur charge, dont un n'est pas leur propre enfant. Aucun des enfants n'est scolarisé. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Hindéwé Firmin a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire, puis a appris la coiffure. Hindéwé Firmin exerce ce métier depuis huit ans. En dehors de cette activité, Hindéwé Firmin fait également de la culture du maïs de façon secondaire ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Hindéwé Firmin désire acquérir d'autres matériels de coiffure afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour cette raison, Hindéwé Firmin sollicite pour une première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Hindéwé Firmin is 29 years old and lives in Bénin. Hindéwé Firmin is married to a merchant named Pauline. The couple has two dependent children, of whom one is not their own child. None of the children go to school. The children live together with their parents. The couple takes care of the different household responsibilities together. 

Hindéwé Firmin stopped school at the primary level, then learned hairdressing. Hindéwé Firmin has been practicing this profession for 8 years. In addition to this business, Hindéwé Firmin also grows corn on the side, which allows him to meet his needs and those of his children. 

Hindéwé Firmin wants to acquire other hairdressing materials in order to better meet the demands of his clientèle. For this reason, Hindéwé Firmin is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the first time.

loans.use: to buy revolving chairs, a mirror and hair products.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 26 years old. He sells clothes to earn a living. He has one employee and has been in the business for 4 years. In addition, he does farming. Previously, he used to sell polythene papers. He describes his business environment as busy with reliable customers.

Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, Wilson has learned how to save because he has been trained on financial management. He hopes to expand his business and buy a piece of land in the future. He needs a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en: Monicah is married and has three children. She sells clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for more than five years. Through Faulu Kenya, she has improved on her saving skills because she has been trained on financial management. She hopes to expand her business and buy a piece of land in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
LA SRA. ESTHER ES UN EJEMPLO A SEGUIR YA QUE ES UNA MUJER DEDICADA, RESPONSABLE Y EMPRENDEDORA ELLA SE DEDICA A CUIDAR  DE UNA PERSONA ENFERMA Y ESO HABLA MUY BIEN DE ELLA PORQUE NO MUCHA GENTE TIENE LA PACIENCIA O EL CORAZON SUFICUIENTE PARA AYUDAR A ALGUIEN DE ESA MANERA, SU HIJO TRABAJA EN UNA MAQUILADORA DE LA LOCALIDAD Y ESTA EN PROCESO DE LA COMPRA DEL HOGAR DONDE RECIDEN ACTIALMENTE.
EL CREDITO LO OCUPARA PARA LA REMODELACION DE UNO DE LOS CUARTOS DE SU DOMICILIO.
texts.en: Esther is truly an example to follow as she is a committed, responsible and enterprising woman.  She works taking care of a person who is sick and this speaks volumes about her because there aren't many people who have enough patience or heart to help somebody in this way.  Esther's son works in a cross-border assembly plant in the town and is in the process of buying the house where they are currently living.  Esther will use this loan to remodel one of the rooms in her home.

loans.use: to remodel a room

loans.name: Avzalbek

texts.ru: Авзалбек житель города Вахдат. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Авзалбек четыре года как работает таксистом. Он берет кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля с целью предоставления безопасной услуги.
texts.en: Avzalbek lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 26 years old, married, and has two children. Avzalbek has been working as a taxi driver for the past four years. He is taking this loan to repair his vehicle in order to provide a safe service to his clients.

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: Doña María de 69 años de edad es originaria de León, comerciante se dedica al negocio de pulpería, su nivel académico es hasta sexto grado de primaria, casada, madre de 2 hijos mayores de edad, viven independientes. Inicio su negocio a los 47  años de edad  por iniciativa propia pues quería ser alguien independiente, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de sus hijos y del esposo, ella se siente satisfecha donde se encuentra pues cuenta con clientes fijos además es un negocio rentable. Cuenta con otros ingresos provenientes de sus hijos que le ayudan con los gastos del hogar, su expectativa es diversificarse en productos para el negocio es por ese motivo que requiere del préstamo para comprar  pan, leche, huevo, aceite, arroz, jugos, etc. Ella estima el crédito será de ayuda ya que podrá surtir su pulpería con nuevos productos, sus planes futuros es mantener su negocio activo para poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Dona Maria, 69, is from Leon.  She operates a corner grocery.  She has a sixth-grade education, is married and has 2 grown children, both living away from their mother.  She started her business when she was 47 years old because she wanted her own income.  Her husband and children helped her start it.  She says that she is pleased with her progress because the business is profitable and she has a regular set of customers.  She can count, too, on her children for extra support.  She is applying for a loan because she wants to expand the range of products she sells.  She will use the loan to buy the merchandise she needs--bread, milk, eggs, cooking oil, rice, juices, etc.--to stock her store.  The investment will allow her to add products that her customers want to buy.  For the future, she wants to continue the business and do what she can to help her family get ahead.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Bibijamila

texts.ru: Бибичамила жительница города Вахдат. Ей 38 лет. Она разведена. У нее трое детей. Бибичамила арендует торговую точку на рынке, где занимается торговлей обуви. Этим видом деятельности она занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для покупки сезонной обуви.
texts.en: Bibijamila lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 38 years old, divorced, and has three children. Bibijamila rents a retail location at a market where she sells shoes. She has been running this business for the past five years. Bibijamila is taking this loan to purchase seasonal footwear.

loans.use: to purchase women's and children's summer shoes

loans.name: Salamatou

texts.fr: Salamatou est une jeune femme de 34 ans, mariée , mère de 03 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 5 et 11 ans, tous vont déjà à l'école.elle est une ancienne commerçante qui gère depuis 10 ans un petit centre d'appel téléphonique( call box)et une petite échoppe dans un quartier de la capitale.Du fait de la petitesse des bénéfices générés par ses activités, de l'augmentation considérable de sa clientèle et de la constante rupture de stock , elle voudrait ce crédit afin de pouvoir régulièrement s'approvisionner en crédit de communication auprès des opérateurs téléphoniques ce qui augmentera considérablement son bénéfice. Bénéfice qui lui permettra de réinvestir dans son échoppe afin de l'agrandir et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Salamatou is a young 34 year old woman, married, and mother to 3 children whose age varies from 5 to 11 years. All the children already go to school. She is an experienced shopkeeper who has been managing a small center for phone calls (call box) and a small stall in a neighborhood of the capital for 10 years. 

Due to the smallness of the profits generated by these businesses, the considerable increase in her clientèle and the constant state of being out of stock, she would like this loan in order to be able to regularly stock in communication credits with the telephone operators which would considerably increase her profits. These profits would allow her to reinvest in her stall in order to expand it and to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: EL SEÑOR SANTIAGO VIVE CON SU ESPOSA ACTUALMENTE, SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ARTICULOS DE SEGUNDA MANO Y APARTE TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES QUE NO TIENE SURTIDA EN UN 100% PERO A LA LARGA ESPERA ABRIRLA, EL PROYECTO QUE TIENE EN MENTE SANTIAGO ES ABRIR UNA TORTILLERIA YA TIENE LA MAQUINARIA SOLAMENTE LE FALTA LA MATERIA PRIMA Y ESO ES EN LO QUE OCUPARA SU CREDITO, SU ESPOSA ES SU UNICA DEPENDIENTE ECONOMICA Y ES SU APOYO PARA TODOS LOS DIAS SEGUIR ADELANTE CON LO QUE SE PROPONEN.
texts.en: Santiago lives with his wife.  He has a business selling second-hand goods and also a grocery store.  The grocery store is not 100% stocked but, in the long term, he hopes to open it.  The project that Santiago currently has in mind is to open a tortilla bakery.  He has the machinery and is only lacking raw materials.  This is what he will spend his loan money on.  Santiago's wife is his only dependent and she provides him with support every day in everything they do.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa est une jeune dame de 34 ans, mariée et mère de famille qui fait du commerce depuis 2 ans. Elle s’active dans la vente de chaussures et de vêtements. Elle vient solliciter pour la 1ère fois, un crédit de 100000FCFA pour acheter 20 paires de chaussures à 3000f la paire et des habits pour une valeur de 40000Fcfa.
Awa commence sa journée à 9h et la termine à 15h. Avec le crédit, elle réussi à épargner afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille. 
Awa appui son mari dans les charges familiales. Elle a comme projet futur d’acquérir une maison.
texts.en:
Awa is a young 34 year old woman, married and mother who has been trading for 2 years. She is active in the sale of shoes and clothing. 

She is coming to request for the first time, a loan of 100,000 FCFA to buy 20 pairs of shoes at 3,000 f the pair and outfits valued at 40,000 FCFA. 

Awa begins her day at 9am and finishes at 3pm. With the loan, she will succeed in saving in order to be able to improve the nutritional conditions of her family. Awa supports her husband with the family responsibilities. She has as a future project to purchase a house.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothing to resell.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Don Faustino tiene 61 años de edad, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos.  Él se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas desde hace más de 15 años. Antes solo se dedicaba a la siembra de maíz, pero luego recibió una capacitación que le ayudo a conocer sobre las hortalizas, desde entonces empezó trabajando bien en esa área. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundacion Campo, es para comprar plantas de tomate, ya que quiere trabajar con tomate la temporada que viene y para comprar insumos agrícolas para 7,000 metros cuadrados de terreno que ya esta lista. Con el financiamiento dispondrá de dinero para realizar sus actividades, que son el sustento de su familia. Pues obtendrá el maíz para su consumo y para la venta, para que sus ingresos sean mayores y también obtendrá ingresos de la venta de tomate. 

Don Faustino piensa en brindarles el estudio a sus nietos, ya que su deseo es verlos como todos unos profesionales. Además tiene la intención de comprar más tierra para continuar trabajando con las hortalizas.
texts.en:
Don Faustino, 61, is married and has four children.  For the past 15 years, he has made his living growing fruits and vegetables.  Before that, he only grew maize.  He added garden crops after taking a training course and now he grows fruits and vegetables too.

Don Faustino is applying to Fundacion Campo for a loan that he will use to buy tomato plants--a crop he's decided to plant for the coming season--and other farming supplies for his 7,000 square-meter farm.  The loan will allow him to invest in the tomato plants and other supplies that he needs for his business, a business that is the main source of income for his family.  Though he will grow maize for his family and to sell, growing and selling tomatoes is more profitable.

Don Faustino wants to help with his grandchildren's schooling because he hopes that they will study toward paid careers.  He tells us, too, that he would like to buy more land for growing garden crops.

loans.use: to buy tomato plants and other supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 22 years old, married and with one child. She operates a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in the business for ten years. Previously she used to operate a salon. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to operate her business because she has been trained in business management. She dreams of expanding her business and operating a wholesale business in the future. She needs a loan of 30,000 KES to buy onions, tomatoes, fruits and pineapples.

loans.use: To buy onions, tomatoes, fruits and pineapples.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is 37 years old and married. She does tailoring to earn a living. She has been in the business for fifteen years. She also sells fish to generate extra income. She had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her to grow her business. She has also learned how to manage her business because she has been trained in business management skills. She hopes to expand her business and become successful in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy fabric for making clothes.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Samalie

texts.en:
Samalie is 35 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 11 years, Samalie has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Samalie has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale, and will help Samalie to generate greater profits and pay for his medical expenses. Samalie hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business into a wholesale shop. 

Samalie is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Samalie who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Rakhat

texts.ru: Рахат 30 лет, вдова, воспитывает 2 детей - 6 и 4 лет. В 2008 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Рахат начала свой бизнес в торговле головными уборами со стартовой суммой в 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Рахат  сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  около 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Рахат  обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на закуп товаров для детей.  Доходы от кредита Рахат  планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса, и в этом году подготовить дочку в первый класс.
texts.en:
Rakhat is 30 years old, widowed, and is raising 2 children who are 6 and 4 years of age. In 2008, while looking for a source of income for her family, Rakhat started her own business in hat sales with an initial investment of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her persistence and hard work, she was able to expand her business so that it now earns roughly 10,000 som (KGS) per month.

Currently, the assortment of merchandise in Rakhat's shop is not very wide, and for this reason she has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase more items for children. Rakhat plans to invest her profits from this loan into further development of her business, and also to get her daughter ready to enter first grade this year.

loans.use: to expand the assortment of children's hats in her shop

loans.name: Jappo Amsa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit JAPPO AMSA  regroupe depuis plusieurs années 5 femmes  qui font du petit commerce : produits alimentaires et cosmétiques. Elles  ont comme responsable : madame Adama  âgée de 44 ans que l'on peut reconnaitre à droite de la photo( c'est elle la plus élancée de toute). Elle fait du commerce de produits cosmétiques depuis 2 ans et possède une cantine dans le marché. Indépendamment  de la place, elle vend dans le voisinage. Grace au crédit, elle réussi à épargner afin d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille.
Elle a comme projet futur de rassembler les femmes de son quartier en GIE
texts.en: The group JAPPO AMSA has united for several years 5 women who have small shops: food products and cosmetics. The person responsible for the group is: madam Adama who is 44 years old and who we can recognize on the right of the photo (she is the most slender of all). She has been selling cosmetic products for 2 years and has a canteen at the market. Independently from this place, she sells in the neighborhood. Thanks to the loan, she will succeed in saving in order to improve the nutritional conditions of her family. She has as a future project to gather the women of her neighborhood into an economic interest group.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products to resell.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 31 years old and is married with three children. He runs a transport business in a conducive environment with encouraging customers. He has been in the business for 3 years.

Through Faulu Kenya, Fredrick has been able to acquire fast loans that have enabled him grow his business. He dreams of becoming an entrepreneur in a real estate business and providing professional transport services to corporate companies. He needs a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy tires and shock absorbers.

loans.use: to buy tires and shock absorbers.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.en:
Alenjandrina is 39 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in the rural area of Lambeyeque, Northern Peru, in a community of around 100 families who have basic water and electricity services. She specializes in the raising and selling of poultry and of dairy products from her cow. She has been doing this activity for the past 12 years, having inherited the talent and learned the tasks form her parents. 

She has identified an opportunity to buy a cow at a discount, as well as poultry and animal feed, and is now getting a loan of 2,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. She feels that even though competition in this market is strong there is also a big market where she can commercialize her goods.

loans.use: To buy poultry, animal feed and a cow, which is offered at a discount.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a Kiva borrower. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 13 years. She describes herself as hardworking. She operates a retail business where she sells fabric. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located near a busy town and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the stiff competition within the area. She will use the Kes 75,000 loan to buy fabric. Her business goal is to be a supplier of materials within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have her own permanent business premises.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomatoes.

loans.name: Ricardo Arnulfo

texts.es:
EL SR. RICARDO A. UN HOMBRE TRABAJADOR, SIEMPRE ESTA AL PENDIENTE DE LO QUE SU FAMILIA NECESITE, HACE POCO ACABA DE NACER SU HIJO, JUNTO CON SU ESPOSA LE DESEAN HACER MEJORAS A SU HOGAR, RICARDO ESTA PROXIMO A CONSTRUIR UN CUARTO EN LA PARTE TRASERA DE SU DOMICILIO Y ASI POCO A POCO EL IRA EXPANDIENDO SU DOMICILIO.
RICARDO ES CASADO Y TRABAJA EN UNA GASERA DE LA LOCALIDAD ASI SOLVENTA LOS GASTOS DIARIOS DE SU FAMILIA YA QUE NO SOLO A EL SI NO A MUCHAS PERSONAS SOLO COMPLETAN PARA LOS GASTOS DIARIOS Y HAY MUCHOS QUE NI PARA LOS GASTOS DIARIOS LES ALCANZA ES POR ESO QUE REQUIERE EL CREDITO PARA COMENZAR SU PROYECTO.
LO UNICO COMO A MUCHAS PERSONAS LE FALTA “EL CAPITAL” EL DINERO PARA REALIZAR SU PROYECTO ES POR ESO QUE ACUDIO A NOSOTROS Y VE EN NOSOTROS LA OPORTUNIDAD DE REALIZAR SU PROYECTO Y TENER ALGO MAS QUE OFRECERLE A SU FAMILIA Y A SU HIJO RECIEN NACIDO.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a hardworking man. He is always ready to take care of whatever needs his family might have. Recently, his son was born; together with his wife, he wants to make improvements to his home. Ricardo is close to building a bedroom on the back of his house; in that way he will continue expanding his house little by little.

Ricardo is married and works in a local gas station. That's how he covers the daily expenses of his family. Given that many people—not just Ricardo—are only able to cover their daily expenses and many can't even afford that, Ricardo needs a loan to start his project.

The only thing Ricardo, like many people, is lacking is capital—the money to make his project happen. That's why he has turned to us [Credituyo] and sees in us the opportunity to do his project and to have something more to offer to his family and his newborn son.

loans.use: to build a bedroom on the back of his house.

loans.name: Santos

texts.en: Santos is a 46-year-old man, living in the rural area of Tambogrande in Northern Peru. He is not married and has no children, so he dedicates his life and energy to his small lemon and avocado crops, as well as raising sheep. As the output of agricultural production is very weather dependent, fertilizers can often help to minimize the randomness of the crop output. As a result, Santos is looking to take a loan of 500 soles to buy fertilizers for his lemon crop, which he feels will allow him to consolidate his business and improve his prospects of bettering his living standards. In the rural areas of Northern Peru, formal channels of access to capital can sometimes be harder to find, and so Edpyme Alternativa and Kiva's task is particularly important.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and compost for his lemon crop.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 35 years old and this is his second loan with Edpyme Alternativa and Kiva. He is married and he lives with his wife and their two children in a small town in Northern Peru, which is a rural area primarily populated by farmers of small animals.

For five years Jose has raised ducks, chickens, turkeys and other animals in the yard behind his home.  He also works as a stevedore for a local private company, where he earns a stable salary.  Jose’s wife is a seamstress.  She sews for local families and also produces clothing for sale in the markets.

This time, Jose's requested loan will be used to purchase additional animals in order to expand the family's livestock business.  They hope to be able to increase their income and assets so as to better provide for the education of their children.  Jose is dedicated to the success of his children and works hard every day to ensure that their future is bright.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals and feed.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 60 years old and lives in Libertad, Bajo, Sinacaban. She is married and has 5 children. Elsa has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 20 years.

She requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. She has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.  In the future, Elsa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 25 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo.  Él se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenia 15 años de edad, siempre se ha dedicado ha esta actividad y este año espera cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de terreno. Para comprar los insumos él se levanta muy temprano para abordar un carro que se tarda cinco minutos en llegar. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundacion Campo, es para comprar insumos agrícolas, ya que quiere abonar lo que tiene cultivado. Así, Víctor tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar sus cultivos para que tengan un buen desarrollo. Igualmente mejorara los ingresos familiares y desea construir su propia casa; ya la empezó porque su papá le dio una parcela de terreno. Además, desea que su hija estudie y sea una buena persona.
texts.en:
Víctor, 25, is married and has one child.  He has worked on farms since he was 15 years old and farming is still his main source of income.  This year, he will farm 7,000 square meters of land.  To buy supplies, he has to get up very early to catch a ride in a minibus that only stops here for five minutes.

Victor is applying for a Fundacion Campo loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs to prepare his land for his next crop.  The investment will allow him to buy what he needs to ensure a good yield.  He wants to increase his income so that he can build a house for his family.  He's already started the house on land that he got from his father.  He also wants to send his daughter to school and raise her to be a good person.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his next crop.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is 44 years old and lives in Carangan, Ozamiz City. She is single and has no children. She has a piggery business and earns approximately PHP 30,000 each month doing this type of business. 

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase feeds for her pigs.  She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Jeanette hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Eufracia

texts.en:
Eufracia is married and has six children. She is 65 years old and lives in Masabud, Clarin.

Eufracia is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Eufracia has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase additional inorganic and commercial fertilizers.

Eufracia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional inorganic and commercial fertilizers.

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is married with 2 children. She is 37 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Lucille is a government employee and also has a farm to earn a living. She has been doing this farming for 3 years.  

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to be used in purchasing rubber tree seedlings for a new farming activity. She became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Lucille hopes to expand her farming activities.

loans.use: To purchase rubber tree seedlings.

loans.name: Dalla

She requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. She has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, Dalla hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

She requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. She has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.  In the future, Marlyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Conchita

Conchita is 48 years old and lives in Segatic Diot, Clarin. She is married and has 5 children. Conchita has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 8 years. 

She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. She has been a member of PMPC for a month.  In the future, Conchita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 29 years old and lives in Locsoon,Tudela. She is married and has two children.

Mercy has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for two years. Mercy requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. 

Mercy has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is married and has two children. He is 36 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin.

Christopher is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. He has been doing this for two years. Christopher has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional piglets to sell.

Christopher has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, he hopes to send his children to school.
